loans.use: to buy more clothes and blankets to sell.

loans.name: Lasha

texts.en:
From the village of Bitsmendi, Lasha is 31 years old and has a pensioner father, a brother and a sister-in-law. Owning one pig and several chickens, but with no source of income apart from the pension, the family has very poor living conditions. Sadly, due to a lack of economic resources, Lasha was unable to study for a professional career, so he can't find a stable job that would address the family's financial difficulties.

Lasha lacks access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as they all require a stable income and business experience.  The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Lasha to qualify for a loan of 1400 GEL to start dairy farming. He will purchase a milking cow and start producing dairy products, cheese and yogurt to sell locally.
. 
After the agribusiness start-up, the family will have a stable income that will enable them to meet everyday costs as well as expand the business in the future.  With support from the Start Up program, Lasha will get an opportunity to be involved in his own business and tackle his financial difficulties.

loans.use: To start dairy farming

loans.name: Qorichuspa Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QORICHUSPA”; Este banco se ubicado en Ccoto Huincho perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Hipolita,la socia continua con su negocio de venta de comida en uno de los mercados de la zona, la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, a la vez la socia continua dedicándose a la venta de artesanía, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, aceite, menestras entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de cerámicas, agricultura,  tienda de abarrotes, docentes.
texts.en: The members belong to the Qorichuspa Communal Bank, which is located in Ccoto Huincho in Urubamba province, Cusco department.  The member, Hipolita, continues with her business of selling food in the area markets and, at the same time, she sells handicrafts, which is how she supports her family.  She is grateful to those who are part of this dream through this means, and promises to make her payments on time.  She is requesting the loan to purchase rice, oil, vegetable stew, and other items.  The other members are engaged in selling ceramics, farming, grocery store ownership, and teaching.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, vegetable stew, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy catering equipment and food items

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 47 years old and supports three children. He has been repairing electronics and selling electrical appliances for the the last 13 years. The business earns him 13,000 KES per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to purchase electrical appliances to sell. The number of clients, as well as the demand for appliances, have increased in the region.

He plans to use the profit to repay the loan and expand his business. His hope is to be financially stable and to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase electrical appliances

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 57 years old. She is married with two children.

Merlita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Merlita has borrowed and paid back 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Merlita aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sobirakhon

texts.ru: Собирахон одна из славных районов под названием Бохтар. Ей 31 год. Она живет вместе с детьми, а муж уехал на заработки в Российскую Федерацию. Собирахон беспокоится о питании семьи и хочет, чтобы питались здоровой пищей. Собирахон намерена купить одну корову и обеспечить детей свежим молоком и молочными продуктами. Собирахон уверена что справится с уходом за коровой. Собирахон дома не сидит без дела и принимает заказы на шитье. За счет своих услуг она будет погашать кредит. Поддержите Собирахон.
texts.en: Sobirakhon is from a famous district in Tajikstan called Bohtar.  She is 31 years old and she lives with her children, since her husband is currently working in the Russian Federation.  Sobirakhon takes great care to provide good nutrition to her family and she wants her children to eat healthy foods.  She intends to buy one cow in order to provide fresh milk and dairy products to her children.  She is confident that she will be able to take good care of the cow.  Sobirakhon doesn't stay idle at home, but works as an independent seamstress.  Thanks to her activity, she will be able to repay her loan.  Please support her.

loans.use: to buy one cow in order to provide milk for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more hair-cutting machines.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es hombre trabajador  y muy honesto que gracias a sus esfuerzos de día con día ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, él ahora se encuentra muy satisfecho  por el apoyo que obtuvo pues él cuenta que gracias al crédito pudo comprar su terreno para su cultivo de maxán y ahora su cultivo ha incrementado pero también sus ingresos han mejorado, Manuel viendo las necesidades de su familia ahora ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un nuevo préstamo para seguir mejorando su cultivo el uso respectivo que le dará al crédito es la compra de dos cuerdas de terreno cultivable.
Manuel  tiene las esperanzas de contar nuevamente con su apoyo para seguir prosperando y construir una casa de block.
texts.en:
Manuel is a hard-working and very honest man.  Thanks to his day to day efforts, he has managed to get his family ahead.  He is very pleased with the support that he got.  He says that thanks to the loan, he was able to buy his land to grow ‘maxán' [calathea].  Now his crop has increased, and his earnings have also improved.

Seeing his family’s needs, Manual has now made the decision to request a new loan in order to continue improving his crop.  He will use the loan to buy two acres of arable land.

Manuel hopes to once again have your support in order to continue to prosper and to build a house from cement blocks.

loans.use: to buy two acres of arable land.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 25-year-old married mother of one, living in Mbire District, Zimbabwe. She rents a shop where she sells groceries, such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, mealie-meal, sugar beans, matemba (sardines), biscuits, sweets, and stationery. 

As an entrepreneur, Grace actively inspires young women in her community to be economically empowered. The business has seen significant growth since she received her first loan from Kiva. Grace would like to use this Kiva loan to expand her business by increasing the items she has to sell in her store. She hopes to grow the business and increase its profitability.

loans.use: To expand her business by increasing the items she has to sell in her store.

loans.name: Señor De La Agonia De Taray Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LA AGONIA DE TARAY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito Taray, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Liberata ella es conviviente y tiene 46 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de crianza de cuyes, la socia los cuyes los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes mercados, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y alimentos para los cuyes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “SEÑOR DE LA AGONIA DE TARAY” communal bank.  The bank is located in the Taray district, Calca province, Cusco department.

Liberata, age 46, is in a common-law marriage and has four children.  She works in her business of raising guinea pigs.  She fattens the guinea pigs and makes them grow.  Then she sells them at the different markets.  She has been in this business for several years, and it is going very well for her.  She dreams of having a place where she could sell the guinea pigs.

Liberata is requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs and feed for the guinea pigs.

The other members have businesses selling sweets, selling clothes, a grocery store, and a book store.

The member is grateful to those who are part of this dream through these means.  She pledges to make her scheduled payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and feed for the guinea pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pullovers, coats, blouses etc.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: 45 летная Мавчуда из не большого района Бохтар замужем и имеет детей. Ее муж находится заграницей на заработках, так как не нашел подходящую работу на Родине. Дочка работает преподавателем в средней школе. Мавчуда можно сказать что всю жизнь работает на земле, занимается растениеводством. С юных лет и до по сей день она проводит свое время работая на поле. Мавчуда решила купить дома кондиционер, так как в Бохтаре летом становится очень жарко и находится дома и на улице в такой жаре очень трудно. Она собрала денег, но на хороший кондиционер ее средств не хватит и она обратилась к Вам за финансовой поддержкой.
texts.en: Mavjuda is a 45-year-old mother who comes from the small district of Bohtar.  Her husband is currently working abroad because he was not able to find a suitable job in his home country.  Mavjuda's daughter works as a teacher in a secondary school.  Mavjuda herself has been working the land her whole life, farming and growing crops since she was very young.  She has now decided to buy an air conditioning unit for her house because the summers in Bohtar are very hot and high temperatures make life difficult both outside and inside.  Mavjuda has already saved some money but she doesn't have the necessary resources to purchase a good air conditioning unit.  For this reason, she is relying on you for financial support.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioning unit.

loans.name: Carlos Alexander

texts.es:
CARLOS ALEXANDER TIENE 30 AÑOS DE EDAD, SOLTERO, VIVE CON SUS PADRES, EN CASA PROPIA, EN UNA COMUNIDAD PEQUEÑA EN LA ZONA RURAL DEL ANEXO POPAN BAJO DEL DISTRITO DE CAYALTI, PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO, REGION LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DE PERÚ,

CARLOS SE DEDICA A LA ACTIVIDAD DE AGRICULTURA (SIEMBRA DE CAÑA DE AZUCAR) Y LABORES AGRICOLAS COMO JORNALERO EN DIFERENTES CAMPOS DE LA ZONA, DESDE HACE MAS DE 7 AÑOS Y GOZA DE BUENAS REFERENCIAS PERSONALES Y LABORALES DE PARTE DE SUS VECINOS. SOLICITA PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE FERTILIZANTES PARA SU CULTIVO DE CAÑA DE AZÚCAR, DE ESTA MANERA OBTENER UN MEJOR RENDIMIENTO EN LA COSECHA DE SU CULTIVO, OBTENER MÁS INGRESOS Y PODER MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Carlos Alexander, 30, is single and lives at his parents' in a small rural village of the Anexo Popan Bajo area, in the district of Cayaltí, Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.
He is a sugar cane farmer who also works as a day labourer in various farms in the area.
He has been working in this field for over seven years and his neighbours consider him an honest person and a reliable worker.
He asks for a loan to buy fertiliser for his sugar cane field, in order to increase productivity and profit from a more bountiful harvest. He hopes to increase his income and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser for his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk delivery with his motorcycle in the area for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more farm cereals to sell in the market for more income gain.

loans.name: Anasita

texts.en:
Anasita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 45 years old and has one child still in school.

Anasita has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy cloth, thread, needles and other materials for her business. She has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread, needles and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a seafoods culture business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more bamboo, binders and other equipment for her seafoods culturing business. Josephine also industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, like raising livestock.

Josephine dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo, binders and other equipment for her seafood culture business.

loans.name: Gerlita

texts.en:
Gerlita is 45 years old and married with eight children. She runs an agricultural business, raising poultry in the Philippines. Gerlita is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to purchase additional chickens, sacks of feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her chickens.

Gerlita has been in this business for 2 years and also earns additional income from fishing. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional chickens, sacks of feed, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her chickens.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 58 years old and a single woman. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Teresita has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts for her shop.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 46 años de edad, divorciada, tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad e independientes, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, constante, paciente, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘mutualista’ un área central que aglomera a oficinas públicas y privadas, de clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Maria es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello castaño largo lo usa amarrado por detrás, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza en compañía de sus hijos menores que son independientes, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cerámica que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, como; pantalones, poleras, camisas, camisetas, jeans, etc., labor que realiza de forma ambulante durante todos los días de la semana, “mi mercadería de segunda mano es accesible a todo público y se vende continuamente, cueto con clientes constantes y mi negocio mejora…” comenta. la ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son continuas, la desventaja es la falta de capital para abastecer el negocio. Su sueño es alquilar un ambiente para abrir una tienda de ropa. Ella desea aumentar sus ventas realizando la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para satisfacer la demanda de temporada. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para abastecer su negocio y con los beneficios alquilar una tienda.
texts.en:
Maria, 46, is divorced, has a three children (all adults and living their life), and sells second-hand clothing.
She is a good mother and a dynamic entrepreneur. Patient and faithful, she is always of a sunny disposition. She is also responsible and very hard-working.
She sells her wares in a common area, in the centre, where there are many public and private offices.
The weather is sub-tropical and warm, with temperatures of between 21 and 35 degrees Celsius during the day.
Maria has brown skin, brown eyes, long brown hair which she wears in a ponytail, a short stature, and is of slight build.
Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks at home. She learned Spanish by hearing people speak it around her and by speaking with her customers.
She lives with her children, who are independent. They live in a rented room made of bricks and cement with a thatched roof and tiled floor. It has drinking water and electricity, and is connected to the sewer system.
She sells second-hand clothing such as trousers, T-shirts, shirts, tops, jeans, etc.
Maria peddles her wares door-to-door every day of the week. She says that her merchandise, being second-hand, is accessible to all and sells very well. She has many regular customers and her business is steadily improving.
Her business's main advantage is that sales are constant. The main challenge is the lack of capital to replenish the stock.
Maria's dream is to rent a locale to open a proper shop.
She wants to buy second-hand clothing wholesale in order to meet seasonal demand and increase her sales.
Maria has been in business for one year, and this is her first loan with the field partner.
She asks for a loan to buy more second-hand clothes wholesale to replenish her stock. With the profits, she plans to rent a shop.

loans.use: to buy secon-hand clothing wholesale and open a shop.

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en: Eyad is a 38-year-old married man from the city of Dier Al-Balah. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all of the family's needs. Eyad took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family's house. By taking this loan, Eyad will be able to decrease the electricity expenses. Eyad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a bull to slaughter for meat so as to meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Nila

texts.es:
Doña Nila trabaja distribuyendo alimentos en grano en las diferentes tiendas de su localidad, su vehículo es la herramienta principal para realizar este trabajo, necesita un préstamo de $500 para comprar varios repuestos y repararlo 
y seguir trabajando ya que es la única fuente de ingreso en su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Nila works as a grain distributor to the different stores in her locality. Her vehicle is the principal tool facilitating this work. 

Nila needs a loan of $500 dollars to purchase various replacement parts and make the repairs so that she can continuing working, since this is her family's only source of income.

loans.use: to buy parts for her work vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks of cooking oil and sugar for selling to clients to meet their demands and to meet the demands of her family.

loans.name: Joedeline

texts.en:
Joedeline works hard to support her family. She is single with one child and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Joedeline has requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. She has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products, bags and shoes to improve his shop.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Josephine is 50 years old and has one child in school.

Josephine has a coconut wine business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Zulayho

texts.ru: На фотографии напечатлена мастер швея Зулайхо. Он из района Рудаки. Жители района Рудаки тоже талантливые, умные, честные, активные и пунктуальные. Зулайхо 30 летняя женщина. Она замужем и мать пятерых детей. У нее прекрасные и замечательные дети. Муж занимается таксистом, и зарабатывает перевозом людей. Сама Зулайхо у себя дома предоставляет услуги швеи.  Она зарабатывает и помогает мужу обеспечить детей. У Зулайхо есть одна швейная машинка,  которая привезет ей прибыль. Для нее машинка является основной источником дохода. Зулайхо решила купить новую швейную машинку, чтобы продвигать бизнес и сохранит источник дохода. Потому что ее нынешняя машинка устарела и не выполняет свои функции достаточно хорошо. Зулайхо с большими надеждами обратилась к Вам за кредитом. Вы можете поддержать Зулайхо сейчас!
texts.en:
Zulayho, shown here in the photo, is a skilled 30-year-old seamstress from the Rudaki district of Tajikistan.  The residents of this district are known for their skills, intelligence, honesty, dynamism and punctuality.  Zulayho is married and the mother of five beautiful and amazing children.  Her husband works as a taxi driver, taking people from place to place.  Zulayho herself works as a seamstress, from home.  She makes her own money and helps her husband provide for the children.  

Zulayho currently has one sewing machine which happens to be her main source of income.  Since her machine is getting old and no longer fulfills all its functions, she has decided to buy a new one to develop her business and keep her source of income.  She is placing all her hopes on this loan and on your support.  Please help her!

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and to keep her source of income.

loans.name: L'amour Divin 2.1 Group

texts.en:
Lurdrich is a member of the community bank group L’Amour Divin 2.1 in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. Helping to lead a group of eleven other micro-entrepreneurs, Lurdrich runs a small electronics shop as an IT specialist. With his first loan with HOPE Congo, Lurdrich will buy a photocopier and reams of paper for his shop. 

In his daily activities Lurdrich faces the challenges of poor infrastructure and power cuts, which affect his business. In order to overcome these challenges, he has purchased a generator so that he can stay open for business when the power is out. 

In the future, Lurdrich would love to expand his house further and to purchase more sophisticated IT equipment. With increased profits, he hopes that one day he can finance his degree in computer engineering.

loans.use: to purchase a photocopier and paper for his shop.

loans.name: Al Hikma Group

texts.en:
Nabila is the featured borrower for Al Hikma Group. She got together with her other group members to take out this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and income at the same time.

Nabila is a 52-year-old Syrian divorced mother of two children. Almost a year ago, she started selling clothes from her house to cover her children's expenses and needs, for she is their only breadwinner. She is working hard and trying desperately to develop her business, so today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with a new collection of summer clothes to satisfy her customers' special requests in the upcoming Fitr Feast (end of Holy month Ramadan). Nabila is the first lady on the right. 

With respect to the other group members, Fadia is the lady sitting in the middle, and Zeina is the first lady on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of summer clothes for the Fitr Feast

loans.name: Abdel Mohsen

texts.en:
Abdel Mohsen is a 38-year-old married man from the city of Rafah. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all of the family's needs.

Abdel took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family's house. By taking this loan, Abdel  will be able to decrease the electricity expenses. 

Abdel appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es: Norma de 43 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus seis hijos de 24, 23, 21,  13, 5 y 6  años de edad que con mucho sacrificio los ha  sacando adelante en sus estudios. Norma se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad desde hace 7 años en su casa de habitación y gracias a su amabilidad y carisma día a día a logrado que las personas prefieran sus productos. Norma debido a la demanda de nuevos y variados productos que los clientes le exigen a diario a decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: verduras, granos básicos y otros productos de consumo diario que le permitan ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Norma is 43 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and six children, who are 24, 23, 21, 13, 5, and 6 years old. Norma has made many sacrifices to keep them in school. For 7 years she has made a living selling everyday necessities. She conducts the sales out of her home, and thanks to her courtesy and charisma more people are choosing her products every day.

In response to demand for new and varied products that customers require daily, Norma has decided to request a loan from FUSAI to buy vegetables, staple grains, and other daily food items, enabling her to offer better variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, staple grains, and other daily food items, enabling her to offer better variety to her customers.

loans.name: Angham

texts.en: Angham is 21 years old, and she lives with her parents and three siblings in a sector of Jordan called Irbid. She is a university student majoring in nursing, and she is in her third year. Angham is planning to find a better job after graduation and to earn a better income in order to support her family. However, because of the financial crisis her family has been facing, she wasn't able to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan. She needs your support to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Miriam Veronica

texts.es:
Miriam es una joven de 19 años, nació en La Paz – Bolivia y vive con sus padres y sus dos hermanos. Comenta que a largo de su vida tuvo extremas dificultades de salud, acompañadas por falta de recursos económicos, es así que desde sus once años, trabaja ayudando en la fabricación y venta de edredones, lo que le ha permitido encontrar su vocación y elección por la carrera de Ingeniería Comercial; para continuar sus estudios está solicitando un crédito educativo.
Miriam piensa que cada día es un regalo y una oportunidad para alcanzar sus metas, su sueño, es tener su propia empresa y así poder retribuir el esfuerzo, la dedicación y el apoyo que ha tenido siempre de sus padres y hermanos ya que considera que con los ingresos de su empresa les brindará una mejor calidad de vida y podrá generar fuentes de trabajo a aquellos jóvenes que quieran superarse en la vida y no cuenten con recursos económicos. Agradece a las personas que hacen posible que estudie y logre alcanzar su sueño de superación.
texts.en:
Miriam, a young 19 year old woman, was born in La Paz, Bolivia, and lives with her parents and two siblings.  She says that throughout her life she has had very serious health problems, accompanied by lack of financial resources, and this has been so since she was 11 years old.  In her job, she helps make and sell comforters, which has enabled her to find her vocation and choose a career in Commercial Engineering.  She is requesting an education loan to continue her studies.

Miriam believes that each day is a gift and an opportunity to achieve her goals.  Her dream is to have her own business, and thus be able to repay her parents and siblings for the effort, dedication, and support that they have always given her.  She believes that the income from her business will enable her to provide them with a better quality of life, and also generate jobs for those young people that wish to succeed in life but don’t have the financial resources to do so.  She is grateful to the individuals who make it possible for her to study and achieve her dream of success.
.

loans.use: to pay for her Commercial Engineering degree.

loans.name: Khasan

texts.ru:
Для ремонта дома. 
Хасан воспитанный, пунктуальный человек. Ему 45 лет. Он из района Руми. Хасан женат и имеет одного ребенка. Он занимается мастером по производство пластиковых окон и двери. Он недавно начал свою работу, 8 месяцев Хасан занимается своей работой. Ему нравится работать техническими аппаратами и оборудованием. Хасан любить жену и ребенка. Он старается обеспечить и улучшить жилищную условия жизни семью. Хасан хотел бы сделать ремонт в  своем доме, чтобы жить комфортно и уютно.  По этой причине он просит кредит. Хасан верит в Вас и на поддержку с Вашей стороны.
texts.en: Khasan is a well-mannered, punctual person. He is 45 years old. He is from the Rumy region. Khasan is married and has one child. He is a foreman producing vinyl windows and doors. He started his job not long ago - Khasan has been doing this work for eight months. He likes to work with technical apparatus and equipment. Khasan loves his wife and child. He strives to provide for and improve living conditions for his family. Khasan would like to carry out renovations in his house in order to live comfortably and cozily. For this reason he is asking for a loan. Khasan believes in you and in support from you.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase items for his motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret  is a 28-year-old woman. She is married and has two children, living in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. 

Margret is a Camfed Learner Guide, volunteering at her local secondary school, teaching a weekly life skills group. She paid back her USD 500 loan well. 

Margret wishes to have a bigger loan to continue and expand her business. She said, “I want to have chickens at different stages, at every given time, such that I will be selling every time, at the same time, with small chicks.” 

Margret wants to train as a nurse, if she passes math.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens, along with medicines and vaccines for them.

loans.name: Dadirai

texts.en: Dadirai is a 24-year-old businesswoman living in Mbire District, Zimbabwe. She is very passionate about protecting the environment so she volunteers at local clinics and organizes cleaning campaigns. Additionally, she offers psycho-social support to young people in her community. Dadirai operates a flea market at the rural service center. She sells a variety of items like cosmetics and clothes. She used her first loan to expand and was able to support her family with the profits. She is very keen on improving her business. With this Kiva loan, Dadirai will purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts to increase the amount of items she can sell.

loans.use: To purchase items for her clothing resale business.

loans.name: Dishoda

texts.ru: Дилшоде 46 лет. Она уроженка не большого городка Истаравшан. Истаравшан известен 1000 летней неизменной культурой и своими ремесленниками. Дилшода гордится тем, что живет в этом городе. Дилшода замужем и имеет двоих детей и невестку. Ее муж со старшим сыном уехал на заработки в Российской Федерации. Младший сын учится в средней школе. Дилшода дома занимается животноводством. На сегодняшний день у нее осень малое количество скотов и она, чтобы спасти свой бизнес и в дальнейшем расширить его, хочет получить кредит. Она надеется, что ее поддержать в этом выборе.
texts.en: Dishoda is 46 years old. She is a native of the small town of Istaravshan. Istaravshan is famous for its continuous 1,000-year-old culture and for its artisans. Dishoda is proud to live in this town. Dishoda is married and has two children and a daughter-in-law. Her husband has gone away with their elder son to earn money in the Russian Federation. Their younger son is studying in secondary school. Disoda rears animals at home. Today she has a very small number of cattle and she wants to receive a loan in order to save her business and expand it in the future. She hopes that she will be supported in this choice.

loans.use: to buy cattle to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish and seafood products.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 20-year-old, single man from Khan Younis, Gazi Strip. He lives with his family in a small, old house. Ali has a stall for selling clothes in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income. Ali took a loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell at his stall to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
Ammar is a 31-year-old married man from Rafah city. He works as an employee in a local firm where he earns a low income that barely covers all the family's needs.
Ammar took out a USD loan from FATEN to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. With this loan, Ammar will be able to decrease the family's electricity expenses. 
Ammar appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house

loans.name: Adham

texts.en:
Adham is a 47-year-old married man from Dier El Balah city. He works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family’s needs.

Adham took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar water heating system for the family’s house. By taking this loan, Adham will be able to decrease the electricity expenses.

Adham appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar water heating system for the family's house.

loans.name: Felícito

texts.es: Don Felícito vende ropa en diferentes comunidades, económicamente depende de esta actividad, solicita un crédito por $2.100 para completar la compra de un vehículo para transportar sus productos y ampliar el área de trabajo.
texts.en: Felícito sells clothing in different communities. Economically, he depends on this work. He requesting a $2,100 loan to purchase a vehicle to transport his products and expand his work zone.

loans.use: purchase a four-wheel drive vehicle.

loans.name: Zaitoon

texts.en: Zaitoon is 37 years old and married. She runs a business with her husband selling milk. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  Zaitoon’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Husband and wife working together are supporting their family. However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenses. Therefore, Zaitoon  has requested ar 40,000 PKR loan to buy one more buffalo to milk. That would provide service to more customers and provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo for milking.

loans.name: Irakli

texts.en:
Irakli, 24 years old and married, lives in Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. He has a wife, who works as a sales lady at the local store. Irakli has worked in construction operations but his income isn't stable. Irakli is eager to start another business to earn additional income. He needs financial support to purchase a car for a taxi business to earn additional business income. Irakli has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 
The loan will greatly assist Irakli as his income will significantly increase by providing taxi service. He will be able to improve his economic situation and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is 20 years old. She lives with her parents in a sector of Jordan called Irbid. She is a university student majoring in business administration, and she is in her second year.

Sara is planning to find a better job after her graduation, with good income to be able to help her family with the household expenses. However, because of the financial crisis her family has been facing, she wasn't able to pay for her upcoming semester fees. Therefore, she has applied for this loan to cover her university fees.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel de 58 años de edad es casada y tiene una hermosa familia de siete hijos de las edades entre 17 y 43 años, para Isabel a pesar de su avanzada edad y que la mayoría de sus hijos sean mayores de edad es no es ningún impedimento para seguir trabajando y obtener sus ingresos es por ello que trabaja elaborando tejido artesanal  esta labor lo realiza ella dese hace 15 años, gracias a mujeres  como Isabel se cuentan con hermosos tejidos típicos, pero para poder mejorar sus ingresos Isabel se dedica a la compra y venta de jocotes ,ella con el apoyo de sus hijos desde hace algún tiempo ha empezado la construcción de su casa pero en estos días ella ya no cuenta con los recursos para poder comprar cemento, cal arena y terminar la construcción de su casa.
El gran sueño de Isabel es poder terminar la construcción de su casa para que sus hijos tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Isabel is 58 years old. She is married and has a beautiful family of seven children aged between 17 and 43 years old. For Isabel despite her advanced age and most of her children being adults she has no problem continuing to work to obtain her income. So she works doing handcrafted weaving which she has been doing for 15 years. Thanks to women like Isabel we have these beautiful traditional weavings. And to improve her income Isabel works buying and selling jocote (a local fruit).

Some time ago with the help of her children she started construction on a house. At that time she did not have sufficient resource to buy cement, lime and sand to complete the construction. Isabel's big dream is to be able to complete the construction of her house so that her children have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish construction.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts such as tyres and wheel rings for repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle, so as to offer better and faster transportation services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts such as tires and wheel rings for repairs and maintenance to offer better and faster transportation services.

loans.name: Muqsood

texts.en: Muqsood is 35 years old, married and has two children.  She is a hard-working mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing this for many years. She knows well the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operation of her business, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy stitching material such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenue to cover personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stitching material such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons to sew more dresses on time

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martín un hombre de campo decidido a trabajar de sol a sol para brindarle a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida y se encuentra muy satisfecho porque gracias al crédito sus sueños se está siendo realidad, porque él pudo comprar sus semillas de cebolla y abono orgánico afortunadamente obtuvo muy buena cosecha que le dejo una bonita ganancia y con ello él pudo comprar un pedazo de terreno donde actualmente ya cultiva,   Martín con el afán de seguir prosperando ha tomado la decisión de realizar otro préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de semillas de cebolla, insecticidas y fungicidas para que su cultivo de logre cosechar de una buena calidad.
El gran sueño de Martín es poder obtener una buena cosecha para que sus ingresos mejoren y construir su casa para que sus hijos vivan mejor.
texts.en:
Martin, a farm laborer, decided to work from dawn to dusk to provide his children with better living conditions.  He is very pleased because, thanks to the loan, his dreams are becoming a reality.  He was able to purchase onion seeds and organic fertilizer and, fortunately, he obtained a very good harvest that left him with a nice profit with which he was able to purchase a piece of land which he is currently cultivating.

With the desire to continue prospering, Martin has decided to take out another loan, which he will use to purchase onion seeds, insecticides, and fungicides so that his crop will produce a good quality harvest.  Martin’s great dream is to be able to obtain a good harvest so that his income improves, and to build his home to that his children live better.

loans.use: to purchase onion seeds, insecticides, and fungicides.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing is a 29-year-old married mother of two. She currently lives in the Chikomba West District of Zimbabwe where she volunteers as a Camfed Learner guide. She wants to improve the learning environment of students by teaching them about well-being. 

Blessing is a vivacious woman who cares about the health and welfare of her community. When Blessing got a $500 loan, she purchased men's and women’s clothes, such as t-shirts, jeans, shirts, jackets, and jerseys to sell to local residents. 

With this new loan from Kiva, she will purchase cattle to sell. Blessing’s business is doing pretty well and she has managed her loan repayments on time.

loans.use: To purchase catte.

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is a 23-year-old single man with special needs. He works hard to prove that despite his situation, he can be successful and make his own living without others' support and help.
Walid had vocational training in a special needs institution. He was taught how to run his small convenience store, which he opened in May 2015, and he is working hard to develop it as much as he can.
Since Walid has a small income, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his business merchandise with summer beverages and special offer products.
He is looking forward to this loan and hopes to keep on developing and expanding his business as much as he can.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with summer beverages and special offer products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy machinery for painting and bodywork.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops so as to get a better harvest to sell to clients and to meet client needs.

loans.name: Pain De Vie 3.2 Group

texts.en: Donald is a member of the community bank group Pain de Vie 3.2 in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. Helping to lead a group of six other micro-entrepreneurs, Donald has two primary activities: selling used clothing and selling sodas and drinks to his customers. Donald is requesting his fifth loan from HOPE Congo and will use the loan to restock his inventory of used clothes. Additionally, Donald has more recently launched a telephone service which he hopes will continue to grow. One day, Donald hopes that he can transform his business into a wholesaler of clothes and drinks instead of simply selling retail. Additionally, with his increased income, he wishes to support the education of his two children and improve the quality of their housing situation.

loans.use: to purchase large bundles of used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk with his motorcycle to earn more income.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es: Natalia es una mujer muy esforzada, tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y sandalias, de los ingresos obtenidos de esta actividad dependen ella y sus dos hijos. Actualmente necesita invertir en su negocio para así generar mas ventas, por lo que necesita de un préstamo de ochocientos mil colones (800.000) para comprar más mercadería .
texts.en: Natalia is a very driven woman, she has a clothing and sandals business, her and her two sons depend on the income from this job. Currently she needs to invest in her business in order to generate more sales, for which she needs a loan of eight hundred thousand (800,000) colones in order to purchase more merchandise.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for clothing sales

loans.name: Nyasha

texts.en: Nyasha is a 24-year-old single mother of one living in Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully selling clothes and her business has benefitted significantly from the first loan that she received from Kiva. When she is not working in her business, Nyasha serves as a Cama (Camfed’s alumni network) member by volunteering as a Community Health Trainer, disseminating health information to schools within her village. With the second loan requested, Nyasha intends to make bulk purchases of clothes which will allow her to increase her profitability. With additional profit, she hopes to expand into a retail shop, create employment within her community and provide for her child.

loans.use: To expand her clothing business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 21-year-old businesswoman from Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She has been selling clothes, shoes, and blankets in her community. Gladys also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide and assists school children with their studies every week.

She received a first loan and developed her business, and she repaid it within the stipulated time. With the second loan that she is requesting, Gladys intends to purchase more clothes, shoes, and blankets from wholesalers. This will help her maximize sales and profits.

With the additional profits, Gladys intends to further her education. She would like to enroll in a teachers’ college and train to become a primary school teacher.

loans.use: to expand her clothing business.

loans.name: Las Inquietas Group

texts.es:
Angelica es una mujer de 38 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 4, 10 y 18 años, y su negocio es la venta de accesorios para teléfonos celulares.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, activa, constate, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad ‘El Torno’ que en los último años ha experimentado un gran incremento en su demografía debido a la emigración la población del interior del país, el clima se caracteriza por ser templado, al estar comprendido entre las llanuras y los valles mesotérmicos, aunque se registran vientos fuertes y lluvias tormentosas en ciertas épocas del año.
Angelica es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás de la nuca, baja estatura, complexión física robusta,  su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (viste blusa azul). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como chofer y con sus hijos; el mayor termino la escuela, el del medio estudia en la escuela y el menor se encuentra a su cuidado, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de madera con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba y energía eléctrica. La necesidad por mejorar su actividad para pagar los gastos de su familia la llevó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de comida, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de lácteos, venta de verduras, venta de refrescos, venta de empanadas y venta de queso, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus ingresos. Su negocio es la venta de accesorios para teléfonos celulares como; carcasas, baterías, audífonos, y otros “trabajo de forma ambulante en mercados y ferias, la mercadería rota constantemente y se renueva de la misma forma…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que sus productos rotan continuamente, la desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión para la compra de nueva mercadería. Su sueño es abrir una tienda para dejar de ambular, ella desea realizar la compra de variedad de accesorios para teléfono celular, para ofertar mayor variedad y con los beneficios pagar los gastos de sus hijos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Angelica solicita un préstamo para la compra de accesorios para teléfonos celulares para mejorar su oferta y pagar los gastos de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Angelica is a 38-year-old woman who lives with her husband, and has 3 children, ages 4, 10, and 18. Her business is selling accessories for cell phones.

Angelica is a good mother, enterprising, active, constant, patient, responsible and very hard-working. She is developing her business in the El Torno neighborhood that in recent years, has experienced a large demographic rate of growth due to the emigration of population from the country's interior. The climate is temperate, located as it is among 'meso-thermal' plains and valleys, though there are strong winds and torrential rains at certain times of the year.    

Angelica has a dark complexion, brown eyes, long black hair fastened at the back of her neck, a short stature, and a robust physical appearance. Her mother tongue is Guarani which she speaks in the family, but speaks Spanish in the general culture and in her business. (She is wearing a blue blouse in the photo.) Angelica lives with her husband. who works as a driver, and with her children. The eldest has finished school, while the middle child is in school, and the youngest is still in her care. They live in a rented room constructed of wood with a calamine roof and dirt floor that has electricity and well water extracted by a pump. 

The need to improve her business in order to cover family expenses led Angelina to lead a community bank composed of members with businesses such as selling meals, second-hand clothing, dairy products, vegetables, soft drinks, stuffed breads, and cheese. All are requesting loans in hopes of improving their incomes. Angela's business sells accessories for cell phones, including cases, batteries, hearing devices, and other “items on foot in markets and fairs. The merchandise rotates constantly and must be repeatedly renewed...” she says. The advantage of her business is that products rotate continuously. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to invest in purchasing new merchandise. 

Angela's dream is to open a store and cease the need to sell on foot. She wants to offer a larger variety of cell phone accessories, and with the benefits, cover her children's expenses. This is her first loan cycle with our institution during her 3 years in this activity.

These are Angelina's motives for soliciting a loan – to purchase cell phone accessories in order to improve her offerings and be able to pay for the costs incurred in raising her children.

loans.use: to purchase more accessories for cell phones, improving her inventory, in order to cover expenses incurred for her children.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine is a 27-year-old mother of a young son. She is from Tbilisi and lives with her friend. Kristine has no source of income and requires financial support to earn some money. She could not qualify for a loan from the local financial institutions because they require business experience or stable revenue. The start-up program, a joint effort of Kiva and Credo, allows poor people like Kristine to get a chance at starting or re-starting a business. With the requested amount of $1,000 (USD) Kristine will purchase food products and also fruits and vegetables and will sell the products from a little store near her house. 
As a result of the new business initiative implemented with the assistance of Kiva, Kristine will be involved in her own business, generate income and improve living condition for her son. She is very thankful to Kiva lenders for giving her a chance to generate income.

loans.use: To start selling food products and fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 48 years old and married with one child in school. Beatriz works very hard to provide for them.

Beatriz runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell such as condiments, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Beatriz has been in this business for 8 years. 

In the future, Beatriz would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as condiments, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
Rovelyn is 39 years old and has five children. She is married and all five children attend school.

Rovelyn is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Rovelyn has requested for a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for 14 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rovelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Alijon

texts.ru:
Аличон трудолюбивый и сильный мужчина. Он после окончания школы начал помогать родителям вести работу. Аличон научился  заниматься сельскохозяйственной деятельностью, и несколько лет продвигал свою работу. Потом он начал еще свой новый бизнес, он занимался торговой деятельностью несколько лет. Аличон всегда думает о будущем и не ни на что трудится. В жизни бед труда не жить. 
Аличон семейный человек. У него жена и любимый сын. Сыну 16 лет, и он учится в школе. Жена бех работница, она домохозяйка. Аличон сейчас занимается таксистом. Ему нравится работать с людьми. Он каждый день встречает разных людей. Аличон любить свою работу, потому что доход от этой работы обеспечить свою семью. Он решил отремонтировать свою автомашину, чтобы не потерять источник дохода. Для этой Аличон нужны деньги, и он по этой причине обратился за кредитом. Он надеется, что сможет восстановить автомашину с вашей помощью.
texts.en:
Alijon is a strong, hardworking man. After finishing school he started helping his parents with their work and learned about agriculture, spending a few years in this occupation. Then he started his own retail business, which he ran for several years. He always thinks about the future but doesn't worry about things, because you can't live without difficulty in this life. 

Alijon is a family man who has a wife and a dear son. His son is 16 and in school. His wife is a homemaker and doesn't work outside the home. Alijon is currently working as a taxi driver. He likes working with people and meets different people every day. He loves his work because he receives income with which he can care for his family. He needs to fix his car, so he doesn't lose his source of income. He needs money to do this and for this reason is requesting a loan. He hopes he will be able to repair his car with your help.

loans.use: to fix his car

loans.name: Usuri Group

texts.es:
Tomasa es una mujer de 41 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 5, 9 y 14 años, y su negocio s la venta de refrigerios y tienda de barrio.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, dedicada, paciente, optimista, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘plan 3000’ se encuentra ubicado en la zona sur de la ciudad, dentro de la zona peri urbana. Creada debido a una riada del río, en la que más de 3.000 familias quedaron sin hogar , y con las pocas pertenencias que le quedaban tuvieron que asentarse en unos terrenos baldíos, donde las familias afectadas tuvieron que empezar una nueva vida.  
Tomasa es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que desarrolla (sentada, la primera de la derecha, viste blusa blanca con rayas celestes). Su vida la disfruta en compañía de su pareja que trabaja como granjero y con sus hijos; los 2 mayores estudian en la escuela y el menor empieza el kinder, viven en un cuarto propio construido de madera con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba, energía eléctrica y no tiene alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación para pagar los gastos preescolares de su hijo menor, la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de ropa de segunda mano, servicio de construcción, comercio de ganado, venta de naranjas, venta de carne, venta de comida, artesanía en cerámica y verdulería, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de refrigerios y tienda de barrio; los refrigerios son sándwiches hechos con pan y alguna variedad de carne, agregándoles alguna verdura. La venta la realiza a diario en su tienda de barrio ubicada en su domicilio “preparo refrigerios y salgo a venderlos de forma ambulante, y otros los dejo en mi tienda dónde también los vendo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que vende de forma ambulante y en su puesto fijo, la desventaja es la falta de capital para invertir en el negocio y generar mejores ingresos. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y surtir su tienda para mejorar sus ventas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Tomasa solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos para preparar refrigerios y venderlos en su tienda de barrio para mejorar sus ventas y pagar los gastos escolares de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Tomasa is a 41 year old woman who lives with her partner. She has three children aged 5, 9 and 14 years old. Her business is the sales of snacks and a neighborhood store.

She is a good mother enterprising, dedicated, patient, optimistic, responsible and very hard-working. Her business is in the ‘Plan 3000’ area which is located to the south of the city within the semi-urban area. It was created because of a flood which left over 3,000 families homeless and with the few possessions left them they settled on this barren land and had to start their lives over.

Tomasa is dark-skinned, has dark eyes, long black hair that she ties back, is short and physically robust. Her native language is Guaraní which she speaks with her family and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for her business. (In the photo she is the first to the right, wearing a white blouse with blue stripes).

She shares her life with her partner who works as a farmer and her children. The oldest study in school and the youngest is starting kindergarten. They live in a room that they built themselves made of wood with a metal roof and dirt floor with water from a well, electricity and no sewage.

Her desire to get ahead to pay the pre-school fees of her youngest child led her to head a group of people with businesses like: selling second hand clothing, a construction service, raising cattle, selling oranges, selling meat, selling meals, ceramic handicrafts and a fruit and vegetable shop, to request a loan to improve their businesses.

Her business is selling snacks and a neighborhood store. Her snacks are sandwiches made with bread and some kind of meat with some vegetable added to it. She sells them daily in her store located in her house. "I prepare snacks and go out and sell them intinerantly and I leave others in my store where they also sell them", she commented. The advantage of her business is that she sells them both in the street and in her store and her disadvantage is the lack of capital to invest in her business to generate more income. Her dream is to expand her business and stock her store to improve her sales.

This is her first loan with the institution in the 3 years she has had her business. For these reasons she is requesting a loan to buy ingredients to make snacks and sell them in her neighborhood store to improve her sales and pay the educational expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make snacks and sell them in her neighborhood store to improve her sales and pay the educational expenses of her children.

loans.name: Padre Eterno Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “KUTIMUY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lucrecia ella es casada y tiene 74 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de librería, la socia vende cuadernos, libros, lapiceros, borradores entre otros, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de librería. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuadernos, libros, lapiceros y borradores.
Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de joyas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Kutimuy Communal Bank, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.  

The member, Lucrecia, is 74 years old, and married with four children.  She works from 8:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. in her bookstore business where she sells notebooks, books, pencils, erasers, and other items.  She has been in this business for five years already, and it is going well.  Her dream is to expand the bookstore business, and she is requesting the loan to purchase notebooks, books, pencils, and erasers.  Lucrecia is grateful to those who form part of this dream by this means, and promises to make her payments on time.  

The other members are engaged in jewelry and clothing sales as well as a grocery store and bookstore businesses.  The members who are attached to the group photo had their photos taken after the meeting because they had to work.

loans.use: to purchase notebooks, books, pencils, and erasers.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras 2014 Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS 2014”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Quillabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yovana ella es conviviente y tiene 37 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y restaurant, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS 2014” ( the 2014 entrepreneurs) communal bank. This bank is located in the Quillabamba district in La Convención province in the Cusco department.

The member is Yovana. She is in a relationship. She is 37 years old and she has two children. She works in a grocery store and restaurant. She sells basic necessity products like rice, sugar, milk and cookies. She wants to be able to provide through this business. She is an enterprising and hard-working woman. Her dream is to expand her grocery business. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

The other members are involved in businesses like selling food, clothes, groceries and a restaurant.

The member is grateful for those who are a part of this dream. She promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: purchase sugar, rice, milk and cookies

loans.name: Guddo

texts.en:
Guddo is 50 years old and married. Along with her husband, she has been running an animal-sales business for many years. 

Guddo is motivated to provide her family with a better standard of living. Now, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. 

Guddo desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Juan Gustavo

texts.es: Don Juan es un señor que alquila locales para oficinas , esta actividad es la fuente de ingresos para su familia,  solicita un préstamo de cuatrocientos cincuenta mil colones (450.000) para restaurar dichos locales y  comprar pintura. Con esto pretende mejorar la apariencia de las oficinas y lograr que sus clientes se sientan a gusto.
texts.en: Juan rents out office space, an activity that is the source of income for his family.  He is requesting a loan of four hundred fifty thousand colones (450,000) to restore these office spaces and purchase paint.  With this, he plans to improve the appearance of the offices, and make his customers feel comfortable.

loans.use: to retore offices.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor Manuel, está casado y actualmente vive con sus hijos y esposa.  El con el crédito va comprar unos novillos para engorde. El posee una finca con buenos repastos aptos para la explotación de estos animales. El hace años trabaja en esto y piensa que es buen tiempo para invertir unos animales más. Él tiene como meta aprovechar el máximo de sus repastos, engordar los animales y luego vender en la subasta para así generar ganancias para su bienestar familiar, y a su vez generar un mejor futuro a su familia con los ingresos obtenidos. Él es el segundo crédito que tiene con Fudecosur.  Antes no había solicitado en otros Bancos Estatales.
texts.en: Victor Manuel is married and he currently lives with his children and wife. He is going to purchase some cattle to fatten. He owns a farm with good pastures for using these animals. He has years of work experience in this field. He thinks it is a good time to invest in a few more animals. His goal is to take good advantage of his land, fatten the animals and then later, sell them at auction to generate earning for his family's well-being. He can create a better future for his family with the earnings. This is the second loan he has had with Fudecosur. He has not worked with any state banks.

loans.use: purchase cattle.

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es:
María tiene 51 años, es casada y madre de 4 hijos, vive con ellos, su esposo y 2 nietas, para un total de 8 personas incluyéndola. No tienen casa propia  y hace varios años viven en una casa prestada por una hermana del esposo, no pagan alquiler ya que el principal deseo de su cuñada es ayudar a la familia. Doña Pilar siempre le gustó cocinar, cuenta con la habilidad en esa área, fortaleza que ha sabido aprovechar para generar ingresos adicionales al hogar, ayudando a su esposo, en especial con los gastos de estudio. El negocio de Doña Pilar como la conocen en la comunidad de Tierra Blanca de Cartago, es la venta de comidas express, inició hace varios años preparando tortillas, tamales y otros productos. Actualmente vende desayunos y almuerzos por encargos, los prepara en la cocina de su casa, al igual que los alimentos para su numerosa familia. La solicitante conoce Fundación Mujer, ya que hace muchos años fue integrante de un grupo solidario, pago su deuda responsablemente y luego se retiró del grupo. 
El negocio de Doña Pilar es pequeño y con necesidad de inyectarle capital de trabajo. Su equipo y electrodomésticos utilizados para preparar las comidas son los mismos de su hogar, que a lo largo de estos años ha podido reforzar, sin embargo aún son insuficientes para el crecimiento y demanda de sus servicios. En cuanto a los insumos para la elaboración de los alimentos se compran día a día por falta de recursos para comprar en mayor cantidad. 
Los clientes actuales de Doña Pilar son los profesores del Colegio de la comunidad, trabajadores de la clínica de servicios médicos y otros establecimientos comerciales que existen en la localidad, tiene muy buena demanda, además está por concretar con más clientes como los trabajadores de una farmacia que recién abrió, así como de otros lugares, esto representa una cartera fuerte de clientes potenciales, sumado a que no existe competencia en cuanto a sodas en el lugar, solo restaurantes con precios muy elevados. La demanda de los servicios es muy estable,  en ocasiones además de los almuerzos diarios le encargan comida si tienen alguna actividad como té de Canastilla, cumpleaños y otros, eso representa un adicional. Cuenta con la ayuda de una de sus hijas mayores, es ella la encargada de entregar todos los pedidos. 
Esta actividad que desarrolla la clienta nace a raíz de contribuir con los gastos del hogar, aprovechando sus habilidades culinarias. 
El crédito es la oportunidad de adquirir equipo para aumentar y agilizar la elaboración de las comidas, fortaleciéndola con mejoras herramientas, así como la oportunidad de comprar abarrotes, granos, aceites, especies, enlatados y productos no perecederos, que le permitan atender más clientes, ya que actualmente debe decirles a algunos clientes que ya no tiene comidas preparadas.
texts.en:
María is 51 years old and is married and the mother of 4 children. She lives with them, her husband and 2 granddaughters, a total of 8 people including her. They do not have their own home and for some years they have lived in a home lent by her husband’s sister. They do not pay rent as her sister-in-law’s main intent is to help the family.

Doña Pilar always liked to cook and has an ability in that area, a strength she has taken advantage of to earn additional income for the household, helping her husband, especially with educational expenses.

The business of Doña Pilar, as she is known as in the community of Tierra Blanca de Cartago, is the sale of fast food. She started several years ago by preparing tortillas, tamales, and other dishes. Currently she sells breakfasts and lunches, by order, preparing them in the kitchen of her house along with the food for her large family.

The borrower knows Fundación Mujer as many years ago she was a member of a solidarity group paying her debt responsibly and later she withdrew from the group. 

Doña Pilar’s business is small and in need of an injection of working capital. The equipment and appliances used to prepare the meals are the same ones in her household, which over the years have been increased, however, they are still insufficient for the growth and demand for their services. She buys the supplies for making the meals every day due to lack of resources to buy in larger quantities.

Doña Pilar’s current customers are the teachers of the community school, medical service workers, and other commercial establishments in the area. She is in high demand. Also, there will be more clientele from the workers at the recently opened pharmacy, and likewise from other places. This represents a strong source of future customers, plus there is no competition for sodas in the place, only restaurants with high prices.

The demand for services is very stable. In addition to the daily lunches sometimes she fixes food for some additional activities such as baby showers, birthdays, and more. She has the help of an older daughter who is in charge of delivering all the orders.

The borrower began this work in order to contribute to the household expenses, taking advantage of her culinary skills. The loan offers the opportunity to buy groceries, grains, oils, spices, canned and nonperishable goods, which will allow her to serve more clients as currently she has to tell some customers that they have no more prepared meals.

loans.use: to buy appliances and supplies for the making of meals such as grains, spices, sauces, and canned items.

loans.name: Silvia Idalia

texts.es:
Silvia, de 29 años de edad, es una mujer joven y emprendedora, tiene 2 hijos que es por quien lucha día con día para salir adelante.
Silvia, tiene más de 12 años realizando cultivos de granos básicos para comercializar el maíz y el frijol y obtener ingresos para sacar adelante y sostener a su familia.

Silvia, necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y semillas para que la cosecha tenga fuerza y sea productiva para cubrir sus necesidades y darle el sustento a sus hijos.

Silvia, sueña con poder comprar una balsa, para pezcar y que esta sea otra actividad productiva para ellos.
texts.en:
Silvia is 29 years old. She is a young and enterprising woman with two children, for whom she works hard every day in order to move forward. For more than 12 years, Silvia has been growing basic grains like corn and beans, which she sells in order to obtain an income and support her family. 

Silvia needs this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds, in order to have a strong and productive harvest and cover all of her needs and feed her children. Silvia's dream is to be able to purchase a raft for fishing, in order to have another productive activity for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds in order to have a strong, productive harvest.

loans.name: Nicolás

texts.es:
Nicolás es un hombre trabajador lleno de entusiasmo  que se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes desde hace 2 años esta labor lo escogió por qué en su comunidad no se cuenta con una tienda que ofrezca todos los productos necesario, pero para mejorar sus ingreso se dedica también a la venta de verduras, estas dos actividades lo realiza el con el único fin de sacar adelante a sus tres hijos, Nicolás para seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes un buen servicio ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo para comprar productos de abarrote como azúcar, arroz, golosinas y gaseosas.
El gran sueño de Nicolás es contar con el préstamo para poder hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Nicolás is a hard-working man who is full of enthusiasm. He has been buying and selling groceries for two years. He choose this work as his community had no store that offered all the products needed. And to improve his income he also sells vegetables. He does these two activities with the simple goal of raising his three children.

In order to continue to offer his clients good service Nicolás has made the decision to request a loan to buy grocery products like sugar, rice, sweets and soft drinks. Nicolás' big dream is to have the loan to be able to expand his business and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy grocery products.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru:
Зухро 61 летняя жительница района Вахдат. Она мать двоих сыновей. Один из сыновей так и многие жители находится на заработках заграницей, а другой работает преподавателем в местной школе. 
  Сама Зухро занимается садоводством и животноводством параллельно. Зухро успевает во всем. Она у себя дома выращивает скотин и имеет не большой сад. Самый приятный период в жизни Зурхо является период сбора урожая фруктов. В сборе урожая ей помогает сын. Зухро решила купить несколько голов скотин и продвинуть животноводческую деятельность. С такими намерениями она обратилась за финансовой поддержкой.
texts.en:
Zuhro is a 61-year old woman living in the Vahdat Region. She has two sons. One of her sons, as many locals, is currently abroad as a migrant worker, and the other works as a teacher at the local school.

As to Zuhro, she grows fruits and also raises livestock. She manages to take care of everything. She keeps livestock by her house and also  has a small orchard. The most joyful time for her comes when fruit is ready to be harvested. Her son helps her to harvest fruit. Zuhro decided to buy several heads of livestock and grow her livestock business. With this intent she has applied for financial support.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Mijgona

texts.ru: 30 летняя Мичгона имеет пятерых сыновей. Она счастлива, что у нее есть 5 сыновей. Старшие дети учатся в средней школе. О младших детей ухаживает ее мама. Мичгона развелась с мужем. Она предоставляя услуги портнихи зарабатывает и кормить детей. Ей одна тяжело, но Мичгона не чувствует себя одинокой, ведь у нее 5 прекрасных детей. Она ради своих детей днем и ночью трудится. Мичгона хочет расширит и ускорить процесс работы. Ей нужны деньги для купли швейные принадлежности, но у нее у них нет. Он была вынуждена обратиться за кредитом. Мичгона надеется, что Вы ей поможете с финансовыми трудностями. Она заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en: Mijgona is 30 years old and the mother of five sons who make her very happy.  Her oldest children attend secondary school.  The youngest are in the care of her mother.  Mijgona is divorced from her husband.  She works as a seamstress in order to make a living and feed her children.  Being a single mother is difficult, but Mijgona never feels lonely because she has five beautiful children.  It is for their sake that she works day and night.  At the moment she wants to expand her activity and also work faster. She needs to buy sewing supplies, but she doesn't have enough money for this purchase.  For this reason, she had to take a loan.  Mijgona hopes that you will help her overcome her financial difficulties and she thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts for maintaining his grinding mill in order to ensure efficient service so as to attract more customers to gain more income.

loans.name: Lina
