texts.en:
Lina is a 42-year-old married mother of two children, who has been providing cleaning services in a public school in her neighborhood since 2000 to support her husband in covering their family's increasing needs. Lina is a hard-working woman with a very good reputation in her region.

Since her limited monthly salary combined with her husband's isn't enough to cover increasing needs for living, Lina is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy items for a special winter living room, which her family needs to have at home, while the prices are good so that they can enjoy them during the winter season.

She has a dream to open a clothes-selling shop and she is working hard to make it come true.

loans.use: To buy items for a special winter living room for the winter season

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gina is 34 years old and has two children who are in school.

Gina has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. Gina has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Gina has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 44-year-old married woman who has been running an animal purchase and sale business with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is the mother of two children and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.

She has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves, to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves, to cater to more customers

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a 57-year-old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition, so she started a business of selling cloth. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children.

Jamila is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Currently she needs a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would enable her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment

loans.name: Arafat

texts.en:
Arafat is a 32-year-old married man from Rafah city. He works as an employee in a local firm, where he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs.

Arafat has taken a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Arafat will be able to decrease his electricity expenses. 

Arafat appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 51-year-old married woman with three children. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years she has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs, from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

Now she has requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Zahida expects an increase in her earnings with the loan, and she plans to spend part of her profits to provide a better life for her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is 55 years old; she is a married woman. She deals in selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate extra income. 

Kaneez needs to improve her business to meet her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 30,000  PKR to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and increase her income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales

loans.name: Jerusalem Group

texts.en:
Sophia, who is in her late 30s, is single with one child, who is still in school.  She has been running a mama lishe (café) business for one year now.  She works from 6:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Sophia's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to increase her stock for her mama lishe business. She dreams of owning a hotel.

Sophia will share this loan with her loan group, Jerusalem, which has ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase stock for her café business.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.es: Don Jonathan tiene un puesto de venta de mariscos y pescado. El necesita comprar mariscos en este momento, ya que están a un precio muy conveniente y de esta manera puede tener más cantidad de producto para vender en los siguientes meses, para esto solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (/¢1.000.000) , su objetivo es hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en: Jonathan has a stand selling fish and seafood. He needs to buy seafood at this moment since they are at a very convenient price. In this way he can have a higher quantity of product to sell in the coming months. He is requesting a loan for this for one million colones (1,000,000). His goal is to make his business grow.

loans.use: to invest in buying seafood.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is a 51-year-old widowed woman. She and her son (also shown in the photo) have been doing agriculture work for some years. They grow different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market.

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Ashraf has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase different types of seeds along with good-quality soil and grass. This would help her to grow more crops, which ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds along with good-quality soil and grass.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente es un hombre de 42 años de edad es soltero y tiene una linda familia de seis hijos de las edades entre 4 meses y 17 años, ellos viven en una comunidad del departamento de Sololá.
Vicente para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a sus hijos se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas el eligió esta actividad pues lo aprendió de su padre y porque en las tierras donde él vive son muy fértiles, Vicente para seguir cultivando ha tomado la iniciativa de solicitar un préstamo para poder comprar sus semillas de zanahoria y compra de fertilizantes pues ya se acerca la época de zanahoria.
Vicente tiene el anhelo de comprar más terrenos para que sus hijos tengan más lugares para sembrar.
texts.en: Vicente is a 42 year old single man, and has a beautiful family of six children ranging in age from 4 months to 17 years old.  They live in a community in the Sololá department.  To earn income and support his children, Vicente is engaged in cultivating vegetables.  He chose this activity because he learned it from his father and because the land where he lives is very fertile.  In order to continue cultivating, Vicente has taken the initiative to request a loan to purchase carrot seeds and fertilizers because the carrot season is approaching.  Vicente wishes to purchase more land so that his children have additional places to sow

loans.use: to purchase carrot seeds and purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Dephine

texts.en:
Dephine is a 28-year-old businesswoman. She is married with two children and lives in Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe with her family. For three years now, she has been selling men’s and women’s clothing. She used her first loan to increase her stock and she successfully repaid it. During her spare time, Dephine volunteers as a Learner Guide, delivering life-skills education sessions to students in schools. 

With the requested loan, Dephine intends to diversify to poultry rearing to increase her income base. With more customers, her sales and profit levels will rise, enabling her to pay school fees for her children and remain financially independent.

loans.use: To diversify to poultry rearing to increase her income base.

loans.name: Mirvat

texts.en:
Mirvat is a 38-year-old single lady who has been investing her time in a mouneh (food preservation) business, which she has run from her house since 2010. Through providing her customers with the best quality of requested mouneh, she has worked hard to improve through the years.

Mirvat used to work as a tutor, but she decided to start her own productive business from her house, planning to expand her working sector properly. As a first step forward, Mirvat is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner in order to ready a piece of agricultural land to start planting. She will harvest its production and develop her agriculture trading business.

She is very anxious about this loan and looks forward to the possible results.

loans.use: To fix an agricultural land to start planting, harvesting its production and developing her agriculture business trading

loans.name: Alexander Group

texts.en:
Ibtissam is the featured borrower for Alexander Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Ibtissam is a 56-year-old married mother of five children. Ten years ago, she started tailoring curtains from her house to cover her family's expenses and needs. She is working hard and trying desperately to develop her business. Thus, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with fashionable textiles to satisfy her customers' special requests.

Ibtissam is the lady on the left. With respect to the other group members, Layla is the lady in the middle, and Fairouz is the lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with fashionable textiles.

loans.name: Cathrine

texts.en:
Cathrine is a 26-year-old mother of one, living in Shurugwi District, Zimbabwe. She sells clothes, and the first loan that she received enabled her to improve her business.

Cathrine spends her spare time volunteering as a Community Health Trainer, disseminating health information to schools and the community.

With the second loan that she is requesting, Cathrine intends to buy her clothing from wholesalers, allowing her to sell her products at more favorable prices and attract more customers.

loans.use: to expand her clothing business

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 26-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She has been running a tailoring business for many years to support her husband. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. 

She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of their household with the educational needs of their children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Now she has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase more reels of threads and packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting her orders on time. Shazia hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads and packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting her orders on time

loans.name: Joumana

texts.en:
Joumana is a 41-year-old married mother of one child, who, six months ago, established her own fresh chicken selling shop, in addition to her home based work which consists of women's facial beauty services in addition to selling clothes and underwear.

Her newly established business is coming on just fine, but just like most new businesses it needs additional financial push to develop to its full potential.

Joumana decided to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy van necessary for her business development and increase in income, which she will use to buy and distribute her chicken production, in addition to several other transportation needs.

Joumama is an ambitious lady who started her career from a very small business at her house and now her shop is widening through her hard work and ambitions.

loans.use: To buy a van necessary for her business development and increase in income

loans.name: Isela

texts.es: Doña Isela es madre de 3 hijos, tiene un negocio de venta de bolsos, acero y plata, con esta actividad ha podido mantener a su familia , solicita un préstamo de quinientos setenta mil colones (570.000) para comprar más materiales y así generar más ventas.
texts.en: Isela is mother to 3 children. She has a business selling purses, steel and silver. She has been able to support her family with this work. She requests a loan of five hundred and seventy thousand colones (570,000) to buy more materials and to thus generate more sales.

loans.use: to buy silver and steel goods.

loans.name: Caliente Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres (Celsa, Ana María y Glenda) de la etnia miskita de la ciudad de Bilwi, del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que luchan día a día por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios de venta de bastimento y pulpería; se organizaron hace 12 meses para acceder a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana.

Glenda: Es integrante del grupo solidario Caliente, es una señora de 41 años afable, madre soltera de 5 hijos que estudian su carrera universitaria y el menor de 11 años cursa su tercer grado. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a su familia, inicio elaborando pan artesanal y típicos de la Región Autónoma de la Costa Caribe Norte (RACCN): Pan de coco, queque de yuca, banano, arroz, quequisque, empanadas, Paty. Gracias a las ganancias percibidas y a los créditos otorgados anteriormente por Pana Pana y Financiados por Kiva, le han permitido establecer una pequeña pulpería en el corredor de su vivienda de tambo y madera. Está solicitando su cuarto financiamiento para diversificar sus productos, comprar: Granos básicos, chiverías, embutidos, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con tener una abarrotería.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of 3 women (Celsa, Ana María and Glenda) of the Miskita ethnic group from the city of Bilwi of the municipality of Puerto Cabezas.  They are enterprising women who struggle every day to make their small businesses, selling small food dishes and a small store, grow.  They organized 12 months ago to gain access to group guaranteed loans with Pana Pana. 

Glenda is a member of the solidarity group Caliente.  She is a 41-year-old affable single mother of 5 children who are studying at university and the youngest, 11 years old, is in the 3rd grade.  With the purpose of getting her family ahead, she started making traditional artisan bread from the Autonomous Region of the Northern Caribbean Coast (RACCN): coconut bread, yucca, banana, rice and taro cakes, empanadas and patís (a spicy beef-filled empanada).  

The profits received and the loans previously provided by Pana Pana and Kiva lenders have allowed her to establish a small store in the corridor of her home made of stilts and wood.  She is requesting her fourth loan to diversify her products, buying basic grains, dairy products and lunch meats, among other things.  She dreams of having a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, dairy products and lunch meats, among other products.

loans.name: Zeyad

texts.en:
Zeyad is a 33-years-old married man from Rafah city. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income is barely covers all the family needs.

Zeyad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Zeyad will be able to decrease the electricity expenses. 
Zeyad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shoe soles, shoes laces and sewing threads for repairing his customers' shoes and make more income to provide for his family's needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more computers and printers to enable him to offer faster services to clients in need of computer services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for use on her farm, to enable her to harvest more farm produce to sell and thus make more profits to support her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a bull to slaughter for meat, to be able to meet client needs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers and herbicides for his crop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to turn fallow land into potato and grain fields and to build fences around.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts for maintaining his poshomill for efficient service so as to attract more customers for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, for use on her farm, so as to get more farm produce to sell and make more profits to support her family.

loans.name: Majida

texts.en:
Majida is a 64-year-old widowed mother of one son, who has been running her convenience store since her husband passed away, to provide her only child the necessary living needs and to make sure that he can benefit from the best education to make sure he can acquire a brighter future
Since 1996 Mirvat has been running her store, and is working hard to fulfill her son's needs. 

Today,since her business income is barely enough to cover their living needs in addition to university expenses, Majida is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her only son's university tuition fees since he decided to take summer courses to graduate early.
Her son is enrolled in a private university, and he is in his second year studying Business, with one year left to graduate.

She hopes that her son will find a very good job when he graduates, then she can look after developing and improving her working place.

loans.use: To pay for her son's university tuition fees in Business since he decided to take summer courses to graduate early

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Ее зовут Зухро. Ей 40 лет. Она вместе с детьми и мужем живет в городе Худжанд. Ее муж сейчас устроился на работу в столице, чтобы иметь больше дохода и прокормить семью. На данный момент сын Зухро болеет и ему нужно купить дорогостоящие препараты и оплатить лечение в больнице. Зухро с мужем работают, но их денег не хватает. Зухро решила обратиться за кредитом, так как не имеет времени ждать и собрать денег. Она верит, что ее поддержат и выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en: This is Zuhro. She is 40 years old. She lives with her children and husband in the city of Khujand. Her husband has now got a job in the capital in order to have more income and feed the family. At the present time Zuhro's son is sick and they need to buy him expensive drugs and pay for treatment in hospital. Zuhro and her husband work, but they do not have enough money. Zuhro has decided to apply for a loan since she has no time to wait and save up. She believes that she will find support and expresses her gratitude.

loans.use: to pay for treatment for her son.

loans.name: Fadziso

texts.en:
Fadziso is a 26-year-old mother of two who lives in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She has raised broiler chickens for two years and her business produces batches of 100 broiler chickens every 3 weeks. 

With the requested loan, Fadziso plans to buy more chicks, feed and vaccines to expand her business. This would allow her to increase her production capacity to 100 birds every week. This would result in an increase in sales and profits.

Rutendo also serves as a Cama member who volunteers to clean toilets in schools within her community.

loans.use: To expand her poultry business with more chicks and vaccines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a cow as he has enough animal feeds for more

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a single woman. She describes herself as honest. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for five years.

Her business is located in an area fit for the business, and her primary customers are ladies. She says that her biggest business challenge is insufficient working capital.

This is Grace's fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan.

Grace will use this KES 80,000 loan to buy more beauty products for salon use. She hopes that in the future she will be successful.

loans.use: buy more beauty products for salon use

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 27-year-old married mother of two children whom she works hard next to her beloved husband for to provide them with the necessary living needs.

A year ago during 2014, Fatima decided to open her current convenience store to make sure her acquired income will help in covering their family's increasing living needs. Thus, for this reason and since her income is barely enough to make her dream come true, Fatima is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special Ramadan dates and requested juices in addition to summer beverages.

This is Fatima's first loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower.  She hopes that her future experiences will be more productive and successful.

loans.use: increase her store inventory

loans.name: Issam

texts.en:
Issam is a 27-year-old single man who opened few months ago a phone and computer repair shop to cover his needs and expenses. He is a talented man and hardworker who is now trying with his professional skills to gain loyal customers. 

Issam is trying hard to develop his business, thus today he is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary mobiles and computers spare parts which will facilitate his work and allow him to provide his customers with better service.

Issam hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: buy mobile & computer spare parts

loans.name: Roza

texts.en:
Roza is a 51-year-old married mother of seven children, and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low financial and social situations of Palestinians in Lebanon, especially those who live in camps, she started eight years ago selling used clothes in an attempt to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their beloved seven kids.

Roza is a hard worker and sacrificing mother, who tried throughout the years to develop her business, and improve her family's living conditions. 

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with new collection of used summer clothes, and to help her son in buying necessary updated tools to his mechanic shop.

Roza wishes her son good luck in his business, as she hopes to expand her business more in the future to stay capable of providing her family with better living conditions inside the camp.

loans.use: increase her merchandise with new collection of used summer clothes and buy updated tools for her son's mechanic shop

loans.name: Bashir

texts.es: Bashir es un joven muy esforzado, tiene un  taller de reparación de automóviles. Actualmente necesita comprar  maquinaria y herramientas para seguir operando en su taller, solicita un crédito de quinientos setenta mil colones (570.000) . Con los ingresos obtenidos de esta actividad pretende continuar con su preparación académica.
texts.en: Bashir is a very enterprising youth who has a vehicle repair shop. He currently needs to buy machinery and equipment to continue the operation of his shop. He is requesting a loan of 570,000 CRC. With the income he will receive from his business he hopes to continue his academic studies.

loans.use: to buy equipment for his mechanic shop.

loans.name: Muhtadi

texts.en:
Muhtadi is a 40-years-old married man from Dier El Balah city.  He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income is barely covers all the family needs.

Muhtadi took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Muhtadi will be able to decrease the electricity expenses. 

Muhtadi  appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house and save on electricity costs

loans.name: Joash

texts.en:
Joash is 34 years old and he supports three children. He has been offering motorcycle transport services for the the last six years and the business earns him KES 10,000 per month. 

Joash has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase motorcycle spare parts such as tyres and wheel rings for repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle so as to offer better and faster transportation services.  He

Joash plans to use gained profit to repay the loan and purchase more motorcycles for transportation services.  His hope is to be financially stable and educate his children.

loans.use: buy motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs for use for high maize production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Moenga

texts.en:
Moenga is 67 years old, married to Grace and supports a family of five children. He has been practicing farming  for the last 19 years, earning KES 15,000 per month. 

Moenga has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy certified seeds for planting better produce and supply more income gain.   He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to start retail shop in the area. His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: buy certified seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 39 years old and has two children. Aileen is married and has two children who are in school.

Aileen is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Aileen requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Aileen has been in pig fattening for 15 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Aileen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita works hard to support her family. Carmelita is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

Carmelita requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase more raw materials for her business.

Carmelita has been in this business for 8 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Carmelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her abaca weaving business

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en: Ashraf is 23 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his family. Ashraf was working as a taxi driver to earn money to help his retired father, and at the same time studying for a bachelor's degree, majoring in mechanical engineering. He is in his fourth year. He is planning to find a better job after his graduation to earn a better income in order to support his family. But because of the financial crisis his family has been facing, he wasn't able to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he has applied for this loan, to help him pay for his university and achieve his dreams.

loans.use: pay his college tuition

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es:
Gloria es una madre soltera de 56 años, vive junto a dos hijos, uno que aun depende de ella y se encuentra cursando el colegio. Habitan en una humilde casa en Santo Domingo de los Colorados.
Gloria es una señora muy dedicada a su negocio, ella vende cosméticos y ropa, lo realiza de manera ambulante, ya con los años de experiencia tiene clientela fija. Gracias a estos ingresos ella ha podido mantener a su familia y darles la educación a sus hijos.
Gloria ya es clienta de Fundación Alternativa, tuvo el apoyo de kiva en su primer crédito, pudo crecer un poco en su negocio, aprovechó productos en precios bajos y se capitalizó; ahora con el dinero podrá seguir comprando más mercadería en oferta para mejorar sus ganancias, para con estos ingresos seguir apoyando a sus hijos y poco a poco ir mejorando su vivienda que ahora necesita un cambio de techo por las fuertes lluvias.
texts.en:
Gloria is a single mother who is 56 years old. She lives with two children. One of them still depends on her and attends school. They live in a humble home in Santo Domingo de los Colorados.

Gloria is a woman very dedicated to her business. She sells cosmetics and clothing, as a street vendor, and through years of experience has a steady clientele base. Thanks to these earnings she could support her family and provide an education for her children.

Glorida is already a customer of Fundación Alternativa. She had the support of Kiva in her first loan and her business could grow a little taking advantage of products at good prices and was capitilized. Now with the money she can contiue buying more merchandise. on sale to improve her earnings. With this income she will continue supporting her children and little by little improve her home that now needs roof repairs because of heavy rains.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise on sale to improve her earnings

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en: Racheal is successfully running a poultry business. She started with 50 birds and upon receiving the loan she increased to 100 birds. She has a current capacity of 100 birds every three weeks. With the profits, Racheal managed to pay for her continued education. She is looking forward to increasing her sales volume by ordering more birds, from 100 to 200 birds per batch. With the Kiva loan, Rachel intends to make bulk purchases of chicks, vaccines, and feeds to boost production volumes and thus increase profits

loans.use: expand her poultry business

loans.name: Forget

texts.en:
Forget is 21 years old and she lives in Mudzi district of Zimbabwe.  She is involved in the mobilization of communities to study and improve their academic levels. 

With the first Kiva loan she received, Forget re-stocked her stall at the flea market with quality clothes that she ordered from outside the country. This gave her a competitive advantage since she was the only one at the market who had these types of clothes. She managed to pay for her traveling documents from the profits and pay school fees for her brother. 

Forget is looking forward to opening a boutique in her community. She will use this loan to purchase clothes for resell in the boutique.

Forget is a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the well-being of students by enhancing their learning environment.

loans.use: to purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits and t-shirts

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan es un joven emprendedor, su objetivo es iniciar su negocio de servicio de soda para lo cual necesita de un préstamo de quinientos setenta mil colones (570.000) para comprar los utensilios necesarios y abrir su negocio. El está muy contento de tener esta oportunidad de financiamiento .
texts.en: Juan is a young entrepreneur and his goal is to start his own business, a small restaurant. For this he needs a loan of seventy thousand colones (570.000) to purchase necessary kitchen utensils and open his business. He is very happy to have this financing opportunity.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils for his small restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house and save on utility bills

loans.name: Ruhangez

texts.ru: Эту милую девушку зовут Рухангез. Ей 30 лет. Она пока не замужем и не имеет детей. Но Рухангез мечтает о семье и надеется, что скоро будет гулять с детьми по улицам. Рухангез работает дома. Она принимает заказы на шитье одежды. Этой деятельностью одна зарабатывает себе на жизнь. Рухангез решила сделать ремонт в доме, но оказалось, что ее собственных средств не хватает на хороший ремонт. Она приняла решение, что будет брать кредит. На заемные средства она купит стройматериалы и обновит интерьер. С обновлением интерьера и ауры в доме может и жизнь Рухангез измениться в лучшую сторону.
texts.en: This sweet young lady is called Ruhangez. She is 30 years old. She is as yet unmarried and does not have children. But Ruhangez dreams of a family and hopes that soon she will be walking around the streets with children. Ruhangez works from home. She takes orders for sewing clothing. She earns her living from this activity. Ruhangez decided to carry out a renovation at home, but it turned out that she does not have enough of her own funds for a good renovation. She has taken the decision that she will take out a loan. She will buy construction materials with the borrowed funds and will update the interior. With an update of the interior, Ruhangez's life and even the aura in the home will change for the better.

loans.use: to renovate her home.

loans.name: María Isabel Marisol

texts.es: Doña María tiene un local en el que vende "Ropa americana", solicita un préstamo de $ 500 para comprar más producto, lo cual le permitirá incrementar sus ventas y obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en: María has a shop where she sells "American clothing". She is requesting a loan of $500 to buy more product which will allow her to increase her sales and obtain greater income.

loans.use: to buy two bales of American clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts, such as tyres and wheel rings, for repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle, so as to offer better and faster transportation services.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 37 years old, married to Lydia and supports a family of 3 children. He has been operating in the motorcycle transport the last 6 years earning KES 10,000 per month.

Evans has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk with his motorcycle for more income gain. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to buy land for rental construction. 
His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable with large rental estates.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk with his motorcycle for more income gain.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 49 years old and married with four children. With two children still in school, Delia works very hard to provide for them.

Delia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like detergent soap, coffee, canned goods, etc. to sell.

Delia has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, coffee, canned goods, etc. 

In the future, Delia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like detergent soap, coffee, canned goods etc. to sell

loans.name: Dewane

texts.en:
Dewane is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Dewane is 35 years old and has three children who are in school.

Dewane has a food vending business in the Philippines. Dewane requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Dewane has been in this business for three years. In the future, Dewane would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Marcelyn

texts.en:
Marcelyn is 33 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Marcelyn is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers for her farm.

Marcelyn has been farming sugarcane for 2 years and also earns additional income from buy and sell charcoal.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Evelia

texts.en:
Evelia is 58 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Evelia has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Evelia requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional raw materials like abaca fiber, etc. for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Evelia has been in this business for 42 years. Evelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials like abaca fiber, for her weaving business

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Memunatu. She is married and has two children, aged 13 and 8 years.

In 2004, Memunatu established her pharmacy (drugs) business. She began her business because she did not further her education. Her business is located in a city centre, and her main customers are both men and women. Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, she earns about Le 700,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Memunatu requires a loan in order to buy more drugs for resale. She hopes that this loan will support her to increase the level of her additional income.

In the future, Memunatu plans to build a shop for more business expansion. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drugs for resale.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is a 21-year-old businesswoman living in Shurugwi district of Zimbabwe. She has had a business selling clothes.  She used the first loan that she received to make bulky purchases. During her spare time, Sharon volunteers at schools within her community. 

With the requested loan from Kiva, Sharon plans to expand her clothing business. With the additional profits she intends to pay for school fees for her siblings.

loans.use: To expand her clothing business.

loans.name: Naume

texts.en:
Naume is a 21-year-old, businesswoman living in Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully selling clothing, purses, and plastic sandals. With the requested Kiva loan, Naume intends to make bulk purchases of clothes to boost her sales and profits. With those additional profits she hopes to expand into a retail business, create employment within her community, and provide for her siblings. 

She had a first loan that she successfully repaid.

When she is not working at her business, Naume serves as a Cama (a network of graduates) member volunteering to work in local schools.

loans.use: To expand her clothing business for better sales and profits

loans.name: Las Trabajadoras Group

texts.en:
The Mission Statement of Friendship Bridge states that the organization will “provide microcredit and education to Guatemalan women so that they can create their own solutions to poverty for themselves, their families and their communities.” The combination of small loans and education is called “Microcredit Plus” and a very effective one for the over 22,000 clients of the organization.

The Trust Bank, “Las Trabajadoras” or “Hard-working Women” is beginning their very first loan cycle funded by KIVA investors. This is a very exciting time for the eleven women who are members of the group that is located in Chichicastenango, a fertile area that has orchards of peaches, plums and apples. 

Juana is a member of the group who is a single mother with one daughter. She was only able to attend school until the 4th grade. In spite of this, she is determined to be a successful businesswoman and provide for her daughter.  Juana has a traditional textile business and creates beautiful blouses called “huipiles” as well as woven tube skirts called “cortes”.

Each week, she delivers 5-7 “cortes” to be sold. Actually, she is quite familiar with the traditional textile business as she started as a child. Juana is requesting a loan that she plans to use to buy high quality thread in various colors and additional “cortes” that she can offer her clients. Her goal is to have a solid clientele that she can consistently sell her textiles to.

Nearly 80% have their children between the ages of 7-13 enrolled in school. At their monthly meetings, a Facilitator from Friendship Bridge shares useful information with the women about everyday subjects like nutrition, health, and self-esteem. The ladies learn to effectively manage their small loans as they learn about budgeting, marketing and customer service. The Facilitator shares this teaching time with the women speaking their own indigenous language and uses drawings, pictures and games. 

Kiva investors are valuable partners in this effort. We look forward to providing a follow-up report soon on Juana and her hard-working friends in the Trust Bank “Las Trabajadoras”. Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: To buy high quality thread in various colors and additional “cortes” that she can offer in her textile business.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 33 years old, married and blessed with 2 children. He has been operating in the motorcycle transport the last 3 years and it has been profitable. 

Benson has applied for his first loan of KES25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to to buy spare parts to repair and service his motorcycle and keep it in good condition and hopes this will enable him to serve more customers. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and also start dairy farming by buying a dairy cow. His future hopes and dreams are to expand his business, be financially stable and invest in rental estates.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to repair and service his motorcycle and keep it in good condition and hopes this will enable him to serve more customers.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.ru: Наргис заботливая жена и мать. У нее четверых детей. Старшая дочка замужем и живет отдельно. Младшие дети живут вместе родителям, и они учатся в школе. Наргизе 42 лет. Она работает уборщицей в городской больнице.  Наргиса любить свою семью и рани них трудится. К сожалению, сейчас ее муж болеет. Наргис очень переживает о муже. Она должна купить лекарство для лечения мужа. Но у Наргизе нет денежных средств для приобретения лекарство. Она вынуждена взять кредит для лекарство. Наргис верить в Вас и на Вашу поддержку. Она нуждается на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Nargis is a loving wife and mother. She has four children. Her eldest daughter is married and lives separately. The younger children live together with their parents, and they go to school. Nargis is 42 years old. She works as a cleaner at the city hospital.

Nargis loves her family and works hard for it. Unfortunately her husband is currently sick. Nargis is very worried about her husband. She needs to purchase medicine for his treatment. However, she does not have money for buying the medicine. She needs a loan for it.

Nargis trusts in you and your support. She needs your help.

loans.use: to purchase medicine for her husband's treatment

loans.name: Karina Gisselle

texts.es: Karina con esfuerzo propio está construyendo su vivienda, sin embargo para concluirla necesita de un préstamo de $ 250, con este dinero comprará el material necesario para techar la vivienda y realizar otros detalles de la misma.
texts.en:
Through her own efforts Karina is building her house, but in order to finish it she needs a loan of $250.00. 

With this money she will buy the necessary supplies to put a roof on the house and take care of similar repairs.

loans.use: to buy materials in order to put a roof on her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified seeds and fertilizers to improve his productivity.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman, with 2 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a poultry business where she sells chicken and eggs. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. 

She says her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more poultry. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more poultry for a greater income

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 57 years old, married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Edna has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of clothes to sell.

Edna has been in this business for two years. In the future, Edna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ginalyn is 32 years old and has two children who are in school.

Ginalyn has a abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Ginalyn requested a PHP 19000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her weaving business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ginalyn has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Ginalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her abaca weaving business

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 20-year-old entrepreneur from Mudzi District of Zimbabwe. She operates a store where she sells sugar, washing soap, cotton wool and body creams. Caroline cites her mother as the inspiration for her business because her mother supported all of the children in the family.  With the requested loan, she plans to expand to selling clothes also in order to increase profits. 

With the additional profits, Caroline would like to pay school fees for her siblings. She received a first loan that helped in boosting her business and she successfully repaid it

Caroline also teaches life skills as a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide.

loans.use: To expand her general store retail business

loans.name: Deisi Angelica

texts.es:
Deisi es madre soltera, tiene 35 años y vive junto a su hijo en la ciudad de Santo Domingo
Deisi es una madre muy trabajadora más aun por el hecho de no contar con el padre de su hijo desde hace años, ella se ha esforzado mucho por salir adelante. Actualmente tiene un salón de belleza, adquirió experiencia en una institución donde pudo aprender todo lo que ahora sabe, es una profesional en la rama de la belleza; ha ido adquiriendo poco a poco todo lo que ahora tiene, es un local muy agradable y cuenta ya con varias clientas, incluso tiene una chica quien le ayuda en el manicure mientras ella realiza cortes, tintes y masajes.
Deisi solicita el crédito para poder comprar una silla de pedicura muy necesaria para su negocio, además desea comprar más tintes ya que si compra al por mayor recibe mayor descuento y desea aprovechar para poder tener más ganancias y seguir apoyando a su hijo en los estudios secundarios.
Deisi afgradece a KIVA por la oportunidad brindada y por apoyar su idea es seguir creciendo como microempresaria para en un futuro no muy lejano ser muy reconocida y así poder dar trabajo a jóvenes emprendedoras que también deseen superarse.
texts.en:
Deisi is 35 years old and is a single mother who lives with her son in the city of Santo Domingo.  She is a hardworking mother, especially because her son's father has not been in contact with them for years.  She has made a big effort to move forward.  

She currently owns a beauty salon.  She got experience in another salon where she could learn everything she knows now.  She is a beauty professional and slowly acquired everything she has now.  Her shop is very pleasant and has many customers.  She also has an employee who does manicures while Deisi does haircuts, dyes, and massages.  

Deisi is requesting this loan to purchase a pedicure chair for her business, as well as to purchase more dyes, since she receives a better discount for purchasing in bulk.  She wants to take advantage of that so she can earn more profits and continue supporting her son with his high school education.  

Deisi is grateful to Kiva for the opportunity provided and for supporting her idea to continue growing as a small business owner so that in the not so distant future, she can be recognized and provide work for young entrepreneurs who also want to succeed.

loans.use: to purchase a pedicure chair to gain more customers and succeed together with her son.

loans.name: Revai

texts.en:
Revai is into buying and selling hardware items and clothes. The loan she received last year was used to increase stock in the shop. She is enjoying the business, since fewer people venture into hardware and therefore, she has less competition. With the loan, she managed to diversify her flea market into a hardware shop. She also managed to pay examination fees for the supplemented subjects.

The profits have also seen her manage to meet her living costs and those of her family. She is looking forward to passing her subjects and furthering her education and also to open a bigger shop.

With the requested loan, Revai will purchase more hardware items in bulk to reduce transport costs.

loans.use: to purchase more hardware items in bulk to reduce transport costs.

loans.name: Tierra De Los Duraznos Group

texts.en:
The ten women who are members of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Tierra de los Duraznos” or “Land of the Peaches” live in beautiful Chichicastenango in the Guatemalan State of Quiche.  These ten women are very excited because they have successfully completed their first KIiva loan cycle.  Thanks to the generous support of Kiva investors one year ago, they were able to receive their first loan which helped expand their small businesses and provided extra income to support their families.  Since they were so successful in their first loan cycle, they are now asking for a second loan cycle in order to expand their businesses even more. 

 One of the members of “Tierra de los Duraznos” is Pascuala who was elected Secretary for the new loan cycle.  She is a single woman but has the responsibility of providing income for her home and family of five including her parents.   Pascuala has a textile business and sells the typical clothing of the area including blouses (huipiles), belts (fajas) and wrap-around skirts (cortes) that are worn in Western Guatemala.  She buys and sells the clothing from the areas surrounding Chichicastenango.  She also makes some of the clothing.  Since the demand for her clothing is so great, she has employed 10 other people who do piece work and in this way, helps these ten people support their families!  She pays them per piece.  Pascuala is asking for new loan in order to buy thread in bulk because this lowers the initial cost of making the piece, thus, increasing her profit.

Pascuala shares her feelings about the loan: “Thanks to my loan, I have been able to generate extra income that has permitted my family and me to cover the costs of our basic needs and has made it possible for us to look forward to a better quality of life!”

The ten women of “Tierra de los Duraznos” are very grateful to Kiva investors for showing new confidence in them and helping them to develop their small businesses.  Thank you for your kindness and generosity!

loans.use: to buy thread and materials in bulk, to lower costs

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru:
Саида занимается животноводством у себя во дворе дома. Она занимается этими делами более 2 лет. 
Саида проживает в районе Шахритус, вместе свекровью, тестю и сыном. Тестю 73 года. Свекровью 65 лет. Мужу 28 лет, а сыну 6 лет. В животноводстве Саида выращивает скота одна. Ее муж находится на заработках  вдали от семьи.  Саида в основном разводит молодых телят и в дальнейшем после откорма перепродает их на скотном рынке. В настоящий момент Саида просит кредит, чтобы купить несколько молодых телят и увеличить поголовье скота и за счет этого увеличить доход от животноводческой деятельности. В будущем Саида планирует расширить животноводческую деятельность.
texts.en:
Saida rears animals in her yard at home. She has been engaged in this business for over two years.

Saida lives in the Shahrituz region together with her mother-in-law, father-in-law and son. Her father-in-law is 73 years old. Her mother-in-law is 65 years old. Her husband is 28, and her son is 6. For the animal business, Saida rears cattle on her own. Her husband is away working far from the family. Saida mainly rears young calves and then in the future after fattening them up resells them at the livestock market. At the present time Saida is asking for a loan in order to buy a few young calves and increase the size of her herd. She will thus increase her income from the livestock rearing business. In future Saida plans to expand her livestock rearing business.

loans.use: to buy a few young calves.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Mrs Thanh is 42 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture, farming food for more than 10 years.
Thanh lives in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover this region often suffered by natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea.
 
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having clean water to drink. She is requesting a loan to purchase a clean water filter.
In 2015, Thanh joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. 

Thanh has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Thanh hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a clean water filter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used shoes for resale

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 39 years old and married to Mary. He supports five children. He has been selling shoes and sandals in the market for the last five years. The business earns him KES 12,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase more stocks of shoes for sale to clients in the market to meet client needs. 

He plans to use gained profit to repay the loan and expand his business sector. His hopes are to be financially stable and to be a rich merchant.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes for resale

loans.name: Cận

texts.en:
Cận is a 34-year-old married man who has worked in agriculture for 7 years.  He lives in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

His family is a low-income household in the village, and this region often suffers from natural disasters ands storms because it is near the sea.
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns him is the latrine is not hygienic. He requests a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick, and material to build a toilet.

This is Cận's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

Cận hopes to build a new house, to have a business that does well, and to make enough money to provide for his children.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick, and items to build a toilet.

loans.name: Hiền

texts.en:
Hiền is  a 30-year-old married woman who has had a tailor business for  10 years.
Hiền lives in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in the village, and this region often suffers from natural disasters and storms because it is near the sea. 

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having clean water to drink. She requests a loan to purchase a clean water filter machine.

In 2005, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business and has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

Hiền hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her children, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a clean water filter machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase groundnuts, garrie, beans, and rice.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 34 years old, married to Mary and supports 5 children. He does motorcycle transport business and has been in this business for 6 years. He is also a dairy farmer and it has been profitable. 

He will be using the loan to buy spare parts to repair and service his motorcycle and keep it in good condition and hopes this will enable him to serve more customers.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and also buy a dairy cow and get milk to sell to his customers. His future hopes and dreams are to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to repair and service his motorcycle and keep it in good condition so as to serve more customers and make more income.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 51-year-old  married woman. 

In 2009, Alice established her bowls, baskets, and cool-man business. She began her business because she wants to support her husband. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are adults. She works six days a week and 12 hours-a-day to earn  1,600,000 SLL every month.

 She would like 5,000,000 SLL to buy dozens of plastic buckets, bowls, flasks and baskets. She hopes that this loan will increase her stock and generate more income.  Alice was unable to rent a shop and get an assistant but she bought some building materials. 

In the future, Alice plans to travel to neighboring countries to buy her stock and develop her  land. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for flasks, cool man,  and bowls

loans.name: Nhom 6 - Khanh An Group

texts.en:
The, 42 , works in agricultural production and embroidery. Her husband died 10 years ago so she is living with her daughter. They earn a monthly income of about $31. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 2000. 

Her family is in an economic hardship situation and they don't have a sanitary latrine yet. With this loan, she and nine of her peers will each build a hygienic toilet at home that will improve their family's and the community's quality of life. 

With ten households making a commitment, this neighborhood will be able to enjoy better health by avoiding many of the common infections and diseases associated with the unsafe latrines currently being used.  

In this photo, The is pictured first from the right, second row.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine, with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Nhom 4 - Khanh An Group

texts.en:
Hue, pictured first from the right, is 54 years old and a member of Nhom 4-Khanh An Group. She works in the agricultural sector and earns approximately $21. Her family is classified as a poor family. Due to the lack of funds, her household does not have a sanitary latrine yet. 

With a portion of this loan, she will be able to gain access to latrine hardware facilities which include a hygienic septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap. Those facilities would also help her family improve their health, living conditions, and personal safety, in addition to providing convenience, cleanliness, and privacy for all family members, while contributing to the environmental health of the community.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine, with a device for hand-washing with soap.

loans.name: Nhom 7 - Khanh An Group

texts.en:
Hoa, pictured first from the right, is 28 years old. She works in agricultural production and earns a monthly income of approximately $21. She is married and has 2 small children. Currently, her household does not have a sanitary latrine. However, as a member of the local Women's Union since 2007, she recently joined a campaign to improve the community's sanitation and hygiene. 

With this loan, Hoa will use the funds to build a hygienic toilet in her house. This will improve the living conditions for her family members by preventing diseases commonly associated with unhygienic toilets and contribute to the sanitary improvement in her community.

With the help of local Women's Union in this campaign, Thrive Network can ensure the repayment rate up to 99%.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine, with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: This is 41 year-old Isatu. She is married and has four children aged 22, 17, 12 and 4 years old. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her to be fostered. In 2004, Isatu established her used clothing business. Her business is located in the city centre and her main customers are mostly women. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 1,450,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 6,000,000 SLL. Isatu requires a loan in order to buy bales of used men's and women's underwear, mixed shirts, blouses and children's dresses for resale. She hopes that this loan will support her to increase her stock and generate more profit. In the future, Isatu plans to open a shop, to become an importer and send her children abroad to study. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bales of used men's and women's underwear, mixed shirts, blouses and children's dresses.

loans.name: Nhom 8 - Khanh An Group

texts.en:
Luyen, 38, works as a farmer and makes about $23 monthly so building the new bathroom is something she couldn't afford. Luyen is married and has two children still in school. 

Currently, their family uses an unsafe, unhygienic latrine. However, her local Women's Union, of which she has been a member since 2010, has recently started a campaign to improve sanitation and hygiene. With this loan, she can purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a septic tank latrine with a hand-washing device to improve the family's living conditions and contribute to the environmental protection. 

In the photo, Luyen is pictured first from the right. With the help of local Women Union in this campaign, Thrive Network can ensure the repayment rate up to 99%

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine, with a device for hand-washing with soap.

loans.name: Nhom 10 - Khanh An Group

texts.en:
Vui, 60, works as a farmer and earns a monthly income of about $26. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1988. Her family is classified as a poor family and could not afford to have a sanitary latrine. A portion of Nhom 10 - Khanh An's loan will help Vui as well as other group members build a septic tank and a hand-washing device with soap to improve living conditions, safeguard the health of her family, and protect the environment.

In this photo, she is in blue, pictured in the middle of the first row. With the help of local Women Union in this campaign, Thrive Network can ensure the repayment rate up to 99%.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine, with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Nhom 9 - Khanh An Group

texts.en:
Thoi is fifty-seven and works as a farmer with a monthly income of about $26. She lives with her two sons who are attending vocational school. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1996. Thoi is fully aware of the fact that using a degraded double-pit latrine has the risks of potential adverse effects on the health of her family members, her community, and environmental contamination. However, she has not yet been able to construct a septic tank latrine due to a shortage of funds. 

With a portion of this loan, she will be able to buy materials to build a hygienic septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap. Those facilities would help her family improve their health and living conditions, while affording safety for them. In addition, this will provide convenience, cleanliness, and privacy for all family members, while contributing to the environmental protection of the community.

In this photo, Thoi is pictured first from the right.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine, with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.ru: Олимчон молодой предприниматель из годка Турсунзаде. Ему 21 год. Он 3 года назад начал животноводческую деятельность. Олимчон с самого детства был ответственным человеком и всегда хотел стать самостоятельным и финансово устойчивым человеком. Так как найти работу в его родном краю очень сложно и большое количество жителей занимаются только сельскохозяйственными деятельностями, и в выборе бизнеса у него не возникли вопросы. Он стал заниматься животноводством, как и его соседи и односельчане. Но он уверен, что его бизнес будет процветать лучше и больше чем у других, потому что он вкладывает больше усилие в свое дело. Олимчон за 3 года набрался хорошего опыта в этой сфере и решил, что пора расширять бизнес. На заемные деньги он купит еще несколько голов скотин и корма для них. Олимчон уверен в своей удаче, и его обязательно ждет успех.
texts.en:
Olimjon is a young businessman from the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 21 years old. Three years ago he started a livestock breeding business. From his very childhood, Olimjon was a responsible person and always wanted to be independent and have financial stability. 

As finding work was very difficult in Olimjon's region, and as most people worked with agriculture, he did not question his choice of business. He started working with livestock breeding, just like his neighbors and his fellow villagers. However, he was sure that his business would thrive more and be better than the others, because he puts more effort into his work. 

Olimjon picked up a lot of experience in this area in three years, and decided that it was time to expand the business. For the loan amount he will purchase some livestock and livestock feed for them. Olimjon is confident in his success, and success is definitely awaiting him.

loans.use: to purchase some livestock and feed for them

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities and earns money for doing them to support her family. 

As a microfinance member of PMPC, she seeks financial help in the form of a loan, which she will use to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell. 

In the future, Concepcion wishes to become a supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es: La señora Erlinda es mayor de edad, vive con su pareja en el área rural en una casa rustica de adobe,  apenas cuenta con servicios básicos pero con algunas restricciones. Ambos solamente alcanzaron a estudiar hasta el nivel primario, la actividad principal a la que se dedican es la agricultura y venta de sus productos, de ahí generan sus mayores ingresos económicos para sustentar a sus tres hijos y pagarles sus estudios. Los productos que siembran y comercializan son: papa en mayor cantidad, haba en vaina, cebolla, avena  y otros cultivos  en pequeña cantidad que son para consumo propio. La señora Erlinda tiene la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para la compra de abono orgánico y semilla así de esta manera continuará con su actividad agrícola para obtener más ingresos y seguir brindando el apoyo a sus hijos,  mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Erlinda is an adult and lives with her partner in a rural area in a house built from adobe.  They have basic utility services, with some restrictions.  She and her partner both only went to school through primary school.  

She works as a farmer and sells her products, which generates most of her income to support their three children and pay for their education.  She plants and sells potatoes, broad beans, onion, oats, and other crops in smaller quantities for her own consumption.  

Erlinda is requesting this loan to purchase manure and seeds so that she can continue her farming work to earn more income and continue supporting her children so she can improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase manure and seeds to continue her farming work and earn more income.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 25 years old, married to Richard, and supports four children. She has been practicing farming for the last six years, earning KES 9,000 per month. 

Grace has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy farm tools and inputs for more income gain.
 
She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children to high levels. Her future hopes and plans are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy farm tools and inputs for use for more income gain.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to purchase materials like wood, nails, bamboo for the repair of her fishing boat and buy gasoline for her fishing business.

Alicia has been in this business for 34 years. Alicia earns more income from nipa roofing making.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase materials like wood, nails, bamboo for the repair of her fishing boat and buy gasoline

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is a 34-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Michelle has a general store business in the Philippines. Michelle requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for three years. In the future, Michelle would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Neneh

texts.en:
Neneh is a 73-year-old married woman with 5 children who are 30, 25, 20, 15 and 12 years old.

In 1999, Neneh established her palm oil, beans, and rice business. Her business is located in the city centre and her main customers are  women. She works 6 days a week and 11 hours a day to  earn about 1150000 LE every month. 

She would like 500,0000 LE to buy more bags of rice, beans, and gallons of palm oil. 

She hopes that this loan will enable her to buy home products and generate more profit. In the future, Neneh plans to expand the business by adding other items.  

In the future, Neneh plans to develop her piece of land and educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, and gallons of palm oil.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 30-year-old married woman with three children who are 9, 3 and 1 year old. 

In 2011, Mary established her food business as a way to complement her husband's efforts to provide for the family. She works six days a week and 11 hours a day to earn about 1,000,000 SLL  every month. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL to buy bags of sugar, garri, crates of drinks, and pure water. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 500,000 SLL. 

In the future, Mary plans to rent a table in a central market to continue her business. She is hard working and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, onion and cooking oil.

loans.name: Alpha S

texts.en:
Alpha is a 37-year-old married man with a 3-year-old child.  

In 2003, Alpha established his rice, flour, and soft drinks business because he saw it as a source of survival. He works six days a week and ten hours a day to earn 1,560,000 SLL every month. 

Alpha would like 6,000,000 SLL to buy more goods for his shop.   He hopes that this loan will help him to increase his profit margin.   Alpha has completed his building project.  In the future, Alpha plans to buy another piece of land and send his child to school. 

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more goods for his shop.

loans.name: Martha Luz

texts.en:
Martha is a 57-year-old married woman who has three children. For many years, Martha has had a restaurant business where she cooks dishes that her patrons love. She is well-known for her cooking, and that makes her feel great.

Martha's restaurant business has allowed her to give her family everything that they need, but she has big dreams. She doesn’t want to stop until she sees her business become a famous restaurant in the city. This is why she needs a loan to buy a bakery showcase and other inputs for her restaurant.

Martha wants to make her restaurant better by improving it. This is why she is working hard to make more profits and accomplish her goals. With the loan, she will be one step closer to getting what she wants and making her family happy.

loans.use: to buy a bakery showcase and other inputs for her restaurant.

loans.name: Leonel De Jesus

texts.en:
For Leonel life hasn’t been easy, but at 23 years old he doesn’t stop for that. He keeps fighting to give his family a good quality life. He has two children, one girl and one boy who are eight and seven years old respectively, and whom he loves very much.

He was displaced by violence so he lives now in Medellín. He has a business selling fruit, and is very recognized for that because people love to buy some mangoes from him, because not only does the product come with great quality, but the service is excellent. He wants to expand his fruit stand by buying more items like more fruits so he can offer new products, and that way he can get more clients and give his family a better life.

He dreams big so he wishes he can give his family a house where they can live comfortably and protected. That wish can come true just with the help of a loan that can make the difference in his life and help him and his family accomplish all their dreams.

loans.use: buy more items like more fruits.

loans.name: Zoila Nicolasa

texts.en:
Zoila has a big and a new dream to start her own business, so she can provide for her family, her three children whom she hopes will continue with the business she is about to start and keep it growing.

She has had experience in selling clothes which is why she wants to capitalize on it with a loan so she can start buying products to sell. She hopes one day she can open her own stand and give jobs to more people who dream about advancing in life and improving their economy.

She is an entrepreneur and wants to see her business grow as much as it can, so she can serve as an example for her children and more people who dream about starting their own business. Her wishes can come true just with a little help.

loans.use: buy products and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Saul Antonio

texts.en:
Saul lives in Barbosa, Antioquia and is 30 years old. He has two sons who are 8 and 4 years old, and are the motor of his life. He works really hard for his family, to provide and give the best to them.

Saul breeds cattle and has a farm of pigs, but to improve his business he needs a lot of money because it is really expensive. That’s why he needs a loan so he can buy more pigs, which he can fatten and then sell, and improve the pigsty where they live. 

He dreams of giving his family the best life he can give, to pay for his sons' education, and to provide for his family. He wants to earn better profits; that’s why he is into investing into his business. With a little help, he can reach his dreams and make them come true.

loans.use: to buy more pigs

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro is just 19 years old but he is a smart and hard working man, who dreams big and wishes for great things for him and his family.  The needs that his family have has made him start his own business that consists of repairs to cars and motorcycles.

All that he knows, he taught himself, and since he was a little boy he dreamed with having this kind of business because he loves vehicles.  So now he wants to improve and make better profits, to have more clients.  He needs a loan so he can buy some oil for different kind of motorcycles so he stocks up and can sell more. 

He would like to improve his house and expand his business place, so he´s a loan away to achieve this dreams, so with a little help he could make a great life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy oils for different kind of motorcycles, for use at his repair shop

loans.name: Jaylord

texts.en:
Jaylord is 23 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married with one infant child.

Jaylord earns a living as the operator of a single-sitter motorcab for hire. He is also engaged in the motorcycle spare parts trading business. He’s been in the spare parts trading business for almost two months. He earns approximately Php 5,000 from these businesses, and this amount is so helpful to meet their needs.

Jaylord has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stocks of tires, tubes and other spare parts for sale.

Jaylord became a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Jaylord hopes to expand his motorcycle spare parts and accessories business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of tires, tubes and other spare parts.

loans.name: Mujeres Sembradoras Group

texts.en:
In the Western Highlands of Guatemala, there is a very colorful town called “Chichicastenango” where the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Mujeres Sembradoras” or Women who Plant” is located.
