The members of the group have an average age of 41 years with a majority not being able to read nor write.  However, they all want to better themselves through their small businesses and their monthly educational trainings.

This is the case of Josefa who is 48 years old.  She is looking for a way to get a more prosperous future for her family and provide the opportunities for her four children to have an education. Josefa saw that the income of her husband, who is a day laborer, was not enought to cover the expenses of their home and family. 

She decided to begin a textile business making the clothing that is typical of Chichicastenango.  She also began an animal husbandry business and currently, two bulls are being fattened for market.  In order for her business to grow, Josefa is requesting a loan that she hopes will be funded by Kiva investors.  With the largest percentage of the loan, Josefa will buy a variety of quality threads for her textile business. A smaller percentage will be used to buy food to continue fattening her bulls so that she can sell them.
 
Besides the loan, Josefa and her friends in the Trust Bank have monthly meetings with a Friendship Bridge Facilitator who gives educational trainings on a variety of useful subjects. The women of “Mujeres Sembradoras” have the opportunity to learn about a variety of topics like women’s and children’s health, self-esteem, women’s empowerment, business management and customer relations.  Thank you Kiva investors for helping to provide the women with opportunities to grow and prosper!!!

loans.use: To purchase a variety of quality threads for her textile business

loans.name: Amigos De Esther Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por  5 personas responsables a distintas actividades comerciales. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “AMIGOS DE ESTHER” una de ellas es la Sra. Nora  de 56 años divorciada  y con 3 hijos.Se dedica ya hace 4 años a los bordados y tejidos en un pequeño local  todos los días con el mérito de salir adelante y así poder pagar el colegio de sus hijos, Con el fruto de su esfuerzo. Ha logrado mejorar su negocio. su mayor deseo es que sus hijos sean profesionales es por eso  que trabaja mucho. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más mercadería (telas broches hilos ETC) y así poder tener más ingresos. Se encuentra sentada y se le distingue con una chompa color negro. se despide con un abrazo a Kiva y Edaprospo y  agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en:
The group is made up of five responsible people who each have their different businesses. This is the “AMIGOS DE ESTHER” communal bank. One of the members is Nora. She is 56 years old, divorced and has three children. For four years she has been working every day making embroidery and weaving in a small shop in an effort to get ahead and be able to pay for the education of her children.

With the gains from her labors she has managed to improve her business. Her greatest wish is for her children to become professionals and she works hard for this reason. She will invest the awarded loan in buying more merchandise (fabric, fasteners, thread, etc.) and be able to generate more income. She is seated and is wearing the black sweater. She says good-bye with a hug for Kiva and Edaprospo and is grateful for the loan that makes her progress possible.

loans.use: to buy fabric, fasteners, thread, etc.

loans.name: Reynelda

texts.en: Reynelda is juggling a business and supervision of the renovation of their home. Reynelda hopes to live comfortably with a house of good roofing, supported by her loan of Php 7,000. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Simona

texts.es: La señora Simona de estado civil casada, alcanzó a estudiar la primaria, vive en el área rural junto a su esposo en una casa de adobe misma que carece de servicios básicos, la señora Simona es una persona trabajadora y con mucho optimismo trabaja día a día junto a su esposo para obtener ingresos económicos. Se dedica primordialmente a la agricultura,  en esta actividad lleva muchos años, donde produce y comercializa. Lo que obtienen lo lleva a la venta en ferias provinciales de la región y pueblos aledaños, los productos principales que siembra son papa en mayor cantidad, oca, avena y otros en menor cantidad generalmente para consumo propio. La señora Simona se ve en la necesidad de solicitar el préstamo para la compra de insumos para ampliar su producción, continuar con la comercialización y obtener mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Simona is married and attended primary school.  She lives in a rural area with her husband in an adobe house that has basic utilities. Simona is a hardworking person and works beside her husband every day with great optimism in order to earn money. 

She primarily works in agriculture. She has done this for many years, and she grows and sells products. She takes their harvest to provincial markets and neighboring villages. They mainly grow potatoes, and also grow oca (a vegetable similar to the potato) and oats. They also grow other things in small quantities for personal consumption.

Simona finds it necessary to request a loan in order to purchase supplies to increase production, continue to sell products, and earn more money in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to increase production, continue to sell products, and earn more money in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Annabele

texts.en:
Annabele is 43 years old with one child who is in school, Annabele works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell.

Annabele has been in this business for 2 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is a 70-year-old widow with 3 children who are 35, 25 and 20 years old. She has 2 additional dependents who live with her and assist her in business. 

 In 1999, Kadiatu established her charcoal business which is located in the city centre. Her main customers are women. She works 6 days a week and 11 hours a day to earn 980,000 SLL every month. 

She would like 500,0000 SLL to buy more bags of charcoal. She hopes that this loan will help to generate more profit and improve her standard of living.

Kadiatu plans to develop her piece of land and to have another store.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Ruby Rosa

texts.en:
Ruby Rosa is a 35-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Ruby Rosa has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Ruby Rosa has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Ruby Rosa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of eleven children, Maribeth works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Maribeth is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy additional sack of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Maribeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sack of rice to sell for her business

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Diana works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Diana is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to  purchase additional fish to make dried fish for her dried fish making business.

Diana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: purchase additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Humu

texts.en:
Humu is a40-year-old Humu divorced woman with 4 children who are 22, 18, 13 and 5 years old. She has 2 additional dependents, who live with her.  

In 2012, Humu established her grocery business,  located in the outskirt of the city. She works 6 days a week and 15 hours a day to earn about 1,198,000 SLL every month. 

She would like 5,000,000 SLL to buy cartons of milk, tin milk, sardines, foam, and crates of drinks.  She hopes that this loan will increase her business capital and profit.

In the future, Humu plans to open a shop, educate her children, and develop her piece of land. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cartons of  milk, tin milk, sardines, and foam.

loans.name: Casildo Manuel

texts.es:
Casildo a sus 42 años de edad ve su sueño cumplirse, el cual es ser una persona independiente y competitiva en el mercado, gracias a la incursión de la Corporación Interactuar en su vida, pudo lograr este sueño y montó una cría y venta de pollos en un corral de su casa. 

Por lo que hoy solicita un crédito que invertirá en la compra de pollos para la cría y alimento para los mismos. Es padre de 3 hijos a los que sueña poder pagarles una buena educación. Casildo  como buen padre siempre estará a su lado apoyándolos incondicionalmente, por eso esta tan determinado en triunfar en este nuevo proceso de su vida.
texts.en:
Casildo at his 42 years sees his dream fulfilled, which is to be an independent and competitive person on the market; thanks to the incursion of the Interactuar Corporation in his life, he could achieve this dream and set up, in the yard of his house, a hatchery of chickens that he sells.

Today, he requests a loan to buy chickens to breed and food for them. He is the father of three children and his dream is to pay a good education for them. Casildo, as a good father, always will be there to unconditionally support their children; that’s why he is so determined to succeed in this new process of his life.

loans.use: to buy chickens to breed and food for them

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is a 40-year-old married woman with  6 children who are 24, 20, 18, 15, 10 and 3 years old. 

In 1999, Hawa established her fabric and textiles business located in the city centre. She works 6 days a week and 11 hours a day to earn  980,000 SLL every month. She would like 5,000,000 SLL to buy bales of wax cotton. She hopes that this loan will increase her business capital. 

In the future, Hawa plans to develop her piece of land, educate her children, and improve the business.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bales of wax cotton.

loans.name: Claudia Andrea

texts.en:
Claudia is 35 years old and is the mother of one. She lives in Medellín and has a business making clothes that she sells to many clients. Her business is the only one around where she lives, because nobody else does it. She started it because she loves to do it and learned how by herself.

She needs a loan so she can improve her business by buying new inputs and so she can adapt the space where she works by getting some shelves. She dreams of giving her family a quality life and she intends to do it by improving her sales and increasing her customers. She wishes in the future to be able to offer jobs to more people who need it.

She can be helped to fulfill her dream with a loan, so with a little help her business can become successful and be an example for her family and everybody.

loans.use: buy inputs

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.en:
Claudia is a 27-year-old woman who has a business selling clothes that she inherited from her mother who was the person who taught her everything that she knows.

She lives in Medellín and wants to improve her business so she can provide a better quality of life for her family. She desires to sell more clothes but she doesn’t have the money to buy more. That’s why she’s asking for a loan so she can stock up on new clothes so her business can grow and be successful and provide better profits and get more clients.

A loan for Claudia not only will help her to stock up on what she needs, but will help her make her dreams come true, to turn her lack of capital into a well-organized business that will give her family everything that they need.

loans.use: stock up on new clothes to sell

loans.name: Maria Ofelia

texts.en:
María is a 63-year-old woman who has a food stand where she cooks and sell to different clients. She is widow but that hasn’t stopped her from working and going through life teaching her son how to behave and be responsible. 

She started her business because she loves to cook and some friend taught her to do it. She wants to improve her business by buying some inputs and a gas pipette that she needs to keep working, so she asked for a loan so she can keep her business and keep providing for her family.

She wishes to give her son the best education so he can triumph in life, and someday to open her own food place because she doesn’t have her own. She has big dreams that can turn real with a little help.

loans.use: to buy some inputs and a gas pipette

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.en:
Manuel is a 36-year-old married man who has an 8-year-old son. He owns a store where he sells all kind of groceries. This is the business that supports his family and lets him give his son a good education. 

Manuel ask for a loan because he wants to improve his store by buying more items to sell like liquor and food so he can offer a better assortment to all his clients. He dreams of seeing his store be around for many years, to be crowded with clients asking for his products and happy with the service he gives them.

He works really hard for all seven days of the week, eight hours per day, because he is very passionate about his job and about seeing it improve and get bigger and bigger.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like liquor and food

loans.name: Dario Antonio

texts.en:
Darío is a 59 years old man who lives in Bello and is the owner of his own business, that is a store where he sells different products like food, liquors and toiletries.  He is a very hard worker, he works all the 7 days for around 12 hours a day, not just to survive but because he loves what he does. 

Darío is asking for a loan because he wants to stock up so he can offer more products and expands his business.  He plans to buy a lot different things according to what clients have been asking for and he´s always into giving them the best quality in the products that his store sells. 

He wishes in the future have the opportunity to give jobs to more people to help them and to make his business grow, so he can make more profits and be more successful, with a little help and a loan he can accomplish what he wants.

loans.use: to buy food, liquors and toiletries

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es:
Luis es un productor de 54 años de edad que vive en la zona norte de Nicaragua. Vive con su esposa y su hijo, en su pequeña finca de 3.87 hectáreas de las cuales 2.46 son de café. Su principal actividad económica es el café, del cual ha dependido en los últimos 15 años. El mantenimiento oportuno de sus plantaciones de café y estar integrado al proceso de certificación comercio justo, le ha permitido disminuir los riesgos en este mercado.

La meta de Luis para este ciclo es obtener 70 quintales de café pergamino, siendo su principal reto disminuir la presencia de plagas y enfermedades que afectan al café. Para esto, él solicita un financiamiento que le permita garantizar las aplicaciones de insumos y fertilizantes en tiempo y forma, y así mantener bajo control este riesgo. Confía que su empeño y responsabilidad en su trabajo y con su familia, le ayudará lograr la meta propuesta.
texts.en:
Luis is a 54 year-old farmer who lives in the northern area of Nicaragua. He lives with his wife and son, in their small farm of 3.87 hectares, of which 2.46 are of coffee. His main work is in coffee production, which he has depended on for the past 15 years. The timely maintenance of his coffee plantation and being involved in the process of fair trade certification has allowed him to reduce risk in the market.

Luis' goal for this cycle is to obtain 70 quintals of coffee beans, and his main challenge is to reduce the presence of pests and diseases that affect the coffee. For this, he is requesting a loan that will allow him to provide applications of inputs and fertilizers in a timely manner, and therefore keep this risk under control. He is confident that his commitment and responsibility to his work and to his family will help him achieve this goal.

loans.use: to purchase inputs and fertilizers that will be applied to his coffee plants to reduce pests.

loans.name: Jeannine Raheriniaina

texts.fr:
Agée de 35 ans, Jeannine est une femme divorcée, et elle a un enfant de 11 ans qui est scolarisé dans une école catholique. Elle élève seule son enfant car son mari est parti et ne lui verse aucune pension. C'est une femme très courageuse et travailleuse.
Elle dirige un petit magasin général il y a maintenant 7 ans. Auparavant, elle était marchande des fruits et légumes dans une province très loin de la capitale. En plus de la périssabilité des marchandises, les voyages étaient fatigants et de temps en temps fastidieux, donc elle décidait d'ouvrir une épicerie et de laisser tomber le commerce de fruits et légumes. Le magasin se situe juste à côté de son domicile, comme ceci, elle peut s'occuper mieux de son enfant et être toujours avec lui.
Son objectif est de développer et améliorer autant que possible son affaire, pour pouvoir offrir à son fils une meilleure condition de vie et une meilleure éducation malgré l'absence de son père.
texts.en:
Jeannine, aged 35, is a divorced woman with an 11-year-old child, who is in Catholic school. Jeannine is raising her child alone, since her husband left and does not provide her with any pension at all. She is a very brave and hard-working woman. 

She has been selling a small general store for seven years now. In the past, she used to market fruit & vegetables in a province far from the capital. In addition to the perishable nature of her merchandise, the trips were tiring and demanding at times, so she decided to open a grocery store and let go of fruit & vegetables. The store is located right next to her home. In this way, she can take better care of her child and always have him near. 

Her goal is to develop and improve her business as much as possible to be able to provide her son the best living conditions and the best education despite the father’s absence.

loans.use: to purchase rice and dried foodstuff

loans.name: Sinikiwe

texts.en:
Sinikiwe is running a flea market where she sells clothes from the capital city. The first loan she received was used to increase stock on the grocery shop and is now double selling clothes and groceries. Her mother assists with selling at the flea market whilst she does mobile selling. Mobile selling has assisted her fight completion from other flea market owners. 

Her family is very proud of her because she is the first woman to own a business in her family. She is looking forward to supplement subjects failed and further her education. With the requested loan she would like to expand the business though purchasing of bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts to increase the amount of items she can sell.

loans.use: To purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits and T-shirts to increase the amount of items she can sell.

loans.name: Domoina Pascaline

texts.fr:
Domoina Pascaline est une jeune femme très dynamique, courageuse de 22 ans. Elle est mariée et son mari est marchand de différentes articles de premières nécessités. Ils ont deux adorables petits enfants de 6 et 3 ans et qui sont tous scolarisés actuellement.
Domoina Pascaline vend des sacs dame, pochettes et ballerines, il y a maintenant 6 ans, c'est à dire depuis la naissance de son premier enfant. Elle demande un prêt pour mieux ravitailler ses stocks de marchandises, diversifier les modèles des sacs et les pointures des ballerines afin d'améliorer son achalandage et attirer les clients.
Sa petite famille habite en ce moment dans une maison appartenant à sa mère et avec elle. De ce fait, les deux époux projettent d'acheter un terrain et construire  leur propre maison. Elle s'efforce toujours d'épargner davantage pour y arriver.
texts.en:
Domoina Pascaline, aged 22, is a very energetic young woman and courageous. She is married, and her husband is a merchant of different basic supplies. They have two adorable little children, aged 3 and 6, who are both currently in school. 

Domoina Pascaline has been selling women’s bags, clutches, and flat-heeled shoes for six years now, that is, since her first child was born. She is asking for a loan to resupply her inventory some more and to diversify the styles of bags and the sizes of flats, so as to improve her customer base and attract more customer. Her small family lives in her mother’s house with her at the moment. So, the couple plan to purchase a plot of land and build their own house. She is always striving to save more money to do so.

loans.use: to purchase women's bags, clutches, and flat-heeled shoes

loans.name: Carla

texts.en: Carla is 38 years old, is married and she is living with her parents in law. Carla is an employee at a dry cleaning place and her husband is a systems engineer.  Carla needs a loan to fix the roof at the place where she is living.  Carla hopes you can help her because the family has many expenses and the roof work is an emergency.   Carla is healthy and she is supported by her husband

loans.use: to fix the roof at the place where she is living

loans.name: Saylikhon

texts.ru: Сайлихон та женщина, которая пережила все, но осталась собой. Она смогла одна вырастит сына. Ему сейчас 22 года и находится заграницей. Сайлихон много лет работает портнихой. Опыта она набралась не мало. Сайлихон живет тем, что она принимает заказы на шитье. Многолетняя работа на швейной машинке естественно повлияла на работоспособность машинки. Так как прежде ее швейная машинка не работает, и не будет работать. Сайлихон хочет приобрести новую машинку, но собственных средств недостаточно и она обратилась за финансовой поддержкой. Поддержите Сайлихон в ее выборе.
texts.en: Saylikhon is a woman who has lived through everything but remained herself. She was able to raise her son alone. Now he is 22 years old and lives abroad. Saylikhon has worked as a seamstress for many years. She has gained a lot of experience. Saylikhon makes her living by taking orders for sewing. Many years of work on her sewing machine have naturally affected its performance. Her sewing machine does not, and will not, work like before. Saylikhon wants to acquire a new sewing machine but she does not have enough of her own funds and she has applied for financial support. Please support Saylikhon in her choice.

loans.use: to acquire a sewing machine.

loans.name: Giang

texts.en:
Mrs Giang is 39 years old and she is maried. She has operated a food stall selling rice noodle for more than 10 years.
Giang lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is the latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build a toilet.

This is Giang's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Giang hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita has always had an enthusiasm for farming. She has cultivated their farming land in Dipolog and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work.

Recently, Teresita applied a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparation. This will ensure that the farming field is ready for planting. Teresita knows that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season.

In the future, Teresita hopes to buy a hauling truck for easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Это Фотима. Она из города Душанбе. Она разведена с мужем. У нее 2 сыновья и 2 невестки. Старший сын занимается торговлей деятельностью на рынке. Младший сын занимается фотографом.  Фотима дома вместе невестками занимается шитьем женской одежды.  Около 5 лет она занята шитьем. В швейном деле Фотиме нравится ежедневный доход, и она просто обожает шить. Она несколько раз отремонтировала швейную машинку, но машинка долго не будет служить. Фотима запрашивает кредит для новой швейной машинки и ткани. Она с такими планами просит кредит. Фотима ждет Вашу доброту.
texts.en:
This is Fotima. She is from the city of Dushanbe. She is divorced and has two sons and two daughters-in-law. The eldest son works with retail sales at the market. The youngest son works as a photographer. 

Fotima stays at home with her daughters-in-law, sewing women's clothing. She has worked with sewing for around five years. She likes that the sewing brings a daily income, and she simply loves to sew. She has repaired hef sewing machine several times, but it will not serve her for long.

Fotima requests a loan for a new sewing machine and fabric. With these plans she asks for a loan. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: La señora Elena tiene 19 años de edad de estado civil concubina, cuenta con una hija dependiente, la familia vive en una zona rural del departamento de Cochabamba, cuenta con una actividad agrícola, tiene ingresos económicos por la venta estacional de su productos dentro de la misma comunidad, de esta forma cubren todos sus gastos, actualmente la señora se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como abono orgánico (gallinaza) y semilla de papa para la siembra de esta campaña agrícola, así continuara con su producción y generará mas ingresos para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Elena is 19 years old, is in a common law marriage, and has 1 child in her care. Her family lives in a rural area in the department of Cochabamba. She works in agriculture and earns money by selling her products in her community, which covers all of her expenses.

She currently needs a loan in order to purchase farm supplies like organic fertilizer (hen droppings) and potato seeds for this growing season so that she can continue to produce potatoes and earn more income to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies like organic fertilizer and potato seeds for this growing season so that she can continue to produce potatoes to support her family.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en: Pedro has been operating his Shoes Corp for the last three years, selling shoes produced by the company of a family friend in the Dominican Republic. He felt that it was "natural to start a business that sells the beautiful productions of my country." His most recent accomplishment was opening a small storefront in Brooklyn last year, but wholesale is still the largest part of his business. He hopes to use this loan to purchase more inventory for re-sale. His dream for the future is to build the business enough to be able to expand and hire employees.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for his shoe business

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James and his family live in a rural home in Kipkaner location in Kenya. He practices both livestock and crop farming for a living. His main income sources are milk and maize. Most of the money he makes covers domestic and business expenses.
 
Until recently, James had never thought of boosting his income through value addition technique. He is seeking a a loan to buy a grain milling machine: The machine will make it possible for him to process his maize/corn harvest into flour and sell it in its finished form, which fetches a much higher price. 
Your loan investment will also enable James to have an alternative source of income by processing grains for other farmers.
 
By making a loan to this borrower, you will not only be empowering one farmer to make better returns from his business, but also empowering the community around him which will benefit from selling their maize/corn produce in finished and packaged form.

loans.use: to buy a grain milling machine

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a 46-year-old married woman with five school-attending children who is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marivic has had a general store for 6 years and requests 9,000 PHP  through NWTF  to purchase more groceries to sell.

 In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money so  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase groceries.

loans.name: Garmet

texts.en:
Garmet is a 31-year-old single woman with two children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur.

Garmet has had a clothing business for 4 years and requests 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy pants, underwear, bags, dresses, and shirts.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy pants, underwear, bags, dresses, and shirts.

loans.name: Mary Jam

texts.en:
Mary Jam is a single parent with seven children who works hard to support her family.

She has a food  business in the Philippines, and earns additional income operating a general store.  Mary Jam is borrowing 9,000 PHP through NWTF to buy meat, fish, chicken, flour, cooking oil, spices, additional utensils, and other items for her business.

Mary Jam has sustained her business activities through 1 previous loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream  which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy meat, fish, chicken, flour, cooking oil, spices, additional utensils, and other items.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 56-year-old married man who has a beautiful 12-year-old daughter and they live in Medellín. He owns a washing machine rental business which he has had for several years, but he doesn’t own as many as he needs.

He needs a loan so he can buy two washing machines and in that way he can cover more clients and improve his profits. He wants to pay for his daughter's education and give her and his family a new house where they can live comfortably. He plans to leave his daughter the business and that’s why he wants to improve it as much as he can so she will get a successful business.

Someday, he expects to give jobs to more people and make his dreams come true. He just needs a loan that will help him come through and let him give his family the best life they could get.

loans.use: buy two washing machines

loans.name: Maria Cielo

texts.en:
For María, her family is the most important thing. She is 44 years of age, is married, and works really hard so she and her husband can have a good quality of life. They see their life getting better and better.

María likes to sell, so she works selling different kinds of things like clothes, perfume, and beauty products from different brands. She wants a loan so she can invest in more inputs so she can increase her sales and, in that way, her profits. She dreams that someday her business can have its own place where she can sell to all her clients all of her good products.

She loves what she does and likes to have big dreams. She just needs a little help so she can accomplish all that she wishes for and all that she has been working for so hard for so long.

loans.use: to buy products like clothes, perfume, and beauty products

loans.name: Oscar William

texts.en:
Oscar is 28 years old and loves his job. He owns a fruit stand where he offers a great amount of different products. Where he works he is the only one who does so. He works for 12 hours a day, 6 days a week, but he’s always thinking about how to improve and take all the opportunities to make his business grow.

He lives in Medellín, and he’s dreaming about seeing his business grow and get recognized through all the city for the quality of products and the service that he offers. He wishes in the future to open new stands in the city, but for now he needs a loan so he can stock up on fruits and add some new products to his offerings, and he wants to buy a new car where he can sell more fruit and show the diversity that he has in his stand.

A loan can help him not only make his business grow, but to impact in his personal life too, by let him make look his house better, and live better.

loans.use: to stock up on fruits and to buy a new car where he can sell more fruit.

loans.name: Irma Yolanda

texts.es:
Irma es madre soltera, vive junto a sus tres hijos, dos de ellos ya mayores de edad, tan solo uno depende de ella. Viven en casa arrendada en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, ciudad caracterizada por ser la unión entre regiones, además por ser muy comercial y productiva, se destaca mucho el intercambio comercial por ser el puente terrestre.
Irma ha trabajado varios años, cuenta con un local en el centro donde arrienda, en el vende toda clase de cd´s, sean musicales o películas, tiene mucha clientela ya que deja a precios mas cómodos para los mayoristas. Gracias al esfuerzo de varios años ella pudo abrir otro local donde atiende sus dos hijos mayores, ellos le ha ayudado mucho para salir adelante.
Irma atiende todos los días, es una microempresaria alegre y carismática, vino referida por su hermana que es cliente de la Fundación. Con este crédito Irma podrá comprar parlantes y flash memory para surtir su negocio, seguir creciendo y seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que ellos sigan como microempresarios y así puedan abrir más locales y ofrecer trabajo a personas que necesiten salir adelante.
texts.en:
Irma is a single mother. She lives with her three children. Two of them are older with only one depending on her. They live in a rented house in the city of Santo Domingo, a city characterized by being the link between regions as well as being very commercial and productive. It is known for its commerce exchange as a land bridge.

Irma has worked many years. She rents a place in the city center selling all types of CDs, whether music or film. She has many customers because of the good prices for the wholesale trade. Thanks to efforts over several years she could open another location which her two older children look after. They have helped her a lot to get ahead.

Irma works every day. She is a happy and charismatic microentrepreneur. She came referred by her sister who is a client of the Fundación. With this loan Irma can buy speakers and flash drives to supply her business to continue growing and continue supporting her children so they can continue as microentrepreneurs so they can open more locations and offer work to people who need to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy speakers and audio equipment to supply her business so that she can continue supporting her children with the earnings

loans.name: Anny Tatiana

texts.en:
Tatiana is only 21 years old and is a married woman. She dreams of having a big family with her husband but knows that she has to work hard if she wants to give them a quality of life.

She inherited from her family a business of good sales and wants to improve it. That’s why she needs a loan so she can invest it to stock up on lotions, shampoos, deodorants and more, so the profits of the sales increase and that way the business can be a successful one and let her accomplish all her dreams.

She lacks capital so she can stock up, so with a little help not only her business can grow, but she can have a good life and establish a great future for her and her husband.

loans.use: to stock up on lotions, shampoos, deodorants and more.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.en:
Daniela is a young woman who is only 19 years old. She is a strong, confident lady who dreams big and has big goals in her life. She inherited her business from her mother who taught her everything about confection and now she is running a local business where they keep sewing and working hard. 

She needs a loan so she can expand. She wants to buy some industrial sewing machines that will help her to be more productive and faster so she can have more clients and keep increasing her business profits. She works really hard because her biggest dream is to pay for her studies to be a professional.

She just needs a little help to achieve all her goals. She thanks her family, especially her mother for everything she did for her. She is a responsible woman who wants to make all her dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy some industrial sewing machines

loans.name: Santos Sergio

texts.es:
Santos Sergio es un productor de café con 40 años edad. Vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en una alejada comunidad al norte de Nicaragua. Desde muy pequeño hacía algunas tareas de la familia en la finca de café de sus padres. Ahora cuenta con su pequeña finca de 5 mz de las cuales 1 es de café. 

Este emprendedor es parte de los productores de avanzada que atiende la Asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC), y que cuentan con las certificaciones de comercio justo, UTZ y C.A.F.E. Practices. Los rendimientos de café que él ha logrado en su finca han sido de hasta 36 quintales pergamino. 

Para este ciclo requiere un financiamiento para garantizar el mantenimiento de las plantaciones de café y continuar mejorando los rendimientos productivos. En su comunidad lo conocen por ser emprendedor, honesto y responsable. Estas cualidades considera le han ayudado a salir adelante y le permitirán crecer económicamente.
texts.en:
Santos Sergio is a 40-year-old coffee grower. He lives with his wife and their three children in a rural community in northern Nicaragua. From a young age, he worked on his parents' coffee farm. Now, he has his own small farm that is 5 manzanas (about 35,000 square meters), one on which he grows coffee.

This entrepreneur is part of the Pueblos en Accion Comunitaria group and has fair trade, UTZ, and C.A.F.E Practices certifications. He has produced 36 quintales (1,656 kgs) of pergamino coffee.

For this crop, he needs a loan to guarantee that he can maintain his coffee crops and to continue to improve his output. He is known in his community for being an honest, responsible entrepreneur. These qualities have helped him to move forward and will allow him to grow financially.

loans.use: to maintain his coffee crops and ensure that he will have a good harvest.

loans.name: Yoichi

texts.en:
Veteran Yoichi started his business, On The Go Phone Repair, in San Diego last month. He completed the Accion Academy for Entrepreneurial Success training class this spring, which gave him the tools and resources he needed to establish his business.

“I was so fortunate to be able to participate in the Accion Academy,” said Yoichi. “It was mind blowing; I thought I knew everything about starting a business, but I realized there was so much for me to learn.”

Since coming out of the Navy after eight years of service, Yoichi has worked as an independent associate with LegalShield, which provides legal services. Through this, he has had to generate his own leads and close his own deals, developing networking skills and customer service skills.

Originally from Japan, Yoichi brings more than five years of cell phone and computer repair experience to the business. In addition, Yoichi has a degree in information technology and cyber security, which gives him the experience needed to succeed.

Yoichi’s business will specialize in mobile cell phone repair service, offering screen replacements and phone accessories. He sets himself apart in the industry by going to the customer and providing excellent knowledge and customer service. He will begin operating his business in the next couple weeks, and will focus on professionals, business owners, and construction workers in the San Diego area.

He also plans to sell cell phone accessories at swap meets and farmers markets in the future.

With the Kiva loan, Yoichi will purchase equipment to assist in mobile phone repairs for his business such as cell phone screens and repair tools.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to assist in mobile phone repairs

loans.name: Mukisa Salaama Development Group

texts.en:
Harriet a new member of the group, was inspired by the other members' progress in joining Ugafode and decided to be a part of the group. 

She is a single mother and is applying for a loan to boost her business of a bar.  She hopes this will help her increase her profitability. 

Harriet thanks the group for accepting her and Kiva for partnering with her. She is hardworking and diligent.

loans.use: to boost her bar business

loans.name: Virgina

texts.en: Virgina has been involved in activities since 2013 and started her business with $ 100.00. Virgina has a shop and requests $1500.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy  sardines, drinking water, sleepers, cooking oils, and soft drinks. She is happy because, with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can build her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy sleepers, tomato paste, drinking water, sardines, cooking oil, and items.

loans.name: Karo Karungi Group

texts.en:
Elias is a 58 year old Ugandan who is married with five children aged 10,08,06,04 and 02. But out of the five three attend school and he is responsible for providing them all the necessities including school fees.

He is a farmer and a produce dealer in a trading centre Kisita Sub County.  He says he began this business in order to earn a living and support his family.
He has applied for a loan of ugx2,000,000=(Two million shillings) from Ugafode to buy agricultural produce and also hire labour to weed and prune his banana plantation. He says his dream for the future is to have all his children educated and also construct a good house for his family.

He faces challenges of drought.

loans.use: To boost his agricultural produce business by buying corn flour and millet for sale

loans.name: Mujakukakasa Group Katoogo

texts.en:
Rose is a new client to Ugafode microfinance. She is a married woman aged 35 years with 3 children.

She is a business woman selling cosmetics in the city outskirts. Cosmetics business in a major business in the city.  It is good since most of the women who are the majority clients like looking good, so when she thought of a business, she couldn't find a better one. She has since not gone wrong since she is assured of clients .

She has used the proceeds to pay tuition for her children and meet other house hold expenses. She will use the loan to buy more of the items demanded by her customers. She is challenged by competition and limited capital to buy especially the good quality products.

Rose is very grateful for the support Ugafode microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to her, since she is now able to fund her business and grow it.

loans.use: to boost business by buying more stocks of cosmetics for selling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice and extra beef, pork, fish, etc.

loans.name: Uralbek

texts.ru: Уралбек молодой дехканин. Ему 30 лет. Он из района Шахритус. Уралбек живет вместе с отцом, матерью, сестренкой, женой и двумя детьми. Детям 6 и 4 года. Родители уже пенсионеры. Жена и сестренка ведет домашнее хозяйство. Сама Уралбек занят с земледелием. Он с утра начинает работать на земле до вечера. В протяжение 10 лет Уралбек постоянно сажает арбуз. Ему нравится честно нажитый доход. Он радостный, ответственный мужчина. На фотографии Вы видите Уралбека и земельный участок, где он выращивает арбуз. Уралбеку надо еще раз обработать урожай минеральными удобрениями, чтобы получить качественный урожай. Для покупки минеральных удобрений у него нет такая определенная сумма денег. И по этой причине Уралбек просит кредит.
texts.en:
Uralbek is a young farmer. He is 30 years old. He is from the Shahrituz region. Uralbek lives with his father, mother, little sister, wife and two children. His children are six and four years old. His parents are already retired. His wife and little sister manage the house.

Uralbek himself is occupied with growing crops. He starts work on the land in the morning and works until evening. For ten years Uralbek has been planting watermelon. He likes his honestly earned income. He is a joyful, responsible man. In the photograph you can see Uralbek and the plot of land where he grows watermelon. Uralbek needs to treat his crop once more with mineral fertilizer in order to get a good quality harvest. He does not have such a sum of money to buy the mineral fertilizer, and for this reason Uralbek is requesting a loan.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Mrs Lan is 53 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years.
Lan lives in Quang Xuong district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover this job is unstable 
. 
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is the latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build toilet.

This is Lan's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Lan hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build a toilet.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 69 years old and lives in Map-an, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 10 children now at their adult age. 

Susana earns a living from managing her own little sari-sari store business for 20 years already. She is also engaged in coconut shell buying and charcoal processing business. Susana earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used for purchasing additional stocks of groceries and other consumable products for retail. Susana has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future Susana hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: To be used for purchasing additional stocks of groceries and other consumable products for retail

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a 41-year-old married woman with three children.

She has raised pigs for 7 years and requests 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies.

She earns additional income from fishing.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to  save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Pia

texts.en:
Ma. Pia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Ma. Pia has been in this business for 15 years. Ma. Pia earns more income from pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is thirty-three-year-old Aminata. She is married and has three children aged thirteen, nine and seven.  In 2007, Aminata established her business selling sets of dishes, bowls, baskets and buckets. She began her business because she wants to improve her life and not to be a burden to her husband. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are adults. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, Aminata earns about Le 1,150,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Aminata requires a loan in order to buy additional plastic bowls, baskets and buckets.   She has got someone to assist her in the business.  Now she plans to buy a piece of land, expand the business and provide good education for her children in the future.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for increased stocks plastic bowls, baskets and buckets

loans.name: Rhulangane A Group

texts.fr: Hamuli est commerçante, présidente de la  banque communautaire «Rhulangane A», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 54 ans, mariée, mère de 9 enfants tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usagés dans un marché de la ville depuis 30 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari, qui est un agent de l’Administration publique. Pour accroitre son activité, elle va acheter 10 ballons de souliers. Elle souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Hamuli is a merchant and the president of the community bank “Rhulangane A”. She is a client of the microfinance institution Hekima, and she is 54 years old and the married mother of nine children, all in school. She has been a vendor of secondhand shoes at a market in town for thirty years. She began her business with funds from her husband, who is a government  representative. 

To grow her business, Hamuli is going to purchase 10 bales of shoes. Her wish is to provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase 10 bales of shoes

loans.name: Shaddai

texts.en: Shaddai spent over a year delivering groceries to residents in her local community in New Orleans before she decided to open her own delivery service, Quick Shop Delivery.  She realized there was an overwhelming group of residents who were unable to make a trip to the grocery store or simply could not afford the extra time to buy groceries. She currently employs three part-time employees and plans to hire two more to complete her delivery operation.  Shaddai need funds to support her insurance for her business, equipment and fees associated with startup costs. With her loan, Shaddai will not only be able to hire additional staff, but she’ll be able to help members of her community receive the items they need to support themselves and their families.

loans.use: to pay for startup costs and additional equipment .

loans.name: Rhulangane B Group

texts.fr: Lwiyando est commerçante, trésorière de la  banque communautaire «Rhulangane B», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 40 ans, mariée, mère de 5 enfants  tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usagés dans un marché de la ville depuis 16 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari qui est infirmier. Pour accroitre son activité, elle va acheter 10 ballons de souliers. Elle  souhaite devenir fournisseur, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Lwiyando is a merchant and the treasurer of the community bank “Rhulangane B”. She is a client of the microfinance institution Hekima, and she is 40 years old and the married mother of five children, all in school. She has been a vendor of secondhand shoes at a market in town for sixteen years. She began her business with funds from her husband, who is a nurse. 

To grow her business, Lwiyando is going to purchase 10 bales of shoes. Her wish is to become a supplier and to provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase 10 bales of shoes

loans.name: Luz Myriam

texts.en:
Luz lives in a town called Carmen de Viboral in Antioquia and is 45 years old. She has a beautiful five-year-old son who is her motivation and strength to go and work 7 days a week for around 10 hours each day.

Luz has a business selling clothes, which she started for her needs to provide for her family. She learned by herself how to manage the store and wants to improve it so the profits will let her pay for her son’s education, buy a house and get a better quality of life. That’s the reason why she needs a loan, so she can invest in her business by buying more clothes and accessories to be stocked up.

This loan will help her accomplish everything that she desires, and would let her give her child the best life she could ask for, teaching him how to be responsible and how he should someday provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy a range of clothes for her business.

loans.name: Mellania

texts.en:
Mellania is a 22-year-old married woman. She lives in the Mudzi district, in Zimbabwe. Mellania managed to build herself a house using the proceeds from her business. As a joyful mother of three, she testified that it could not have been possible if it was not for the loan she received last year. 

She buys and sells cell phone hand sets and their accessories at the local township. Besides being able to repay her first loan in time, Mellania has also achieved growth in her business. She has one of the biggest retail shops that sell cell phones in the area. 

With the Kiva loan, Mellania will purchase more accessories (i.e., phones and chargers) to provide enough services to clients. 

Mellania is volunteering as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the well-being of students by enhancing their learning environment.

loans.use: To purchase more accessories (phones and chargers) to provide enough services to clients.

loans.name: Olga Lucia

texts.en:
Olga is a married woman and is 44 years old. She has three children, two boys and one daughter. She lives in a town called Yarumal where she started her business with love for what she does, to make crafts like accessories, earrings, bracelets, and lot of beautiful things that she builds with her own hands.

She is passionate about what she does. Every piece of craft is made with a lot of love and people love to buy what she does for the beauty and the love that is reflected. Olga wants to see her business grow and that’s why she needs a loan, so she can buy more inputs to create new accessories and improve the profits and the sales.

She wishes that some day she can open her own locale and improve her home. She wants to offer new products that are in her mind ready to create. With a loan she can accomplish this dream and more.

loans.use: to buy more inputs to create new accessories

loans.name: Santos Amado

texts.es:
Santos es un productor de café que vive con su esposa y 3 hijos en una comunidad rural al norte de Nicaragua. Su finca es manejada bajo los criterios de certificación de comercio justo, UTZ y C.A.F.E. Practices, lo cual evidencia el cumplimiento aspectos productivos, sociales y ambientales en su finca, que han derivado en el mejoramiento de los rendimientos productivos en los últimos años. 

Santos dice que el café es un rubro rentable. El y su familia viven con los ingresos del café principalmente, y su mayor desafío es hacer frente a las plagas y enfermedades que afectan el café. 

Para garantizar un manejo adecuado de su cafetal en este año, él está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes que aseguren las condiciones requeridas para una buena cosecha. Su dedicación y disciplina le permitirán asegurar la implementación de todas las actividades que requiere su cafetal y continuar mejorando sus ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is a coffee farmer who lives with his wife and 3 children in a rural community in northern Nicaragua. His farm is managed under the criteria of fair trade certification, UTZ and C.A.F.E. Practices, which demonstrates the compliance of productive, social and environmental standards in his farm, and has resulted in improved returns in recent years. 

Santos says that coffee is a profitable field. He and his family live mainly on the income from coffee, and his main challenge is coping with pests and diseases that affect the coffee. 

To guarantee proper management of his coffee farm this year, he is requesting a loan to purchase inputs and fertilizers that ensure that conditions are acceptable for a good harvest. His dedication and discipline will allow him to ensure the implementation of all activities required for his coffee farm and to continue increasing his profits for his family's wellbeing.

loans.use: to purchase inputs and fertilizers to apply to his coffee for a good harvest.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 65 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with five children. Editha has a stall in the market and sells fish at wholesale and retail prices. She's been in the business for 40 years already and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing "banyeras" of fish resale. Remaining amount will be used in the processing of her son's papers for residency abroad. Editha has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, Editha hopes to expand her fish vending business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing "banyeras" (big basin) of fish resale

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is 57 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 2 children now at their adult age. Meriam earns a living from snack vending at her coffee stall located in the bus terminal.  Her main products are puto, biko, suman and coffee. She’s been in the business for 10 years already and earns approximately PHP12,000.00 each month. This amount is so helpful to meet their needs. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing malagkit rice, sugar and other ingredients for her biko, suman and puto making and vending business.
Meriam has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.  In the future, Meriam hopes to expand her coffee and snack vending business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing "malagkit" (glutinous) rice, sugar and other ingredients

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon has wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring for and harvesting and earning income as well. Corazon has supported her husband doing this type of work.  Like a farmer, Corazon has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds to have good results with healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.  Someday, Corazon hopes to purchase more rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds to have good results with healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Teresita is 51 years old and both of her children are in school.

Teresita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing net and other equipment.

Teresita has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Hilda Elvia

texts.es:
Hilda es una joven de 24 años de edad, es soltera vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad denominada san Andrés Semetabaj, Hilda para apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, esta labor lo tiene ella desde hace 10 años, pues lo aprendió de su madre, esta joven se dedica a su trabajo con mucho esmero y dedicación es por ello que cuenta con muchos clientes, por tal razón solicita un préstamo para comprar más güipiles de distintos colores y estilos.
Hilda tiene el anhelo de comprar un terreno donde ella pueda construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Hilda is a young 24 year-old woman, who is single and lives with her parents in a community called San Andrés Semetabaj. To support her parents with the household expenses, Hilda makes a living by purchasing and selling traditional clothing. She has had this job for 10 years, which she learned from her mother. 

This young woman is engaged in her work with great care and dedication, and because of this she has many customers. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to purchase more traditional blouses called guipiles, of different colors and styles. 

Hilda has the desire to purchase a plot of land where she could build her own home.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Monica Yanedt

texts.en:
Monica is 43 years old and has one beautiful daughter, who is 6 years old and is the reason Monica works so hard, to give her a better life. She started her business for necessity and learned about it by herself. She has a restaurant where she sells delicious food made by her.

She doesn’t have the resources to improve her business and the pressure cooker she has right now doesn´t has enough capacity, so she needs a better one.  That’s the reason she is asking for a loan so she can keep with her business.  She also needs to buy new equipment to improve her business and increase the profits so she can provide better to her family.

She dreams to give her daughter a good education and in the future give jobs to more people when she opens her new place. That is a goal she has, with a little help she can accomplish all that she wants and more.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for her restaurant

loans.name: Sara Emilia

texts.es:
Sara es una mujer trabajadora, que decidió que el hecho de ser ama de casa no le iba a detener para que ella saliera adelante. Al lado de su esposo, su hija ha logrado realizar su sueño de tener su propia pulpería donde oferta granos básicos, artículos de limpieza, golosinas, frituras, entre otros, a los habitantes de su comunidad. 
En este momento, Sara ha descubierto que sus clientes demandan los productos de refrescos y gaseosas enlatadas y embotelladas, es por eso que ella solicita la ayuda de Kiva junto a MiCredito para que se le otorgue un préstamo que le permita comprar refrescos y gaseosas y poder tener estos productos en exhibidores en su local. Ella espera poder lograr hacer de su pulpería, una distribuidora, además de incursionar en otros negocios.
texts.en:
Sara is a hard-working woman who decided that being a housewife was not going to stop her from getting ahead. Alongside her husband, their daughter has managed to realize her dream of having her own grocery store where she sells basic staple foods, cleaning supplies, candy, snacks, and fried foods, among other items, to the residents of their community. 
At this time, Sara has found that her customers demand products like soft drinks and canned and bottled drinks. She is enlisting the help of Kiva together with MiCredito, so that she may be granted a loan that allows her to buy sodas and drinks and be able to have these products displayed at her shop. She hopes to achieve making her grocery store a distributor and also venture into other businesses.

loans.use: buy soft drinks and beverages.

loans.name: Brian

texts.en:
Brian is a Dominican immigrant who came to the United States about five years ago. He began his career in the states working in a warehouse. During that time, he and his wife worked hard to save enough money to purchase a truck and start Byron Transport LLC. Since then, he has devoted himself to his business with the goal of providing for his wife and his young son. Brian is hardworking and strong of character. Despite living in Perth Amboy where almost everyone speaks Spanish, Brian has gone above and beyond by teaching himself English in a short period of time. He is a kind and hardworking father who is eager to have his business excel so he can provide for his family.

The company currently has two fully operational trucks, and Bryon Transport obtains a steady income by subcontracting for two trucking companies that have contracts with Amazon and UPS. Brian is requesting this loan to fund working capital while he recovers from having one of his trucks stolen. Brian plans on purchasing a new truck to replace the stolen one, bringing his fleet back up to three trucks, and in the meantime, needs funds for operations. This loan would help him to cover the costs of paying wages, insurance, and gasoline.

loans.use: to recover his business after having his truck stolen.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Ее зовут Манзура. Она замужняя женщина в возрасте 35 лет. Манзура поддержка и опора своему мужу. Она ему во всем помогает и поддерживает. Манзура вместе с мужем занимаются переработкой шерсти животных. Они покупают, шерсти обрабатывают их солью, высушивают и после перепродают на заводах. Этим бизнесом они живут уже 15 лет. Сейчас есть потребность к их продукции, и им нужно приобрести больше шерсти на обработку. Сейчас их денег не хватает на приобретения достаточного количество шерсти и она приняла  решение обратиться финансовой поддержкой.
texts.en: This woman is called Manzura. She is a married woman who is 35 years old. Manzura is a great support for her husband. She helps him with everything and supports him. Manzura and her husband process wool. They buy it, process the wool with salt, dry it out and then sell it on to factories. They have lived on this business for 15 years. Now their product is in demand, and they need to acquire more wool to process. They do not have enough money now to acquire a sufficient quantity of wool and so she has taken the decision to apply for financial support.

loans.use: to buy wool for processing.

loans.name: Secondiano

texts.en:
Secondiano makes a living through his retailing business. He runs a sari-sari store in Tudela and earns a promising income to support his family. He has signed up his membership with PMPC to gain access of capitalization. 

He wants to increase his inventory. Now, he availed a loan to restock his store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. Secondiano hopes to sustain his business and dreams to send all his children to school.

loans.use: to restock his store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 45 years old and lives in Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 4 children who are now adults and of school age. Her main source of living comes coconut buying and copra processing business for 15 years already. She earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month with this type of business activity and this amount is so helpful to meet their needs. 

Juliet has requested a loan to be used in purchasing coconuts for copra processing and for resale. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to become a major copra buyer in their area.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing coconuts for copra processing and for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy lotions, ointments, creams, hair extensions etc.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is aged 46 and happily married with one wife with 7 children aged  22, 20, 18, 16, 14 and 12. 3 of his children are still schooling. He borrowed a loan of ugx2000, 000/= and this is his first time of borrowing from UGAFODE Microfinance ltd (MDI). 

He is a farmer and mainly does coffee farming and a banana plantation. He works for 9 hours for a day and 6 days a week.  He also has a side income from carpentry and timber selling.  He started the business in order to generate income for his family house hold. 

The loan purpose is to buy more stock of timber, nails and furnishings for his carpentry business, coffee seedlings for planting, mulches for his plantations and coffee for trade. Most of his clients are people in Rubirizi District. He started business in 1999. He hopes to become the leading producer of coffee for sale in the area and owning large carpentry workshop. He is always faced with a challenge of price fluctuations and high prices for agricultural inputs.  He is a hard working person.

loans.use: To buy furniture manufacturing supplies, such as wood, nails etc

loans.name: Estrellas De Fatima Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Estrellas de Fátima” y está conformado por 06 socias comprometidas y responsables. María de 43 años de edad es conviviente con 3 hijos dos de ellos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas desde hace más de 1 año. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su negocio y le va bien se siente feliz porque gracias al préstamo mejora cada día más su calidad de vida. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de arroz aceite y papas. El grupo “Estrellas de Fátima” agradece a las personas de kiva por hacer posible éste crédito. María es la primera del lado derecho viste casaca ploma y polo fucsia.
texts.en:
This is the group "Estrellas de Fátima" [Fatima's Stars]. It is made up of 6 committed and responsible members. 

María is 43 years old and is in a domestic partnership with 3 children, two of whom are dependents. She has made a living selling food for more than a year. With a lot of effort, she has managed to improve her business and it is going well. She feels happy because, thanks to the loan, her quality of life gets better each day. Her latest loan will be used to buy rice, oil, and potatoes. 

The group "Estrellas de Fátima" appreciates the people of Kiva for making this loan possible. María is the first from the right and is wearing a gray jacket and fuchsia shirt.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and potatoes.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julian es un hombre de 40 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es la extracción y venta de material de construcción.
Él es emprendedor, optimista, generoso, constante, paciente, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘chuquiaguillo’ caracterizado por sus grandes campos, dónde se alimentaban al ganado que aquí se criaba, situada al oeste de la ciudad, a una altura de 4000 metros sobre el nivel del mar, de clima frío y seco durante todo el año, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre -1/16 grados centígrados.
Julian es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus padres que son los fundadores de la zona y son jubilados. Viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica, alcantarillado y agua potable. Su negocio es la extracción de material de construcción como arena, piedra, etc., “trabajo desde muy tempranas horas del día y aprovecho las lluvias que arrastran material para guardarlo y venderlo a mejor precio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que sus clientes son empresas que compran continuamente, la desventaja es la falta de agua y combustible para trabajar.  Su sueño es comprar un camión donde transportar las piedras, él desea realizar la compra de un motor para la máquina lavapiedras. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que desarrolla esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Julian solicita un préstamo para la compra de un motor para la máquina lavapiedras y con los beneficios comprar agua y combustible para trabajar.
texts.en:
Julian is a 40 year-old man, single, without children, and his business is the extraction and sale of construction materials. He is enterprising, optimistic, generous, steady, patient, responsible and very hardworking. His business is being developed in the "chuquiaguillo" area, which is characterized by its large fields, where the cattle that are raised here graze. The area is located in the west of the city at an altitude of 4,000 meters above sea level, with a cold, dry climate year-round and a temperature that varies between -1 and 16 degrees Celsius during the day.

Julian has a dark complexion, brown eyes, short black hair, short stature and medium physique. His mother tongue is Aymará, which is spoken at home, and speaks Spanish outside the home and for his business. He shares his life with his parents, who are founders of the area and are retired. They live in their own home constructed of adobe with a tin roof that has electricity, a sewage system and potable water. 

His business is the extraction of construction material such as sand, stones, etc. "I work from the early hours of the day and take advantage of the rains that wash the material in order to save and sell it at a better price," he says. The advantage of his business is that his customers are companies that continuously purchase his materials, the disadvantage is the lack of water and fuel to work. 

His dream is to purchase a truck in which to transport stone, and hopes to purchase a motor for the machine to wash the stone. This is the 1st sequence of loans with the institution, in 3 years his business will be developed independently. It is for these reasons that Julian is requesting a loan to purchase a motor for the stone-washing machine and with the benefits to purchase water and fuel to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motor for the stone-washing machine and with the benefits to purchase water and fuel to work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes to expand her clothing business.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es una mujer de 29 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 1 año, y su negocio es la venta de jugos calientes combinados con cereales y leche.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, paciente, constante, comprometida, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘villa el Carmen’ este lugar surge por la existencia de una vertiente de agua, en esta zona existían grandes plantaciones de árboles de Kishuara, que fueron plantados por los colonos y, que en la actualidad quedan unos cuantos árboles que los mantienen como un recuerdo. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Julia es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como constructor y con su hijo que aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de jugos calientes, como; Quinua con leche, quinua con manzana, cañahua con leche o manzana, y otros, “trabajo desde muy tempranas horas de la madrugada porque mis clientes son los primeros en ver el sol…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que los jugos calientes tienen mucha demanda debido al frío del lugar, la desventaja es el mal estado de su carrito juguero que no brinda la ayuda necesaria para el trabajo. Su sueño es abrir una tienda para dejar de ambular, ella desea realizar la reparación de su carrito juguero ya que las llantas están destrozadas y los aros desoldados. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Julia solicita un préstamo para la reparación de su carrito juguero para poder continuar con su actividad y alimentar a su familia.
texts.en:
Julia is a 29 year-old woman who lives with her partner, has a 1 year-old son, and has a business of selling hot drinks combined with grains and milk. She is a good mother, enterprising, patient, steady, committed, responsible and very hard-working. 

Her business is located in the 'Villa de Carmen' area, an area that grew due to the existence of spring water. In this area, there are large plantations of Kishuara trees, which were planted by the settlers, and currently some are maintained as a remembrance. The area has a cold, dry climate with a temperature that varies between 0 and 12 degrees Celsius during the day. 

Julia has a dark complexion, brown eyes, long black hair that she wears in a braid, short stature, thin physique and wears traditional clothing (hat, shawl and skirt). Her native tongue is Aymará, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish outside of the home and for her business. She shares her life with her partner, who works in construction, and with her son who is not yet school-age. They live in their own home constructed of brick and cement, with a tin roof and wooden floors, that has potable water, electricity, gas and a sewage system.

Her business is selling hot drinks, such as: quinoa with milk, quinoa with apple, cañahua [a grain similar to quinoa] with milk or apple, and others. "I work from very early in the morning because my customers are the first to see the sun," she says. The advantage of her business is that the hot drinks are in great demand due to the cold, the disadvantage is that her cart is in poor condition and does not provide the necessary help to her work. 

Her dream is to open a store and stop peddling. She wants to repair her cart because the tires are destroyed and the rings are broken. This is the 1st sequence of loans with the institution in 7 years that she has had this business. It is for these reasons that Julia is requesting a loan for the reparation of her cart in order to continue with her work and feed her family.

loans.use: to repair her drink cart to be able to continue with her work and feed her family.

loans.name: Esnath

texts.en:
Esnath was very glad that she received her first loan at the height of the season. She used it to increase her stock levels and venture into poultry production. Her income increased relative to the increase in production. 

Consequently, Esnath was able to pay for her own examination fees and those of her cousin, who was on the verge of dropping out of school. Her family used to depend on hand-outs to survive, but with the increased income that Esnath is earning, she has been able to shield her family from poverty. 

With the requested loan, Esnath would like to increase her poultry production capacity to 200 birds per batch.

loans.use: to increase her poultry production capacity to 200 birds per batch.

loans.name: Maria De Los Ángeles

texts.es: Doña María tiene un negocio donde vende artículos que ella misma produce , necesita un préstamo de un millón cincuenta mil colones (¢1.050.000) para comprar materiales y continuar creando manualidades y de esta manera vender en mayor cantidad.
