texts.en: Doña María has a business where she sells items that she makes herself. She needs a loan of one million fifty thousand colones (¢1.050.000) to buy materials and continue making handicrafts to be sold in large quantities.

loans.use: to buy materials for handicrafts

loans.name: Blanca Cecilia

texts.es:
Blanca es una joven ecuatoriana que nació en el cantón Sigchos, provincia de Cotopaxi. Esta zona se caracteriza por un clima frio en donde la población se dedica a diferentes actividades comerciales, siendo la agricultura y ganadería la más importante. Blanca tiene22 años de edad, es soltera pero vive en unión libre en un departamento arrendando un año aproximadamente. Gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres realizó sus estudios hasta la educación básica, y actualmente labora en un local de bisutería, en el cual aprendió acerca del mercado y como se desarrollan las actividades comerciales del mismo.
Blanca solicita el crédito para emprender su propio negocio bisutería, en donde ofrecerá una atención de calidad a la población en general,  en donde atenderá todos los días. Espera que con esta inversión pueda mejorar los ingresos que necesita para salir adelante y cambiar su estilo de vida. Blanca agradece a Fundación Alternativa y KIVA por hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Blanca is a young ecuadorian woman born in the Sigchos canton of the Cotopaxi province. This area is characterized by its cold climate where the residents have different occupations, agriculture and cattle being the most important ones.

Blanca is 22 years old. She is single but lives with her partner in an apartment they have rented for approximately a year now. Thanks to the effort of her parents she completed her basic education and is now working in a costume jewelry store where she learned about the business and its commercial activities.

Blanca is requesting the loan to start her own costume jewelry business where she will offer quality service to the customers in general and which she will attend every day. She hopes that with this investment she can improve her income to get ahead and change her life style. Blanca is thankful to the Fundación Alternativa and KIVA for making her dreams a reality.

loans.use: to start her custome jewelry business and improve her life style.

loans.name: Pain De Vie 3.1 Group

texts.en: Francoise is a member of the community bank group Pain de Vie 3.1 in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. Helping to lead a group of four other micro-entrepreneurs, Francoise sells smoked fish, one of the favorite meals of many Congolese. With her fourth loan with HOPE Congo, Francoise will purchase several baskets of fish, which she will then be able to prepare and resell. At times, Francoise struggles to find good quality fish to provide to her customers, but she always ensures that her stand is clean and offers a good price to her loyal customers. In the future, Francoise would love to expand her activities further and to be able to travel outside of Brazzaville to purchase her fish.

loans.use: to purchase baskets of fish for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y frijol tiene 10 años de dedicarse a esa actividad agrícola con la cual ha podido salir adelante, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarlos en los pueblos aledaños, el joven vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, pesticidas entre otros insumos agrícolas y asi continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
This young man's face has been pixelated because he is 27 years old and lives in a high-risk zone. He works in agriculture, planting corn and beans. He has made a living at this agricultural occupation for 10 years, and thus he has been able to get ahead.  

When his harvest is ready, he stores it in the granaries shown in the photograph in order to later sell his crops in the adjacent towns. The young man lives in his own house with his life partner and their two children.

He is seeking a loan to by seeds, fertilizers, manure, and pesticides, among other agricultural supplies, so as to continue with his work since it is his only source of income.

loans.use: to by seeds, fertilizers, manure, and pesticides, among other agricultural supplies

loans.name: Maryuri Mercedes

texts.es:
En el barrio Perpetuo Socorro de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Alianza Femenina, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico.
En este lugar vive la señora Maryuri, tiene  42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 20, 16 y 10 años los dos menores estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es maestro constructor.
Doña Maryuri es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para ayudarle a  su marido  con los gastos que genera el hogar, ella tiene una papelería en su casa, allí vende útiles de toda clase, cuadernos, plumas y muchos otros productos para los estudiantes,  actualmente ha estado muy ocupada vendiendo útiles escolares, aunque ya es menos las ventas a ella le gusta tener muy bien surtido su local para que sus clientes llegue en mayor numero, ella lleva 3 años con este negocio el cual lo empezó con el primer crédito. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar cuadernos, plumas y  otros  útiles escolares. Lleva tres años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos.  Sus sueños seguir mejorando cada vez más su negocio.
texts.en:
In the Perpetuo Socorro neighborhood of the city of Manta every 15 days the Crédito Alianza Femenina Group meets. The city is known for its beautiful beaches which are busy in every season of the year with domestic and foreign tourists and because it is one of the most important ports of the country and of America situated on the shores of the Pacific. 

In this place lives Señora Maryuri, who is 42 years old, married, and has three children who are 20, 16, and 10 years old. The two younger children are in elementary and high school. Her husband is a master builder.

Doña Maryuri is a woman who has always liked to work to help her husband with the expenses from the house. She has a stationery shop in her house. There she sells supplies of every type, notebooks, pens, and many other products for students. Currently she has been very busy selling school supplies. Even though the sales are less now she likes to be very well supplied so more clients come. She has been doing this business for 3 years, she started it with her first loan. 

She will use this loan to buy notebooks, pens, and other school supplies. She has been in the Grupo De Crédito for three years and she likes it for the help they give with loans. Her dreams are to continue improving her business more each time.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pens, and other school supplies.

loans.name: Mambwe

texts.en:
Mambwe is 23 years old and is finishing his degree in mechanical engineering this year. He is a partner in his father's metal workshop and works part time manufacturing machines with his father. He says this kind of work has been part of him for as long as he can remember and he loves it. He will take over from his Dad when the time comes and he wants to grow their company to its maximum capacity. Their biggest challenge is the lack of adequate modern machinery. 

Mambwe is asking for a loan to buy more sophisticated machinery and a computer to be able to produce products with better finish and modernize the way the business is run. He hopes that these tools will enable them to produce more, and employ more people.

In their workshop, Mambwe and his father are manufacturing large gas-improved cook stoves that run on sustainable biomass pellets. Every morning, Mambwe sees oxen transporting charcoal to the compounds. The number of bags he sees every day tells him there is a lot of deforestation happening. He knows that their stoves can help preserve the forests of Zambia and that if they could supply the compounds with such stoves there would be less charcoal used and many trees saved.

In his time off, Mambwe likes to mingle with friends, relax, socialize, and mostly meet new people because he always learns things from them.

loans.use: buy equipment for his shop

loans.name: Angelino

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha Província de Maputo, tem 31 anos de idade, vive na sua casa com a sua família, é pai de 3 filhos menores de idade, somente 2 frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém. 	
Este é o seu 4º empréstimo na Hluvuku no qual pretende adquirir material de construção como: blocos, cimento, varões e mais, para dar continuidade com a sua obra de residência, sendo que os últimos 3 foram aplicados para mesma actividade. 
Futuramente pretende concluir a sua obra e adquirir mobiliário para a mesma. O seu maior desafio é a falta de fundo suficiente para transportar o material.
texts.en: Angelino was born in Namacha, Maputo Province and is 31 years old. He lives in his own house with his family of three young children, two of whom are school-aged. Aside from his children, he has no other dependents. This is his fourth loan cycle with Hluvuku, and he plans to use it to buy construction materials like bricks, cement, rebar, and rock to keep working on his home improvements, as he has been with the previous three loans. In the future his plans are to complete his construction work and buy a property of his own. His main challenge is not having the financial resources to arrange for transporting his supplies.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, rebar, and rock

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 21 years old. He lives in an area of Jordan called Irbid with his parents and five siblings. Ahmad is a university student majoring in accounting. He is in his third year. He is planning to work in his field of study after graduation in order to support his family financially and be a productive guy. Lately Ahmad`s parents have been facing financial problems that have prevented them from paying for his tuition fees. Therefore, he is applying for an educational loan to cover his semester fees and achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Rosa Yolanda

texts.es:
En el barrio Perpetuo Socorro de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Alianza Femenina, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene  53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aún viven en su casa. Su esposo es zapatero.
Doña Rosa es una mujer que le gusta  trabajar para tener para sus gastos, ella es artesana y elabora carameleras, apliques, piñatas, y muchos otras manualidades para cualquier compromiso social,  tiene un local en el cual se dedica a la venta de  sorpresas, caramelos, dulces  y una gran variedad de productos, ella elabora sus productos al mismo tiempo que realiza sus ventas. Tienen más de 9 años con esta actividad la cual le encanta y se entretiene a la vez.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar materiales para elaborar las manualidades y  artículos de fiesta que ella compra para vender. Lleva 5 años  en el Grupo Crédito y le gusta porque los  créditos les ayudan mucho. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su actividad la cual le encanta.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of Perpetuo Socorro in the city of Manta every 15 days the Crédito Alianza Femenina Group meets. The city is known for its beautiful beaches which are busy all year with domestic and foreign tourists and for being one of the most important ports in the country and in America, situated on the shores of the Pacific. 

In this place lives Señora Rosa, who is 53 years old. She is married and has three adult children, one of whom still lives at home. Her husband is a shoemaker. 

Doña Rosa is a woman who likes to work to have money for her expenses. She is an artisan and makes candy jars, appliqués, piñatas, and many other handicrafts for any social engagement. She has a shop in which she sells sorpresas, candies, sweets, and a wide variety of products. She makes her products at the same time as she sells them. She has more than 9 years doing this activity which she loves and finds entertaining at the same time. 

She is going to use this loan to buy materials to make the handicrafts and party supplies that she will buy to sell. She has been with the Grupo Crédito for 5 years and she likes it because the loans help them a lot. Her goals are to continue in the activity that she loves.

loans.use: to buy materials to make handicrafts and party supplies.

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es:
Jhonny tiene 30 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos, en el caserio de Cabramayo que pertenece al distrito de Colasay, Provincia de Jaén, Región Cajamarca, SierraNorte de Perú. Cabramayo es un caserío pequeño y tranquilo dedicado a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio básicamente.

Jhonny se dedica al servicio de talado de madera con motocierra, hace 15 años, con muy buenas referencias, sus clientes en su mayoría son de la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo que será invertido en la compra de repuestos para dar mantenimiento a sus equipos de trabajo, de esta manera podrá brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Generará mayores ingresos, de esta manera podrá mejora su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Johnny is 30 years old and lives with his spouse and their 2 children in the Cabramayo community. This is in the Colasay district, province of Jaén, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Perú. Cabramayo is a small and quiet community basically dedicated to agriculture, livestock and commerce.

Johnny makes a living providing wood cutting service with his chainsaw. He has done this for 15 years, has good references and most of his customers are from the area. He has requested a loan to invest in the purchase of spare parts to maintain his tools and this way provide better service to his customers. He will generate more income and, therefore, he will be able to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to maintain his work tools.

loans.name: Amparo Verónica

texts.es:
En el barrio Perpetuo Socorro de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Alianza Femenina, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico.
En este lugar vive la señora Amparo, tiene 36 años de edad es madre soltera de dos hijos de 14  y 10 años, los  dos estudian en colegio y escuela. 
Doña Amparo es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y así salir adelante con sus hijos, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de ventas es puerta a puerta, ella sale en las mañanas o noches a ofrecer sus productos aunque la mayoría solo para entregar ya que cuenta con muy buena clientela, deja a crédito y que cobra cada 8 días, lleva  más de 5 años  con esta actividad  la cual le ayuda a salir adelante y darles lo necesario a sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y otras prendas. Lleva más de 5 años en el Grupo De Crédito le gusta porque así empezó con su negocio que hoy le permite ganarse la vida. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the Women's Credit Alliance Group meets in the neighborhood of Perpetual Help in the city of Manta.  The city is known for its beautiful beaches which are visited year round by national as well as international tourists.  It is also one of the most important ports in the country and on the Pacific coast of America.

In this place lives Amparo, 36 years old, single mother of two sons ages 14 and 10.  The children study in high school and elementary school.  Dona Amparo is a woman who likes to work and progress with her children. 

She sells all types of clothing door to door.  She leaves in the mornings and evenings to sell her products, although often it is just to deliver as she has a very good clientele.  She accepts credit and collects every 8 days.  She has been doing this for more than five years.  This helps her improve her life and provide for her children.  

This loan is to purchase pants, shirts, blouses and other articles of clothing.  She has been in the Credit Group for more than five years.  She likes it because that is how she began her business, which  now allows her to earn a living.  Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, blouses and other articles of clothing.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 40-year-old married woman with eight children, five of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Helen has a fishing business in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing net, bamboo, and gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Helen has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing net, bamboo, and gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Hồng

texts.en:
Ms Hồng is 35 years old and she is single .She has had a retail business selling clothes for more than 10 years.
Hồng lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is the latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build toilet.
This is Hồng first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Hồng hopes for her business to do well, to travel for vacation within the country, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build a toilet.

loans.name: Eloisa Isabel

texts.es:
En el barrio Perpetuo Socorro de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Alianza Femenina, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico.
En este lugar vive la señora Eloísa, tiene 21 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual esta a la espera de su primer hijo, está en su 7 mes de embarazo por lo cual está muy feliz. El marido es taxista. 
Doñas Eloísa con la intención de ganarse algo por su cuenta y con esto poder ayudar a su marido a salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta pero actualmente solo está vendiendo en su casa ya por su embarazo se le hace muy difícil salir, es por esta razón que sus clientes la visitan cuando necesitan de alguna prenda, ella les deja a crédito y  cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 3 años dedicada al comercio, con sus ganancias ella está invirtiendo en cosas necesarias para la llegada de su bebé.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa y zapatos. Lleva 6 ciclos  en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque con los créditos financia su negocio que le permite salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener su bebé sano.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the Grupo de Crédito Alianza Femenina [Female Alliance Credit Group] meets in the neighbourhood of Perpetuo Socorro in the city of Manta. It is a city known for its beautiful beaches, which are frequently visited at all times of the year by national and international tourists. Sitting on the edge of the Pacific, it is also known for being one of the most important ports in the country and in America.

This is the place where Eloísa lives. She is 21 years old and in a relationship with her domestic partner, with whom she is expecting her first child. She is in her seventh month of pregnancy and very happy about it. Her husband is a taxi driver.

With the intention to earn some money of her own and use it to help her husband support the household, Eloísa works selling clothes and shoes of all kinds. She conducts her sales door-to-door but is currently only selling out of her house, as her pregnancy makes it very difficult to go out. Because of this her clients visit her when they need some article of clothing, and Eloísa notes the credit and collects every eight days. She has worked in this business for more than three years and with her earnings she is investing in things necessary for her baby’s arrival.

This loan is to buy clothing and shoes. Eloísa has been with this credit group for 6 loan cycles and she likes it because with the loans she is able to finance her business, which allows her to get ahead. Her dream is to have a healthy baby.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 53 years old, married, and has three children.

Merlinda is in the agricultural business  in the Philippines. Merlinda requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies to raise her pig. Merlinda has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 37 years old and married with three children.

She is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in the Philippines. Rosana is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies to raise her pig. Rosana has been in this business for three years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 22-year-old married businesswoman from Mudzi District, Zimbabwe. Ever since she completed her schooling, Grace has been focusing on her ever-growing business. Grace used the Kiva loan to diversify to a flea market stand with all ranges of clothes that she ordered from the capital city at low prices. This gave her a competitive advantage since she purchased her products at low costs. 

She had a 20% increase in income since the receipt of her first loan. Grace is managing to assist her family with groceries and meet all expenses for her child. With the requested loan Grace would like to purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts to increase the amount of items she can sell.

loans.use: to purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Merly is 47 years old and has two children are presently in school.

Merly has a food processing business in the Philippines. Merly requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Merly has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha and her husband are farmers with a child living in Sampong village that is far from the power grid. As a farmer, she wants to expand her business with three hectares of land and make her family's living conditions more comfortable. 

Sokha and husband are not using their car battery because it consumes her time in order to charge the battery every week. Sokha wants to find a better solution that can save her time to do other activities. Sometime, because of busyness, she doesn’t have time to charge the battery and the whole family is in pitch black condition for the whole day. Therefore, Sokha decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy high-quality home solar energy. After using solar home energy, she believes her family's condition will be better and safer. She also can save time and money on utilities.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home energy system

location.town: Sampong Village, Thma Andeurk commune, Chetr Borei

loans.name: Herlen

texts.en:
A small canteen is commonly known in the Philippines as a “carenderia.” Most Filipino families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. But if there is only one or two family members present for dinner, they would prefer to buy cooked viand or food. This is a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one or two people when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. This is the reason why Herlen’s carenderia business is considered valuable. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community, students, and working people. 

Herlen is 48 years old, married to a cook named Ricardo, and is blessed with children. They are living in Santa Barbara, Iloilo where Helen runs a carenderia and her husband does the cooking. For almost sixteen years, this has been the source of their family income. Although the canteen business is quite exhausting since they have to wake up very early and go to sleep late at night, the couple persists because it helps provide for their daily expenses and children’s education. 

But the presence of other carenderias threatens Herlen’s business. She needs to improve hers through additional capital of PHP 18,000 that she will use to buy more ingredients like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. She has to work hard in order to support their children’s education until its completion. With a college diploma, she believes that her children will have a brighter future. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings

loans.name: Jennafer

texts.en:
Jennafer lives in Tudela and supports her three children by building new houses from the ground up. 

She has successfully repaid her whole loan, which she used to buy building material, paints, and to pay her workers. She wants her children to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work she has had to endure.

loans.use: to buy building material, paints & pay her workers for building new houses

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en:
Jovy is 51 years old, widow with three children.

Jovy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items of groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, shampoo and other personal care products.

Jovy has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Jovy aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items of groceries to sell suh as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita, a 43-year-old married mother of five children, two of whom are currently in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Florita has had a fish vending business in the Philippines for eight years and is requesting a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more assorted fish to sell.

Florita would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish to sell

loans.name: Edmond

texts.fr:
Edmond est un homme âgé de 63 ans. Il a 7 enfants  dont les 4 ont déjà fondé leur famille. Actuellement, il vit avec sa femme et ses 3 enfants encore en train de poursuivre ses  études. Cette famille vit dans un quartier très animé de la ville d’Antsirabe. Cela fait 5 ans qu’il tient une épicerie chez lui à son domicile. 
Il est parmi les premiers emprunteurs, donc 12 ans de partenariat avec Vahatra.  Ces prêts lui ont permis d’augmenter significativement le stock de produits et marchandises à vendre. Avec ce 12ème prêt, il va augmenté son stock de produits de première nécessité tels que du sucre, de l’huile, de pétrole, …. 
Edmond est un homme tenace, près à réaliser son projet qui est de devenir grossiste en produits de première nécessité. Il compte constituer beaucoup d’épargner afin d’assurer ses vieux jours.
texts.en:
Edmond is a 63 year old man. He has 7 children, 4 of which have already started their own families. He currently lives with his wife and his 3 children who are still in school. This family lives in a lively neighborhood in Antsirabe. He has been running a shop out of his home for 5 years. 

He is one of Vahatra's first borrowers, marking 12 years of partnership. These loans have allowed him to significantly increase his stock of products and merchandise that he can sell. With this 12th loan, he will add basic items to his stock such as sugar, oil, petroleum, etc.

Edmond is a tenacious man who has nearly achieved his goal of becoming a basic product wholesaler. He plans to maintain a savings program for his old age.

loans.use: to buy basic products like sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Aleida Maria

texts.en:
Aleida is 36 years old and has 2 children; one boy who is 17 and one daughter who is just 10 years of age, Aleida is married and works in clothing, job that she learned a long time ago by herself because is something that she loves to do.

She works all the 7 days of the week for around 8 hours per day, she desires to be more productive but the lack of a good machine doesn’t let her to be, that’s why she needs a loan so she can buy a new sewing machine that help her increase the sales and give her business success. 

She wishes she can pay for her children a good education and later in the future to give jobs to people, who need it, is a dream that she can fulfill by getting the loan she needs.

loans.use: buy a new sewing machine to improve her clothing production

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is thankful to Kiva for the previous loan which enabled him add stock of beef to his butchery.  This increased his sales and income that supported his family expenses e.g. food and clothing. He repaid his first loan promptly. 

He started vegetable farming from the profits he realized from the butcher. He is now borrowing second Kiva loan to buy manure, fertilizers, and certified seeds in order to increase vegetable production hence earn more income to pay school fees for his children.  

Peter is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the continuous financial support.

loans.use: To buy manure, fertilizers and certified seeds to increasee vegetables production for increased income to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Erika Rocio

texts.es:
En el barrio Perpetuo Socorro de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Alianza Femenina, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico.
En este lugar vive la señora Erika, tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 10 y 5 años y el menor de 5 meses, los dos mayores estudian en escuela. El marido es taxista. 
Doña Erika es una mujer que le gusta ganarse lo suyo y con esto contribuir con los gastos que demandan la educación de sus hijos y los del hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, vende productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa lugar en el cual también vende dulces y golosinas, trabaja todos los días en todas sus actividades ya sea fuera o dentro de su local. Lleva más de 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo para el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y golosinas. Lleva más de 8 años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the Grupo de Crédito Alianza Femenina [Female Alliance Credit Group] meets in the neighbourhood of Perpetuo Socorro in the city of Manta. It is a city known for its beautiful beaches, which are frequently visited at all times of the year by national and international tourists. Sitting on the edge of the Pacific, it is also known for being one of the most important ports in the country and in America.

This is the place where Erika lives. She is 29 years old and in a relationship with her domestic partner, with whom she has three children, ages ten and five years and the youngest, five months. The older two are in school and her husband is a taxi driver.

Erika is a woman who likes to earn her own living, with which she contributes to paying the expenses of her children’s education and of the household. She works in the commercial sector, selling Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women). She conducts her sales door-to-door as well as out of her home, where she also sells sweets and candies. She works every day on all her business, in and outside of her store. She has done this work for more than six years, doing her part for the good of her family.

This loan is to buy perfumes, cream, cosmetics and candies. Erika has been with this credit group for more than eight years and likes it because thanks to the loans, she started her business. Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and candies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shoes, fabric and cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo tiene 29 años de edad, vive en casa propia, por mas de 25 años en dicha vivienda; junto a su cónyuge y su menor hijo de 1 año de edad. Vive en la parte rural y cuenta con servicios de luz, en el caserío de Huancas, que pertenece al distrito de Querocotillo, provincia de Cutervo, Región Cajamarca, Sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza es la de caporal de campo ,estas actividades las realiza en el caserío de Huancas y sectores aledaños. El destino del crédito será para invertir en mantenimiento de sus herramientas de trabajo y servicios varios que realiza, esto le generará mayores ingresos y así podrá mejorar su calidad de vida .
texts.en:
Lorenzo is 29 years old and lives in his own home (in which he has lived for over 25 years) with his spouse and his one-year-old son. He lives in a rural area with access to electricity in the small village of Huancas, which is a part of the Querocotillo District, Cutervo Province, Cajamarca Region, in the northern sierra of Peru.

He works as a field foreman in the village of Huancas and the surrounding areas. The purpose of the loan he requests is to invest in the maintenance of his work tools and various other services he performs. By doing so, he will be able to generate a greater income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in the maintenance of his work tools.

loans.name: Narcisa Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En el barrio Perpetuo Socorro de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Alianza Femenina, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico.
En este lugar vive la señora Narcisa, tiene 40 años de edad es madre soltera de dos hijos de 20  y 10 años, los  dos estudian en universidad y escuela. 
Doña Narcisa con la intención de ganarse la vida  y con esto poder salir adelante sola con sus hijos se dedica al comercio, ella  vende ropa interior de todo género, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale en horas de la mañana ya que a esta hora es más fresco,  también vende en su casa lugar en el cual tiene unas vitrinas donde exhibe sus prendas al público, ella deja a crédito y cobra casa 8 días, lleva más de 3 años dedicada a este negocio el cual le permite ganarse el sustento de ella y sus hijos.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa interior. Lleva más de 5  años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the Grupo de Crédito Alianza Femenina [Female Alliance Credit Group] meets in the neighbourhood of Perpetuo Socorro in the city of Manta. It is a city known for its beautiful beaches, which are frequently visited at all times of the year by national and international tourists. Sitting on the edge of the Pacific, it is also known for being one of the most important ports in the country and in America.

This is the place where Narcisa lives. She is 40 years old and a single mother of two children, 20 and 10 years old. Both are studying in university and school.

With the intention to earn a living and be able to get ahead on her own with her children, Narcisa works in the commercial sector. She sells undergarments of all types and conducts her sales door-to-door. She goes out in the morning as this is the coolest time of day. She also sells out of her home, where she has windows in which she displays her garments to the public. She operates on credit and collects every eight days. She has worked in this business for more than three years, which has allowed her to support herself and her children.

Narcisa is going to use this loan to buy undergarments. She has been with this credit group for more than five years and she likes it because the loans allow her to get ahead. Her dream is for her children to be professionals.

loans.use: to buy undergarments.

loans.name: Asociacion 5 De Junio Group

texts.es:
Gabriela es una mujer de 27 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de ropa interior.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, activa, comprensiva, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad ‘Cotoca’ que es un lugar especial para pobladores, debido a que se encuentra la Virgen, La leyenda cuenta que la imagen fue encontrada por dos campesinos quienes vieron un resplandor que venia del interior del tronco de un árbol, cuando ellos se acercaron encontraron la imagen de la Virgen.
Gabriela es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que desarrolla (al centro, viste polera verde). Su vida la disfruta en compañía de sus padres que trabajan, viven en un cuarto propio construido de madera con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba, energía eléctrica y no tiene alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación para mejorar su actividad, la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de verduras, venta de bisutería, venta de medicinas natural, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de refrescos y venta de huevos, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de ropa interior femenina como; sujetadores, camisetas, bodies, combinaciones, ropa de baño, braguitas, culottes, ligueros, corsés, panties, encaje, lencería de noche, camisones, y otro “ inicié mi actividad con unas pocas prendas, los clientes me hicieron pedidos y así descubrí que es lo que más se vendía…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos, la desventaja es la falta de capital para surtir el negocio. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de ropa, ella desea realizar la compra de variedad de ropa interior femenina para complacer a sus clientes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad de forma independiente. 
Es por esos motivos que Gabriela solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa interior femenina para surtir su negocio y abrir una tienda de ropa interior femenina.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a 27 year old woman, single without children, and her business is selling undergarments.

She is enterprising, independent, active, understanding, patient, responsible and very hardworking. She opened her business in the Cotoca area which is a special place for its people because of the Virgin. Legend has it that the image was found by two farmers who saw a glow coming from the inside of a tree trunk. As they approached they found the image of the Virgin.

Gabriela has a dark complexion, brown eyes, and long black hair tied back. She is short with a thin physique. Her mother tongue is Guaraní which she speaks at home and around the community but she speaks Spanish for cultural and business purposes. (She is in the center, wearing the green t-shirt.)

She enjoys life in the company of her parents who work. They live in their own room made from wood with a corrugated iron roof and earthen floor. They have well water extracted by pump, electricity, and no sewage system.

Her hopes to succeed in order to improve her activity led her to lead a communal bank in order to ask for a loan to improve businesses including selling vegetables, jewelry, natural medicine, second hand clothing, soft drinks and eggs.

Her business is selling undergarments such as bras, shirts, bodysuits, slips, bathing suits, panties, culottes, garter belts, lace, nightgowns, nightshirts, and more. “I started my business with a few items. Customers gave me orders and thus I discovered the best sellers, she says.”

This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the two years since she started her independent business.

It is for these reasons that Gabriela is asking for a loan to buy women's undergarments to supply her business and open a lingerie store.

loans.use: to buy women's undergarments to supply her business and open a lingerie store.

loans.name: Patricia Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En el barrio Altamira de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Altamira, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico. 
En este lugar vive la señora Patricia, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos mayores de edad, la menor de ellos aun vive con ellos y  estudia en universidad. Su esposo es empleado privado.
Doña Patricia es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos para ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar y educación de su hija se dedica a la venta de ropa y sabanas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres o cuatro días y aprovecha sus ratos mas desocupados para salir aunque también vende en su casa hasta donde sus clientes, su hija también le ayuda con las ventas en su lugar de estudios. Sus ganancias las invierte en la educación de su hija por que para ella es lo más importante, lleva más de 4 años con esta actividad y espera seguir mucho tiempo ya que le encanta sus ventas.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo y sabanas. Lleva más de 3 ciclos en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños es que su hija sea una profesional.
texts.en:
The Altamira community bank meets twice a month in Manta's Altamira neighborhood.  Manta is known for its beautiful beaches, a draw for tourists from both Ecuador and abroad, and for its port, one of the most important Pacific Ocean ports in the country and in South America. 
Sra. Patricia, 54, lives in Manta.  She and her husband have five grown children, of whom only the youngest--a university student--still lives at home.  Doña Patricia's husband works for a private company and she operates a home-based business to supplement his income and to support their daughter's studies.  She buys and sells clothes and bedding, going door to door, three or four days a week.  She also meets her buyers at her house and her daughter helps with the business, selling her mother's merchandise at her school.  She has operated the business for 4 years and her earnings help pay costs related to her daughter's university studies.  
Doña Patricia will use this loan to buy a mix of clothes and bedding.  She has been a member of her community bank for 3 years and likes it because she can secure loans quickly.  Her dearest wish is that her daughter finds a steady, well-paid job.

loans.use: to stock merchandise for her retail business.

loans.name: Kuña Pojoaju Group

texts.es:
El grupo se formó con la unión de amigas y vecinas de ciudad del Este, todas son muy luchadoras, ponen lo mejor de sí para poder mejorar y salir adelante, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que está en una pobreza extrema, esforzándose por poder mejorar y crecer. Ella se dedica a la cría y venta de gallinas, y por medio de ese oficio lucha por tener los medios para poder ayudar a su familia.
Maria pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de gallinas y balanceados para poder seguir con la cría y venta de sus gallinas. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group was formed with the union of friends and neighbors of Ciudad del Este. All of them are very hardworking and do their very best so that they can improve their situation and get ahead in life. They are in a poverty-elimination program, fighting to improve their living conditions.

One of the members is Mrs. Maria, who in her survey was placed in a poverty level of one, which means that she is in extreme poverty, fighting hard to to get ahead and grow. She works in the raising and sale of chickens, and by way of this trade she strives to obtain the means necessary to be able to help her family.

Maria requests this loans so that she may use it to invest in the purchase of chickens and chicken feed so as to be able to continue with the raising and sale of her chickens. She is grateful for the opportunity to continue growing that she is receiving.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of chickens and chicken feed for their raising and sale.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 52 years old and lives in Baga, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 4 children now at their adult age. 

Nida is engaged in hog fattening business and earns approximately PHP 4,000.00 each month doing this type of work. She's been in the business for 10 years already. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing 4 sacks of corn bran, 4 sacks of pollard and 3 sacks of pellets. Nida has been a member of PMPC for almost 4 years. In the future, Nida hopes to expand her hog fattening business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing 4 sacks of corn bran, 4 sacks of pollard and 3 sacks of pellets

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is from the village of Antipolo, Dapitan City. She is 49 years old and is widow. Estrella owns and operates a sari-sari store business in their community. She has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Elsie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. 

She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital.She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
El grupo Virgen de Fatima está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Se unieron para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras y con ello dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener. 
Amelia, una de las integrantes de este grupo, es una mujer muy trabajadora y sacrificada que lucha por poder salir adelante y con lo que obtiene ayuda a su familia. Comenta que tiene una despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día, hasta muy tarde en la noche.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carne, hortalizas, panificados y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y mejorando cada día.
texts.en:
The Virgen de Fatima [Our Lady of Fatima] group is in its first cycle of the program, a committee of women who all work and help each other to get ahead. They joined to be able to help one another and give their families everything they were not able to have.

Amelia, one of the members of this group, is a very hardworking and self-sacrificing woman who fights to get ahead and uses what she earns to help her family. She tells us she has a small grocery store where she works every day from very early in the morning to very late at night.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy vegetables, meat, leafy greens, baked goods and more, so that she will be able to continue with her work as she has been doing. She is thankful for the opportunity she is getting to be able to continue growing and improving each day.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, leafy greens, baked goods and more.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetics, dyes, creams, shampoo, hair rinse, and other similar products.

loans.name: Rene

texts.en: Rene is 62 years old and has seven children. Rene personally sells the catch from her fishing boat in nearby municipalities.  She has been a member of Paglaum MPC in good standing for almost five years. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to PHP 10,000 for the purchase of new fishing nets.  As much as possible, she has to have quality fishing accessories to maximize the chances of a good catch. She already has floaters to help guard her fish cages. She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so she can sell more fish to the nearby fish market and fetch higher prices.  In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales.  She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing nets

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en: Anastacia has a banana farm in Dipolog. This is her primary source of income for her family. Anastacia makes it a point to have good land preparation for maximum yield and good income. Recently, she needed a loan from Paglaum MPC to pay irrigation costs. Anastacia wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply bananas to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay irrigation costs for her banana farm.

loans.name: María Daniela

texts.es:
En el barrio Altamira de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Altamira, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico. 
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 10 y 8 años que estudian en escuela. El marido trabaja en un laboratorio de larvas en la ciudad.
Doña María es una mujer que le gusta sentirse activa y generar sus propios ingresos que les sirvan para colaborar con los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus hijos, ella trabaja en sociedad con la mamá que es costurera, ella compra muchas telas y material de costura con los créditos que recibe de la institución para que su madre confeccione sabanas las mismas que luego ella sale a vender por la ciudad, deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, ella empezó este negocio hace 2 años con el primer crédito que recibió del grupo por lo cual está muy agradecida.
Este crédito es para comprar telas, hilos y otros materiales para la confección de las sabanas. Lleva 2 años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con el primer crédito comenzó su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un buen local algún día.
texts.en:
The Altamira community bank meets twice a month in Manta's Altamira neighborhood. Manta is known for its beautiful beaches, a draw for tourists from both Ecuador and abroad, and for its port, one of the most important Pacific Ocean ports in the country and in South America.
Sra. María, 31, and her husband have two children, 10- and 8-years old, both in school.  Her husband works at a lab in the city.  Doña María and her mother, a seamstress, have been making and selling sheets for 2 years..  Her earnings from the business generate an extra income for the family and support her children's education.  Doña María is applying for a loan now that she will use to buy the cloth and other supplies that her mother needs to make sheets which she, in turn, will sell.  She sells on credit and collects from her buyers every 8 days.
Doña María will use this loan to buy cloth, thread and other supplies for making sheets that she will then sell.  She has been a member of the community bank for 2 years and likes it because it delivered the seed money she needed to start her business.  She says, too, that she wants a shop of her own one day.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Bercy

texts.en:
Bercy, who comes from Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines, is happily married to Rico, a driver and has four children, three of whom are already working, while their youngest is in college. Bercy manages her household while operating her small general store by her house. She and her husband both work to provide for their daily needs and the school needs of their daughter.

Bercy has operated a small variety store for six years already. She does not allow poverty in the Philippines to hinder them from improving in life. Aside from her small store she ventures into various other businesses such as selling snacks, RTW clothes and retailing electronic loads of different pre-paid mobile subscribers to earn additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 900 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store, Bercy is requesting a Php 30000 loan to buy grocery items such as canned goods, coffee, eggs, instant noodles, beverages etc. Part of the loan she will use to pay for ingredients of her snack items, RTW clothes and electronic loads. Although at times her RTW sales are low, she is still encouraged by the good turnout at her store and sales of her snacks. She is positive that the loan will boost her income as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Bercy aims to sustain and grow her businesses. Her simple dream is to see her daughter become a professional someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Estrella Hermencia

texts.es:
En el barrio Altamira de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Altamira, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico. 
En este lugar vive la señora Estrella, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad, una de ellos aun vive en su casa. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Estrella es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante junto  a su familia, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos como granos, detergentes, carnes, legumbres, entre productos de primera necesidad, así como también artículos de bazar y licores, entre otros productos, trabaja todos los días y en ocasiones  su  hija y su marido le ayudan, lleva más de 20 años con este negocio el cual que le dan lo necesario para salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va a invertir en comprar víveres para surtir su tienda y artículos de bazar.  Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con  los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The Altamira community bank meets twice a month in Manta's Altamira neighborhood. Manta is known for its beautiful beaches, a draw for tourists from both Ecuador and abroad, and for its port, one of the most important Pacific Ocean ports in the country and in South America.
Sra. Estrella, 53, and her husband have four grown children, only one of whom still lives at home.  Her husband is a driver and she has a corner grocery to help support their family.  She started the business more than 20 years ago and sells all kinds of products: meat, grains, beans, detergents and other everyday goods that her customers want.  She also sells alcohol and products that you might find in a five-and-ten-cent store.  She works every day.  Her husband and daughter sometimes help with customers.  
Sra. Estrella will use this loan to stock her business.  She has been a member of the community bank since it was formed and likes it because it delivered the seed month she needed to start her business.  Her greatest wish is to provide for her family in the very best way she can.

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is married and a 52-year-old mother of three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Rosalina has a meat-vending business in the Philippines. Rosalina requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more meat to sell in the market.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now has requested this loan to further build her business.

Rosalina has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell in the market

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 54 years of age and a married father of 8 children. Only one of them attends school in Hoima Uganda. 

Robert operates a retail shop mainly selling general merchandise. He also owns a motorcycle for a transport business in order to supplement his income. He expects to grow his businesses and fulfill the increasing demands of his customers but he is limited by inadequate capital. 

He will use the loan to buy more stock like salt, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock of items like salt, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa is in the business of selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan of (USD )$600 to improve her business. Teresa will use this loan to buy more vegetables and to resell in the market. She started selling vegetables in 2013 with her own working capital of (USD) $100. Now, she is taking out this loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy more vegetables such as cabbage and cassava leaves. Every day her life selling vegetables is earning her a good income.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell, such as cabbage and cassava leaves.

loans.name: Quira De Jesus

texts.en:
Quira is a young woman who is just 21 years old and lives in a far town called Momil, Cordoba, a coast place surrounded by beautiful nature and a lot of culture, something Quira knows well.  She represents her culture and let the people know it by selling lovely craft and accessories and she also sells sandals and purses. 

Quira is very determined to be successful and make her business grow and be recognized by all the people, that´s why she needs a loan to expand her sales by buying inputs, that way she can increase her profits and get more clients. She dreams to improve her house and someday have her own store.

Quira wants to see her dream turn true, that´s why she works hard and search for some help that can give her what she wants, an opportunity to do great things.

loans.use: to buy inputs to make craft and accessories

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
This is Jean, 45 years old, married to John, a laborer. They have four children, two of whom are already in college. They reside in Tigbauan, Iloilo. Jean owns two “pedicab” units of (which are also known as “trisikads”). This is a three-wheeled vehicle, just like a tricycle, and it doesn’t use gasoline or diesel fuel to run. Just the power of the “sikad,” or kick, makes it run. Simply put, it’s a bicycle with attached compartment for passengers. Jean is able to help unemployed, low-educated but hardworking men in their community by hiring them as trisikad drivers. Jean’s income from the pedicab operation, combined with her husband’s irregular income as a laborer, is insufficient for their growing expenses. Tuition fees for her children are really a burden for her. She takes in laundry to earn additional income. She is eager to obtain a loan of PhP 20,000, which she will use to buy spare pedicab parts and pay for repairs. She will use another part of the loan to pay the tuition fees of her children who are in college. It’s her desire to see all her children complete their education and have stable jobs. In due course, she plans to acquire more pedicabs, so her family can enjoy living well enough. She gains inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare pedicab parts and pay for repairs.

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
En el barrio Altamira de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Altamira, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico. 
En este lugar vive la señora Blanca, tiene 65 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen siete hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es taxista.
Doña Blanca es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante junto a su esposo, ella se dedica al comercio, vende productos Belcorp y Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas),  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale dos días por semana o cuando ella puede, también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes,  entrega los productos a créditos y cobra cada ocho o quince días. Lleva más de 12 años con este negocio el cual le permite ganar algo.
Este crédito es para comprar cremas, perfumes, bisuterías  y cosméticos. Lleva 8 años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son tener salud para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
The Altamira community bank meets twice a month in Manta's Altamira neighborhood. Manta is known for its beautiful beaches, a draw for tourists from both Ecuador and abroad, and for its port on the Pacific, one of the most important ports in the country and in South America.
Sra. Blanca, 65, and her husband have seven grown children, all living away from their parents now.  Her husband is a taxi driver and she operates a business selling Belcorp and Avon beauty products.  She has operated the business for 12 years and says that she likes working because it is her means of helping her husband support their family.  Sra. Blanca sells her merchandise from door to door.  She works two days a week or when she can.  She also meets buyers who come to her house.  She sells on credit and collects from her customers every 8 or 15 days.
Sra. Blanca will use this loan to buy creams, perfumes, jewelry and cosmetics.  She has been a member of the community bank for 8 years and likes it because past loans have helped her a lot.  Her greatest wish is for good health for her and her family.

loans.use: to stock her cosmetics sales business.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Iloilo, just like other provinces in the Visayas region of the Philippines, was hit hard by Typhoon Haiyan in November 2013. Almost all businesses in those areas were destroyed. Entrepreneurs have worked hard for nearly two years to recover and rehabilitate their businesses. Sari-sari (variety) stores were not exempt from that crisis. Frequent distribution of relief goods to Haiyan victims affected communities by almost crushing the variety stores. The commodities that the people need everyday were supplied to them through relief goods instead of sari-sari stores. It was several months after Haiyan that variety stores rose again. 

Gemma is one of those variety store owners. Not only did Haiyan affect her business. Her income also diminishes during school breaks or vacations. It’s good that she also owns a tricycle driven by her husband, Norly, which provides supplemental income for the family. Now that school has begun, she needs more variety store items like snacks, toiletries and beverages. She also plans to pay the last installment on their tricycle, so that income can totally be used for her family’s needs and savings. She asks for your kind support to fund a loan in the amount of PHP 30,000. May you be God’s blessing to her as she aspires to improve her business.

Gemma is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more snacks, toiletries, beverages, and other items for her variety store

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita is a widow, 53 years old, with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Angelita has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Angelita applied for a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. Angelita has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Ariana

texts.en:
Ariana is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 55 years old and has two children who are in school.

Ariana has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Ariana has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Simeo

texts.en: Simeo is a 60-year-old hardworking married man, a farmer who also sells produce, which enables him to generate income and meet his family’s needs. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda, and he plans to buy a motorcycle in the near future to enable him move to his farm and access the market with ease. He complains of inadequate capital and fluctuations in the prices of the goods he sells. He is applying for a loan to buy manure, fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides to improve his banana farm.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides to improve his banana farm.

loans.name: Devano

texts.en: Devano is a 50-year-old married man with seven children, all of whom attend school, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He runs a butcher shop and has been working four days in a week since 2004. He also grows food crops to earn extra income. His intention is to stock more cattle and establish several butcher shops, since the market seems to be okay. Devano faces challenges of inadequate capital and competition from similar businesses. He has applied for a loan to buy more cattle to butcher for sale.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to butcher and sell.

loans.name: Yessenia María

texts.es:
En el barrio Altamira de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Altamira, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico. 
En este lugar vive la señora Yessenia tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 13, 6 y 5 años, el mayor estudian en colegio y  los menores en escuela, actualmente está en su 6 mes de embarazo se su 4to hijo. Su esposo es taxista. Ella hace tiempo atrás aprendió corte y confección en una academia en la localidad.
Doña Yessenia es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta a base de esfuerzo ganar sus ingresos para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar y estudios de sus hijos, ella tiene un taller de costura en su casa, allí se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, esto le deja muy buenos ingresos,  trabaja desde su casa y al mismo tiempo atiende su hogar y a sus pequeños.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos y otros materiales de costura. Lleva 15 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su taller.
texts.en:
The Altamira community bank meets twice a month in Manta's Altamira neighborhood. Manta is known for its beautiful beaches, a draw for tourists from both Ecuador and abroad, and for its port on the Pacific, one of the most important ports in the country and in South America.
Sra. Yessenia, 36, and her husband have three children: 13-, 6- and 5-years old.  Their oldest child is in high school and the two younger children are in elementary school.  Sra. Yessenia is now pregnant with the couple's fourth child.  Her husband is a taxi driver.  Sra. Yessenia learned to cut and stitch at a local vocational school a few years ago.  She is a hard-working woman and liked the idea of starting her own business so that she could help her husband with the family's expenses.  She also wanted to generate an extra income to support her children's schooling.  She has her own workshop now where she makes clothing for men, women and children.  She operates the business at home and says that her earnings help her and her children.
Sra. Yessenia will use ths loan to buy the cloth, thread and other material that she needs to carry on her business.  She has been a member of the community bank for 15 years and likes it because past loans have helped her a lot.  Her greatest wish is to go on improving her workshop.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her sewing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom at their home, to improve their of access to sanitation and water.

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
El Sr. Alcides es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, es vendedor ambulante, y comenta que se dedica a este trabajo hace más de 5 años, y ya tiene una clientela bien formada.
Alcides es un cliente antiguo de la fundación y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona luchadora y sacrificada.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas, calzados y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Alcides is from the city of Paraguarí in Paraguay.   He is a walking salesman.  He comments that he has been working in this field for five years and he has an established customer base.  Alcides is a long-term client of Kiva's field partner and has always been characterized as a hard-working and self-sacrificing person.  

He is asking for a loan in order to invest in the purchase of various items of clothing, such as shoes and other items, in order to continue his work as he has been doing.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of various items of clothing, such as shoes and other items

loans.name: Agapito

texts.es:
El Sr. Agapito tiene 56 años, está casado hace 38 años con la señora Carmen de 55 años, el matrimonio tiene 5 hijos, es una familia muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere salir adelante.
El señor Agapito tiene una despensa en su casa donde vende todo tipo de productos, incluyendo productos agrícolas, también se dedica  a la compra y venta de ganado, toda la familia se ayuda para poder crecer.   
Agapito solicita el préstamo para la compra de arroz, harina, gaseosas, condimentos, animales vacunos, y así ofrecer a sus clientelas productos de primera calidad que le permita mejorar su ingreso.
texts.en:
Agapito is 56 years old and has been married for 38 years to Carmen, who is 55 years old.  They have 5 children and are a hard-working family who struggles because they want to get ahead. 

Agapito has a store in his home where he sells all kinds of products, including agricultural items.  He also works buying and selling cattle. The entire family helps to raise the animals.  

Agapito is asking for a loan in order to purchase rice, flour, sodas, condiments, and cattle.  This will allow him to offer his clients a range of high quality products and to improve his business.

loans.use: o purchase rice, flour, sodas, condiments, and cattle.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El grupo Renacer está en su ciclo número 10 del programa de comité de mujeres, el grupo lleva ese nombre llamado Renacer ya que ellas buscan el renacer y el resurgir de sus seres queridos. Están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas luchan por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Amelia, una de las integrantes, pide este préstamo para poder comprar cervezas, gaseosas, vinos y otros, para poder seguir con su trabajo en la venta de bebidas. Amelia es una mujer muy luchadora y sacrificada que quiere salir adelante y dar a sus seres queridos una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Ella y sus compañeras están entusiasmadas por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias y poder seguir capacitándose para poder crecer.
texts.en:
The group "Rebirth" is in its 10th loan cycle with the committee for women.  The group is named "Renacer" or "Rebirth" since they are looking to restart and energize their loved ones.   They are part of a program to eliminate poverty, and all of the struggle to improve their living conditions. 

Amelia, one of the group members, is asking for a loan in order to purchase sodas, beer, wine and other items in order to continue with her work selling beverages.  Amelia is a hard-working and self-sacrificing woman who wants to get ahead and give her loved ones a dignified life without privations.  She and her group are enthusiastic to be able to improve their quality of life and that of their families and to be able to continue training that will help them grow.

loans.use: to purchase sodas, beer, wine and other items in order to continue with her work selling beverages.

loans.name: Palmira

texts.es:
Palmira es artesana, hija de una conocida artesana, comenta que se ha abierto camino por sus propios méritos y que también ya es muy conocida en la zona. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que se esta abriendo camino, y comenta que su préstamo anterior le ha sido de mucha ayuda.
Pide este préstamo para poder seguir con su trabajo, e invertir nuevamente en sus artesanías, quiere comprar hilos, hilos de colores, agujas y demás insumos. Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en: Palmira is an artisan, the daughter of a known artisan. She comments that she has moved forward thanks to her own merits, and also that she is already well known in the area. She is a very hardworking and enterprising person who is moving forward, and she comments that her previous loan has been very helpful. She is asking for this loan to continue with her work and to invest again in her handcrafts. She wants to buy threads, color threads, needles and other supplies. She is grateful for this new given opportunity to be able to continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy threads, color threads, needles and other supplies.

loans.name: Santo Domingo Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santo Domingo es un grupo nuevo, que se formó para poder  mejorar la vida de cada una de ellas. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde tres señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema.
Pelagia integra este grupo, es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que a través de su esfuerzo y lucha ha ido mejorando. Ella vende remedios naturales y también tiene una despensa bien surtida en la cual trabaja día a día desde muy temprano. Pelagia quiere seguir creciendo y mejorando, y es por eso que está contenta por formar parte del grupo, ya que podrá seguir capacitándose y crecer.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar remedios naturales para la venta, y también productos para poder surtir su despensa con verduras, panificados, lácteos, carne y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The group called Santo Domingo is a new group which was formed to improve the lives of each of them. They are doing the Poverty Stoplight program, where three of the women are below the poverty line, that is to say in extreme poverty.

Pelagia is a member of the group. She is hardworking and a fighter who through her efforts and struggling has improved. She sells natural remedies and also has a well stocked food pantry from which she works starting early every day.
