Pelagia wants to continue growing and improving and this is why she is happy to be a part of the group so they can continue training and growing.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy natural remedies to sell and also products to supply her food pantry such as vegetables, bakery goods, dairy products, meat, and more so that she can continue with her entrepreneurship.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies, and vegetables, bakery goods, dairy products, meat, and other supplies to stock her food pantry.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy dress clothing, jeans, shirts, t-shirts and other types of clothing

loans.name: Faisi

texts.en:
Faisi lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda and has two children, one of whom is in school. As a widow, her children are her responsibility and so she must work hard to support them.

Faisi buys and sells cocoa and matooke, a type of cooking banana. She also farms to supplement her income.

Faisi is applying for a 500,000 UGX loan through Kiva's field partner HOFOKAM to buy more matooke to sell. She has plans to open a shop to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy more matooke, or cooking bananas, to sell.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Esperanza  está en el 4to. ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas luchan por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Karina ella  es cliente de la Fundación y se dedica a la venta de ropas en un local en el circuito comercial,  tiene varias operaciones canceladas con la institución  y siempre ha cumplido de la mejor manera. Karina es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que se esfuerza para poder mejorar cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas varias para la venta, como ser remeras, camisas, jeans, pantalones, blusas, vestidos y otros, ella está contenta por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The Esperanza group is in their fourth cycle of the women's committee program, where they all work and help one another to get out ahead. They are conducting the survey to eliminate poverty, where they are all fighting to be able to improve the quality of their lives. One of the members, Mrs. Karina, is a client of the Foundation and makes a living selling clothes in the commercial center. She has had various operations cancelled with the institution but she has always finished in the best way. 

Karina is a hard-working fighter who challenges herself to get better every day. She requests this loan to purchase a variety of clothes to sell like knitted tops, t-shirts, jeans, pants, blouses, dresses, and more. She is happy about the opportunity to receive assistance and continue to grow.

loans.use: Purchase knitted tops, t-shirts, jeans, pants, blouses, dresses, and more to sell.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
La señora Estela tiene 45 años, es de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso,  es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere salir adelante y se esfuerza cada día.
Ella tiene una despensa, en la que trabaja desde muy temprano en la mañana y hasta muy tarde en la noche. Comenta que por medio de su trabajo ayuda a sus seres queridos y les da una vida digna.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar artículos varios para poder surtir su despensa como ser azúcar, yerba, panificados y bebidas en general. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
Estela is 45 years old and from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.  She is a very hard-working and enthusiastic woman that wants to get ahead and works hard everyday.  She has a general store, where she works from very early in the morning until very late at night.

She comments that through her work, she helps her loved ones and gives them a dignified life.  She is requesting this loan to be able to purchase various articles like sugar, herbs, breads, and beverages to be able to stock her store.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she's receiving to be able to grow and improve.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, herbs, breads and beverages in general.

loans.name: Ahmadjon

texts.en:
Ahmadjon is a strong young man. He was born in southern Tajikistan in 1995 and lives in a remote district with his parents.

Ahmadjon is a second-year medical student at university. He wants to be a doctor and treat patients. His grades are excellent, and he is active in his classes.

Ahmadjon has applied for a 5,300 TJS loan through Kiva's field partner IMON International to pay for medical school costs. He hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: pay for medical school costs.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Thanks for your unwavering support to Aida. Because of the loan that you granted her recently, she was able to buy more products for her sari-sari (variety store). This has aided in meeting her household's basic expenses and helped in attracting more customers as well. 

To continue what she had started, she would like to avail herself of another 10,000 PHP loan that she would use to pay for more grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell at her store. Your small act of generosity now will be a good head start to Aida's dream of expanding her business and giving a better life to her family. 

She meets every week with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Asitajona

texts.en:
Asitajona is 37 years old, married with six children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She trades in cocoa, mainly buying and selling to agents and cocoa companies, and she gets additional income from farming and selling food stuffs like cassava and maize. 

She started the cocoa business to raise income for her family and to pay school fees for the children; her main challenge is limited capital. She hopes to expand the business, educate her children and support the family in getting basic needs. Asitajona has asked for a loan to buy cocoa seeds for resale.

loans.use: To buy cocoa seeds for resale.

loans.name: Ana Luzmila

texts.es:
Ana, en su mente lo único que tiene presente es que para salir adelante hay que trabajar duramente y mantenerse siempre fuerte ante las adversidades que se puedan presentar.

Por esta razón, todos los días labora de una manera firme pero sin dejar a un lado su gran sonrisa y carisma que le han permitido ganarse un lugar desde hace 36 año cuando decidió abrir su negocio de venta de comestibles en el municipio de Medellín.

En su negocio ofrece alimentos variados, los cuales son muy apetecidos por los clientes que visitan regularmente su negocio como chontaduro y dulces.

Pide un apoyo económico para la compra surtido de estos alimentos para abastecer su inventario.

Ella sabe que de la mano de interactuar y con el apoyo de los prestamistas de KIVA podrá tener un negocio muy bien acreditado y con la mejor estabilidad posible.
texts.en:
The uppermost thing in Ana’s mind is that she has to work hard and always keep strong in the face of adversity in order to get ahead in life.

For this reason, she works hard every day, using the big smile and charisma that enabled her to find a place 36 years ago when she decided to open her food business in the municipality of Medellín.

She sells different kinds of food, such as fruit from the peach-palm and sweets, which are highly appreciated by her regular customers.

She is requesting financial support so she can buy stock for her inventory.

She knows that with the help of Interactuar and Kiva lenders, she will be able to have a well-established and stable business.

loans.use: to buy food supplies for her inventory

loans.name: Sor Melida

texts.es:
Sor es una mujer luchadora, trabajadora, una persona que nos e queja y sale a la calle en busca del sustento para su hogar, tiene una venta de jeans en las calles gracias a este negocio genera el sustento para su familia.
Ella sueña con tener un local propio, al trabajar en la calle corre el riesgo de ser expulsada por no tener un local propio, corre el riesgo de robos e inclusive extorciones para poder trabajar, por ello quiere recoger el capital suficiente para montar un local y que lo pueda sostener.

Por el momento Sor es feliz con lo que tiene y espera este año tener la alegría de montar el local que tanto anhela.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa como lo son Blue Jeans, camisas, pantalones, mejorando y actualizando su exhibición buscando captar mayor público.
texts.en:
Sor is a fighting, hardworking woman. She is a person who doesn’t complain but goes out in search of sustenance for her household. She sells jeans as a street vendor and thanks to this business generates a living for her family.

She dreams of having her own place. Working on the street runs the risk of being driven off for not having her own facility, runs the risk of robbery, and even extortion in order to be able to work. This is why she wants to have sufficient capital to open her own store so she can maintain it.

Sor is happy for the moment with what she has and hopes this year to have the joy of opening the store she longs for.

She is asking for a loan to buy clothing such as blue jeans, shirts, and pants to improve and update her display looking to capture a wider audience.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as blue jeans, shirts, and pants, to improve and update her display hoping to capture a wider audience

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is married with two children; one attends school in Bundibugyo, Uganda. In 2000 he began trading mainly in cocoa so as to take care of his family's needs. He also farms and makes bricks for additional income.

He is applying for a 500,000 UGX loan through Kiva's field partner HOFOKAM to buy more cocoa beans to sell. He dreams of expanding his cocoa business into new markets so he can send his children to university and build a good house.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa beans to sell.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a 53-year-old married woman. She has been involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases a variety of cloth at low prices from city markets and sells it in her own town. She has a strong customer base. 

Shameem has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to boost her earnings with her loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to boost her earnings.

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es: Marcos de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, el se dedica desde hace 15 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Marcos, 45, lives in his own house with his three children.  He has earned a living in farming for 15 years, growing corn and beans.  He sells his crops in the various markets near his home.  With what he earns from his sales he's able to pay for some of his household expenses.

Marcos is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, soil amendments, pest control, and so on.  He's also going to improve the plot of land shown in the photograph so he can keep working and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, soil amendments, pest control, etc., and to improve his plot of land

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 65-years-old, a widow and comes from the province of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She has remained a widow since her husband died and has dedicated herself to taking care of her only offspring, who is a special child, now age 40. Raising her special child has been her biggest challenge, but with her strong faith in God she has been able to surmount this trial in her life.

Virginia is grateful that God has blessed her with a general store and eatery business for ten years already. It has been her stable source of income to support herself and her special child's daily needs.  She buys essential food items from a wholesaler, such as canned goods, coffee, biscuits, beverages, and toiletries and sells them at retail prices. Aside from her small store, she also has a small eatery that sells simple snacks. At times her income is quite low, but being a positive woman, she is able to persevere and carry on her business with joy in her heart. 

To help her expand operations of her store she is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy large quantities of grocery items to add to her store. Part of the loan she will use to buy ingredients like fresh meat, vegetables, and condiments to cook meals for her small eatery. She is thanking God and you in advance for your good heart and the financial aid that will be given her. Her earnings are a big help to cover her and her son's daily sustenance. 

Virginia hopes to still grow and expand her store. She prays that God will continue to bless her with good health and long life so she can continue to look after her special child. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

 *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her general store.

loans.name: Shabnamgul

texts.en:
Shabnamgul is a responsible woman. She was born in a northern part of Tajikistan in 1994. She is living in a remote district with her family. From her childhood she was taught about taking care livestock and helped her parents in their activity. Unfortunately, her father died when she was a child and it was hard for her mother to ensure and feed their family. Her mother went to Russia to find a job, but it did not help them to live better. Recently her mother works as an assistant at a government agency. 

After graduation of high school, she entered the university by herself through examination. It is her second year of studies, but she has not enough money to pay for education. Her mother gave her to marriage. The family of her husband is living poor. 

She is a capable, skillful, talented person. Her husband earns working as a rental worker. She decided to sew traditional women’s dresses at home and help her husband with finances. She gave birth to a child and all the saved up money was spent on their child. Unfortunately, she does not have money to pay her higher education costs. She asks for a loan from Kiva and IMO to pay her higher education costs. She awaits Kiva lenders’ kindness and hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to pay her higher education costs.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Carmelita is 51 years old and has one child still in school.

Carmelita has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines. Carmelita requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy spare parts, gasoline and maintenance for her motorcycle transportation.

Carmelita has been in this business for three years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, gasoline and maintenance for her motorcycle transportation.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 64 years old and a widow with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. 

Regina has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more clothes to sell. She has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Regina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Esmeralda Maria

texts.es:
Esmeralda es una joven de 24 años de edad, una persona humilde falta de recursos, madre cabeza de familia, pero que quiere salir adelante, superar las adversidades que se le presentan en el camino todo con trabajo y honestidad y más que tiene un motivo muy especial por el cual luchar que es su hija de 5 años.

Esmeralda junto un capital y compro un surtió de Snaks  y productos de la canasta familiar, conforme iba ganando un poco de dinero compraba madera y de ahí construyo las estanterías, en pocas palabras su negocio lo está construyendo paso a paso y ahora es hora de seguir avanzando, ya que solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido como abarrotes, refrescos y algunos granos.

Su sueño es tener una venta de productos de la canasta familiar y sabe que con la ayuda de interactuar junto con su aliado KIVA lo lograra.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is a 24-year-old young woman. She has few resources and is the head of her family, but she wants to get ahead in life and overcome the challenges that come her way through hard work and honesty. She has a very special reason for trying to get ahead in life: her five-year-old daughter.

Esmeralda gathered together some capital and bought some snacks and basic household products. She earned some money and bought some wood to build shelves. In short, she is building her business step by step and it is now time to keep expanding it. She is requesting a loan so she can buy groceries, soft drinks and some staple grains.

Her dream is to sell all the products that a household needs. She knows that she can achieve this with the help of Interactuar and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy groceries, soft drinks, and some staple grains for her business

loans.name: Mubeen

texts.en:
Mubeen is a 33-year-old, married woman. 

She has been in the beauty parlor business for many years. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through her providing of the best services she has become very famous on her street. 

In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying a variety of cosmetic products for the parlor.  That is why she has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR: to buy hair care products, skin products and hair rollers to treat more customers thus gaining profits to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and hair rollers to treat more customers.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana, 45, is married, has four children and is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery. She creates beautiful designs and patterns and has used this skill for many years to earn a living. Her special talent is known throughout the town.

Rukhsana has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR through Kiva's field partner Kashf Foundation to buy more beads, threads and embroidery frames. She wishes to be able to finish her customers’ orders on time and earn a good amount in profits.

Rukhsana dreams of providing her children with a quality education.

loans.use: to buy more beads, threads and embroidery frames.

loans.name: Luz Amparo

texts.es:
Luz amparo tiene 52 años de edad, separada, no tiene hijos dependientes, vive en casa familar domicliada en el distrito de OYOTUN la cual es una zona rural, que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo, Región Cajamarca, costa norte de Perú.

Luz amparo se dedica a brindar servicios como ayudante de cocina en un restaurante en el distrito de Oyotun, hace 1 año, con buenas referencias laborales y personales. Solicita préstamo para activo fijo; compra y mantenimiento de utensilios de trabajo y otros gastos afines, así mejorar sus condiciones de trabajo y poder brindar un buen servicio, de esta manera generará mayores ingresos,y tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Luz Amparo is 52, divorced and has no dependent children. She lives at the family house located in the OYOTUN district, which is a rural area in the Chiclayo province, Cajamarca Region, north coast of Perú.

Luz Amparo has been working as a kitchen assistant in a restaurant in the Oyotun district for a year. She has good business and personal references.

She is requesting a loan for a fixed asset: to buy and maintain working utensils and for other related expenses. Thus, she will be able to improve her working conditions and to provide a good service. This way she will generate higher income and will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy and maintain working utensils and for other related expenses

loans.name: Gerly

texts.en:
Weaving clothes is like shaping your life. Before an end product comes, the fabric needs to undergo cuts from its edges and a lot of pierces with the needle. 

In spite of those, Gerly still carries the spirit. She is only 33 years of age and for her two kids, there is nothing that she won't do. As of now, she is involved in a tailoring business at their community in Pasay City, Philippines. This inventory has already helped her a lot in maintaining her household. 

She is really dreaming that this business will expand and grow in progress. To start reaching this dream, she needs your help. She would like to take a loan worth PHP 12,000 that she would utilize to buy additional supplies of materials she needs to weave more clothes from the needles, fabrics, and threads. Part of the amount will be used also for the maintenance of her weaving machine. 

Today, she is diligent enough and hardworking in her trade. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies of materials she needs to weave more clothes from the needles, fabrics, and threads.

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en:
Nazeeran is a 60-year-old, married woman. She is a mother of 8 children. 

She, along with her husband, has been buying and selling animals for many years. She is working hard to provide for her family. 

Now, she has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She hopes to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 50 years old and married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a general store business in the Philippines. 

Wilma has requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell. She has been in this business for three years. In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma, 48, is married and talented in the art of hand embroidery. She creates beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to garner a consistent clientele, which allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her continue her operations, Salma has applied for a 50,000 PKR loan through Kiva's field partner Kashf to buy spools of thread in different colors and packets of beads, sequins and stones to embellish her work. She wishes to gain more customers so as to increase in her income.

Salma dreams of a bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread in different colors and packets of beads, sequins and stones

loans.name: Alijon

texts.en:
Alijon is an active boy. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1996. He lives in the district with his big family. 

His family is busy in agriculture, raising and breeding livestock. He always helps his parents after school. 

He and his parents wish for him to be educated. After graduating from high school with excellence, Alijon wanted to enter to university. He had heard about Kiva, and asked his parents to apply for a loan. 

He has taken the chance that he will get a loan to enter university. He has made a request through IMON International, asking for financial support to pay his higher education costs to study at university. He hopes to be supported and awaits the kindness of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay his higher education costs to study at university

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Sophat, 52, lives in a small community in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. He is the father of three children. To make a living and support his family, he grows and sells rice. On average, he is able to make an income of 2 USD a day.

Sophat wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by building a latrine, as there isn’t one in his house now. He has received a 500 USD loan through Kiva's field partner Hattha Kaksekar Limited to do so. In this way he can give his family more sanitary conditions, promote their health and help to lessen environmental degradation.

Sophat is thankful for the loan granted through HKL, as it has a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
As a zealous member of CCT Credit Cooperative for more than five years, Emily gains good values with entrepreneurship that she can apply on her business as rice dealer. She has some problems with delayed payments by her customers, but she can still manage her business well through proper rolling of capital. 

Although of course, her family’s daily sustenance and her children’s everyday allowances are affected by these long time debts. She has been very considerate to her debtors, but she needs to maintain her business too. This is why Emily wants to borrow additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy more sacks of rice. This will bring extra profits for her and will help provide for their daily needs and the children’s education. 

She and her husband, Semalie, both work hard in order to see their children finish their schooling. She regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice.

loans.name: Hermogina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Hermogina works hard to support her family.

She has a peanut butter-processing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from poultry. Hermogina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Hermogina has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Julieta works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish vending. Julieta is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Julieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl is 44 years old and single with five children. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. 

Sheryl is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pig. She has been in this business for eight years and also earns additional income from fishing. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia, 27, is a vigorous, married woman. She has had a business doing hand embroidery for many years. She knows the art of making beautiful embroidery patterns with beads and pearls. 

She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day.
 
Her husband does not earn enough to support his family well on his own. Asia’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. 

She wants to grow her business so she has requested a loan of 45,000 Pakistani rupees. She will use the loan to buy large quantities of raw materials, such as thread, sequins and pearls, to complete her customers' orders on time.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of raw materials, such as thread, sequins and pearls, to complete her customers' orders on time.

loans.name: Manilyn

texts.en:
Manilyn is 27 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Manilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Manilyn has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 29 years old and has two children. She is married and has one child in school. She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Irene has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been in this business for nine years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Irene would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
As the married mother of three children, Mary Ann works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Mary Ann is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell to customers. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to customers.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 38 years old and married with two children who are still in school.  She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items of groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, shampoo and other personal care products.

Alma has been in this business for 15 years.  She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items of groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, shampoo and other personal care products.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Joan is 37 years old and has four children who are currently in school. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

Joan has requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more boxes of fish to sell in her food stall. Joan has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca lives in Atsabe, is married and has two children. She is a business women, so a loan of $600 is being offered to her to improve her business. 

She has a small kiosk, so she is taking this loan. She will use the loan to buy additional supplies, such as sugar, salt, noodles and cooking oil, to keep her store stocked. 

Francisca has been involved in business activities since 2005. She started with her own working capital of $800. She feels very happy to run her business, because it has become her activity. She also raises animals, like cows, pigs, chickens and dogs.

Running a business has made Francisca independent, because she can be responsible for her family.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, noodles, cooking oil and other things to sell.

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
Las Mercedes es un grupo rural, donde todas se dedican a actividades de ese tipo, son de una zona de difícil acceso alejada de la zona de la capital del país.
La Sra. Carmen es una de las integrantes, tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de gallinas, ella trabaja en este  plan de negocios como un medio de poder ayudar a su familia, y darles una vida digna y sin privaciones. Carmen es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha y se esmera para poder crecer.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar gallinas para poder criar y después vender, y luego por medio de su trabajo poder procurarse los medios para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Las Mercedes is a rural group and all of them work at rural activities. They are from a place that is difficult to access, far away from the capital of the country.  

Carmen is one of the members. She has a small business selling chickens. She works in this type of business as a way to help her family and give them a dignified life that lacks for nothing. Carmen is a very hard working person who fights and strives to be able to grow. 

She is asking for this loan to buy chickens to raise and later sell and later, though her work, be able to obtain the means to help her family.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise.

loans.name: Humura Abagambakamu Group

texts.en:
Mary is a member of Humura Abagambakamu Group where members guarantee each other. She is age 37 with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a retailer and a farmer, growing food crops like bananas and cassava. 

She faces hardships of low capital that hinder expansion of her businesses. However, she is working very hard to make sure she buys land where she can expand her farm. Mary requests a loan to buy cassava flour, soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour, soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 39 years old and married with one child.

Marife works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items of groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, shampoo, and other personal care products.

Marife has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from buying and selling fruits and vegetables.

Marife aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items of groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, shampoo, and other personal care products.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
“With the grace of God, we will be able to put up a big, profitable piggery, and our children will complete their education, acquire decent jobs, and live a better life.”

Rowena from Bacolod City, Negros Occidental, speaks this phrase with faith as she shares her aspirations with her co-fellowship* members at CCT. For almost seven years, she has been a dedicated member of the organization, where she continually gains inspiration from Bible reflections and sharing of life experiences.

Rowena is married to Abner, a broker, who is suffering from high blood pressure. They have children who are studying in college. Expenses for her husband’s medication and her children’s education are quite expensive. That’s why she tries to earn extra money by raising hogs in their backyard. So far, it’s been very helpful in sustaining their everyday expenses.

As of now, she needs to buy additional piglets and feed; that is why she is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. With additional piglets, she can increase her income and can supply more consumers in their community in the next few months. She is praying that you would be one of God’s instruments to help her. She would really appreciate your kind support.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Miguel está integrado por 14 mujeres, están en  el 4to  ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan ya que se encuentran en la misma comunidad, están trabajando para superar su situación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Señora Juana, quien participa siempre de una manera activa en todas las capacitaciones que recibe por parte del programa de comité de mujeres. Juana tiene una despensa en la que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas, y con su trabajo tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia.
Ella pide este préstamo ya que quiere surtirse para poder ofrecer una mejor variedad a sus clientes, quiere comprar verduras, frutas, bebidas, comestibles, productos a granel y otros, para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y salir adelante.
texts.en:
The San Miguel group is made up of 14 women. They are in their 4th cycle of the women's committee program. All of them work and help each other because they are in the same community. They are working to overcome their poverty situation.   

One of the members is Juana, who always participates in an active way in the trainings she receives through the women's committee. Juana has a store where she works every day from the early morning hours. With her work, she has the means to help her family. 

She is asking for this loan because she wants to offer a wider variety to her customers. She wants to buy vegetables, fruit, edible goods, bulk goods and more, in order to continue with her sales as she has been doing. She is thankful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to keep growing and getting ahead.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, beverages, edible goods, bulk goods and more.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda works hard to support her family. She is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Melinda has been in this business for 10 years now. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is a married woman. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

Rufina has requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell. She has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Rufina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Ethelyn

texts.en:
Ethelyn is 58 years old and married. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ethelyn has been in this business for five years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Villa 23 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
El grupo está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, todas las integrantes se unieron para poder crecer y salir adelante y dar a sus familias una vida digna y sin privaciones, es por ello que ponen todo lo mejor de sí.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Dominga, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que está en un nivel de pobreza extrema. Dominga se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogo, y es por medio de su trabajo que tiene los medios para poder ofrecer a su familia lo que necesita para una vida digna.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de esmaltes, prendas, artículos de bazar, calzados y otros productos que le hicieron pedido sus clientes con catalogo y de esa forma poder cumplir con ellos. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir mejorando.
texts.en:
This group is part of a poverty elimination program. Its members formed the group in order to keep growing, move forward, and give their families a decent life with nothing lacking, and they give their all toward these goals. 

Dominga is one of the members. She ranks in level 1 of poverty according to evaluations, which is to say that she lives in a state of extreme poverty. She makes a living selling products by catalog, and this work gives her the means to be able to offer her family a decent life. She is requesting this loan to invest in nail polish, clothing, shoes, small items, and other products that her customers have requested in the catalog, so that she may fulfill their requests. She is thankful for the opportunity she is given to keep improving.

loans.use: to invest in nail polish, clothing, shoes, small items, and other products to sell by catalog.

loans.name: Villa De Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El grupo Villa de Mercedes se formó en la ciudad de San Pedro, son 17 mujeres que se unieron para poder buscar un mejor porvenir para sus seres queridos.
La señora Marias cuenta con un puesto de productos agrícolas en el mercado, adquiere productos de un proveedor y también cuenta con producción propia. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que no teme a los desafíos y es por eso que pone su mejor para poder crecer y mejorar cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar productos agrícolas para la venta, como tomates, locotes, zapallos y otros, y de esa manera a poder seguir con su microemprendimiento. Agradece por la gran ayuda que recibe de poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The Villa de Mercedes Group was formed in the city of San Pedro when 17 women joined together to seek a better future for their loved ones. 
Marias has a produce stall in the market. She buys products from a supplier and also relies on her own production. She is a very hard-working person who is unafraid of challenges which is why she does her best to grow and improve each day. 
She requests this loan in order to buy agricultural products to sell such as tomatoes, peppers, squash, and more. In this way, she will be able to continue with her small enterprise. She is grateful for all of the help that she receives as it allows her to help her loved ones.

loans.use: buy tomatoes, peppers, squash, and more.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Rainy season is fast approaching in the Philippines. This season is difficult for fishermen and fish vendors. Practically, it’s dangerous for fishermen to go fishing. The scarcity of fish makes the price higher, and the fish vendors find it hard to afford. 

Jose, 69, is a dried fish vendor who resides in Tigbauan, Iloilo. He also owns a variety store that sells usual commodities like canned goods, snacks, toiletries, condiments, and many others. He decided to run a variety store, because dried fish vending is unstable especially during rainy season. Now he wants to prepare for the upcoming rainy days. 

He is requesting additional capital of PHP 25,000 to buy a volume quantity of fresh fish while it’s still cheap. He will dry it and sell it afterwards. This additional capital will keep his dried fish business running, even during rainy season. He will also use part of the loan to buy more supplies for his variety store. You can be the answer to his prayers through your generous support. Thank you so much in advance.

Jose is married to Merna and they have children who are still studying in college. Two or three years from now, he will be relieved of his children’s educational expenses. He can give full focus to his dream of improving his business. He is an enthusiastic member of CCT where he gains inspiration from his co-fellowship* members who regularly meet once a week to study the Word of God and share stories of their life and businesses. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy a volume quantity of fresh fish for drying and selling.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy the ingredients for five school days such as rice, soybeans, noodles for meals and wheat flour, sugar, etc. for cakes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs and in this way increase the sales of his business in order to have greater income.

loans.name: Jeanny

texts.en:
Jeanny is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jeanny is 45 years old and has one child still in school.

Jeanny has a fishing business in the Philippines. Jeanny requested a 20,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in the market.

Jeanny has been in this business for 26 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in the market.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima lives in Oe-cusse. She is married and she has two children. 

She is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to improve her business. She will to use the loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk, such as sugar, cooking oil, cigarettes, milk, roses, salt, noodles, and other things. 

Fatima opened her kiosk in 2011 with her own working capital of USD 2000. She is happy with the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin to have more working capital, to buy more goods. She also cultivates animals, like pigs, chicken, and dogs.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, cigarettes, milk, roses, salt, noodles, and other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beauty products such as perfumes, creams, dyes, etc., and in this way obtain greater earnings and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda has been in a gravel and sand business for four years. She is 46 years old, has been living with her live-in partner for five years, and has three children from her former husband. Imelda also manages hog-raising and rice-farming businesses.

Imelda would like to keep her gravel and sand business progressive and profitable; that's the reason why she's asking for additional capital. She is seeking a loan of PHP9,000 to be used in buying gasoline and loads of gravel and sand. She knows that her additional capital has much to do with the improvement of her gravel and sand business. Imelda would be thankful if her requested loan was granted.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and loads of gravel and sand.

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Raising five children is quite challenging, but here is Nerissa. She doesn’t focus on difficulties; instead she considers her big family as companions through triumphs and trials. She is married to Garry, a helper, who gives all out support in raising their five children. 

Nerissa is into buying and selling onions in Tondo, Manila. She’s been doing this for six years and it’s a good supplementary source of income for her family. She gets sacks of onions at a wholesale price, and then sells them per kilo at Divisoria market, a known plea market in Manila where prices of goods are much lower than other markets. But for whatever reason, there are times when policemen barge into their rented space at Divisoria market and demand some fine from them. 

This shakes the stability of her business, thus she plans to put up a space in front of their house where she can sell not only onions, but also other stuff such as fruits and vegetables. She needs additional capital of PHP 8,000 to buy these. She’s positive that it will boost her income and will sustain their everyday expenditures. 

She wants to see all her children finish their schooling to gain better opportunity for a more decent wage. She draws inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share stories of their lives and businesses and to draw strength the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy other fruits and vegetables in addition to her usual product which is onions.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Helen works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Helen is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell for her buy-and-sell banana business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Hoima Uagnda. She is aged 29, married with 2 children of ages 2 and 4 years. She operates a salon whereby she plaits hair for ladies, selling synthetic hair braids, lotions and other cosmetics for women. She has always admired improving and growing her business to attract more customers that will increase her profits. 

She will use the loan facility to buy more cosmetics like hair food, sprays and others items for sale.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics like hair food, sprays and others for selling.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph intends to use the loan to pay for labor for planting on his farm. He does farming, where he grows mostly maize, and he lives in Masindi, Uganda. Joseph is married with two children and all attend school. Joseph started the business to cater for his family and have a strong source of income. He desires to educate his children to university level, despite the difficulty of seasonal changes affecting his expected returns.

loans.use: to pay for labor for planting on his farm.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
Ermelinda is applying for a loan of $ 1.000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop of second hand clothes. She started to do this business in 2013 with her own working capital of $500.00. Ermelinda is earning a good income from selling her second clothes because many people like to buy it, they are cheap and unique, when compared to new clothes. 

She is taking this loan because she wants to use to buy more second hand clothes such as children's clothes, shorts, pants, shirts, shoes and other clothes. She is very happy with the loan that offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more clothes.

loans.use: To buy second hand children's clothes, shorts, pants, shirts, shoes and other clothes.

loans.name: Senaida Patricia

texts.es: Patricia es una señora de 40 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 23, 22, 15, 13 y 10 años de edad mismos que los 3 están estudiando, el esposo de Patricia se dedica a trabajar de chofer, ella tiene 3 años su negocio que es una tienda de los productos de consumo masivo, el crédito que le va a otorgar Fodemi es para comprar mercadería para su tienda, lo que Patricia aspira es mejorar su negocio, ofrecer más variedad de productos y para aumentar sus ventas y por ende mejora su economía para seguir dando el estudio a sus hijos hasta que lleguen a tener su título universitario.
texts.en: Patricia is 40 years old. She is married and has 5 children, aged 23, 22, 15, 13 and 10. Three of them are in school. Patricia's husband works as a driver. She has had her business for 3 years. It is a store that sells products of mass consumption. The loan she is getting from Fodemi is to buy merchandise for her store. What Patricia aspires to is to improve her business, offer a wider variety of products and increase her sales and therefore her finances. This way, she can continue educating her children until they graduate from college.

loans.use: to buy products for her store.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: En la comunidad donde vive Jorge no hay acceso a energía eléctrica, por lo cual él  debe caminar largas distancias solo para tener cargado su teléfono celular. Jorge es un joven luchador y con muchas aspiraciones para su vida , actualmente trabaja como mayordomo en una finca desde hace cuatro años , su trabajo le gusta mucho, pero él también aspira en un futuro, llegar a  tener un pequeño negocio donde pueda vender alimentos y algunos artículos indispensables para higiene personal entre otros, por lo cual él solicita este préstamo para comenzar con este proyecto, porqué ya tendrá iluminacion,acceso a cargar el celular y esto le ayudara a levantarse más temprano para atender su trabajo.
texts.en: In the community where Jorge lives there is no access to electricity, so he has to walk long distances to simply charge his cell phone. Jorge is a hard-working young man with great aspirations in life. He has worked as a farmhand for 4 years. He likes the work a lot, but he also has dreams of having a future with a successful small business where he can sell food, personal hygiene, and other items. Therefore he is seeking this loan in order to begin this project. He will have light, access to charging his phone, and it will help him get up earlier in order to work.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for his home which will contribute to improving his quality of life.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
They say there’s money from garbage. This is also Josephine’s principle which is why she ventured into the buy-and-sell of scrap or junk. She buys scrap from individual collectors or scavengers, then she organizes it into types such as paper, board, plastic, bottles, and others. She will then sell these items to a junk shop. For some, it’s a filthy job but for Josephine, she will do everything to raise her eight children. She is a widow and she is currently living with Gener, a laborer. They are staying in Tigbauan, Iloilo.

Josephine also owns a pedicab but it’s still hard to imagine how she provides for her eight children. As for now, she appeals for PhP 10,000 in additional capital for buying scrap. Part of it will be used to buy spare parts for her pedicab. Hopefully, this will augment her family’s daily needs and support her children’s education.

She dreams that someday her children will finish schooling and have a better life. She’s also looking forward to owning a junk shop in the near future. She draws inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share stories of their life and business and to draw strength from the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more scrap materials for selling.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie owns a food stall in Pasay City. She has been operating the business for almost two years now. She is married to Joel, who is a driver. Whatever income she basically acquires from her chosen trade, she uses it for helping her husband in sustaining the family expenses. 

Filipinos are fond of eating heavy meals. Unlike other foreign countries who are only used to eating breads for lunch or dinner, most Filipinos can’t afford to not eat rice with dishes during lunches and dinners. And, it is a big help to most when there are food stalls along the roads where they can eat without even going home to just cook. This is the reason why perhaps Rosalie has chosen to manage a food stall then. Since food is always in demand, she earns well profit from this. 

However, Rosalie still wants to expand her business. She is asking a loan worth PHP 10 000. She will use this to buy more quantity of raw ingredients needed for her recipes. She wants to send you her sincerest thanks for your goodness and generosity by now. 

In the future, she wants her family to experience progress and improve as well in her current business. She dreams of having her own stall, house and lot, and earn for future investments. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more quantity of raw ingredients needed for her recipes.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marilou is 31 years old and has four children who are in school.

Marilou has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines. Marilou requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell.

Marilou has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a hardworking woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She used her previous loan to buy more shoes to sell.

In addition to her spare parts business, she also owns a shoe business for a living. She still faces a challenge of high rates of rent and transportation costs but has hopes of having a wholesale business and constructing a good home.

She is requesting a new loan to buy more secondhand shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more secondhand shoes to sell.

loans.name: Rosanie

texts.en:
Rosanie is 32 years old and married with four children, three of whom are currently in school. Rosanie works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items of groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, shampoo and other personal care products.

Rosanie has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items of groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, shampoo and other personal care products.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia, age 55,is a hardworking woman who has 5 children. She has been providing the service of sewing clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Razia ’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. 

Razia  has requested for a loan amount 40000 PKR. She intends to use this loan  to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently

loans.name: Jessica Estefania

texts.es: Estefanía tiene 22 años de edad, vive con sus padres y 4 hermanos que se encuentran estudiando, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa ambulante o por catalogo desde que tenía 15 años, Estefania tiene un bebe de 1 año y debe trabajar mucho para tener lo necesario para su bebe, Estefania necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería en ropa y tener más variedad de productos para mejorar sus ventas y mediante su negocio tener el dinero que le permita dar una buena alimentación a su hijo.
texts.en: Estefanía is 22 years old and lives with her parents and 4 siblings who are in school. She has been selling clothing via catalog or as a street vendor for 15 years. Estefanía  has a 1 year old baby and needs to work in order to support her child. Estefanía needs a loan to buy clothing in order to have a greater variety of products in order to improve her sales and through her business have the money that will enable her to support her son.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Nyamsuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Nyamsuren, 60 years old, lives with her daughter in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. She has been supplying drinking water to local people from her deep well since 2002. Her daughter works as manager at a carpet company. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and it needs urgent repair. So she is requesting a loan of 5000000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cements and fiberglass. After renovation, she and her daughter will live in comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, releasing less pollutant into air. The borrower is a very hardworking woman who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to renovate her house in order to burn less coal

loans.name: Las Orquideas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “Las Orquideas” es un grupo nuevo que forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, todas ellas quieren ayudar a sus seres queridos a mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mercedes, es una persona muy luchadora y trabajadora que ayuda a su familia por medio de sus ventas variadas. Mercedes tiene una muy buena clientela que se ha ganado gracias a que es muy buena en lo que hace y comenta que pide este préstamo para poder comprar calzados, ropas y colchas, para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
Todas las integrantes agradecen por las capacitaciones que vienen recibiendo.
texts.en:
"Las Orquideas" (The Orchids) is a new group, formed as part of the poverty elimination program. They all want to help their loved ones to have better living conditions.

One of the members is Mercedes, a hardworking and determined person who helps her family by means of varied sales. She has good clientele, whom she earned by being very good at what she does. She is requesting this loan to buy shoes, clothing, and quilts, in order to continue her sales like she has been doing.

All members of the group are grateful for the ongoing training they have received.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothing, and quilts for sales.

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
This is Liberty. Recently, she availed a loan that helped a lot in maintaining her barbecue stall business. With just a mere PHP 8,000, she was able to maximize the trade with enough raw ingredients she needed for cooking her specialty. Because of it, she was able to gain a higher income that paved a way for meeting the everyday needs of her family. 

She wants to continue this business. Determined enough to do so, she is willing to humbly ask you for a loan that she will be needing to buy greater quantities of meat and other ingredients. She wants you to know that PHP 13,000 is really an amount enough to continue her business operations. 

With hope and faith, she believes that your tender hearts will help her take a grip of her goal.  She dreams of expanding her business someday and for her family to have a better life ahead-not just financially, but also spiritually. She also wants her kids to finish schooling for future security as well. 

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy greater quantities of meat and other ingredients needed in her business.

loans.name: Camel Group

texts.en:
Doreen is a businesswoman and mother of three schooling kids. She is aged in her early forties. She has been running a poultry business since 2006. She works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. This will be Doreen's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. 

She used the previous loan to buy poultry equipment for feeding chicks and chickens, renovated the poultry house and bought more chicks and chicken feeds. She has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, started building her house and covered household expenses. She is happy with the loan. 

She will use this loan to buy chicks and chicken feeds for her poultry business. She dreams of finishing her house. Doreen will share this loan with her loan group, "CAMEL," which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: To buy chicks and chicken feeds for her poultry business

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
This is Herminia and she is asking for a loan that means a lot for her business expansion. 

Taking a small peek at her background, she has had a hard time finding ways to support her family, but that never stopped her from moving forward and reach her dreams. She is 48 years old now and with her self will and courage, she's making herself quite busy handling her buy-and-sell business. 

As you can see in the picture, she offers a variety of products. She sells footwear, shampoos, lotions and other accessories. From those sales, she gets income that serves as a remedy for her family's (seemingly unending) financial incapacity. At times, her sales do not meet her expectations, and it's really hard when such moments come. There are also circumstances when her capital is not enough. Being one of the bread winners of the family, Herminia doesn't want this business to end based on insufficiency. 

She believes that there is always a provision when there is a vision (a dream). This inspiration comes from the people around her that encourage her, including the people that she interacts with every week in regular fellowship. (Here, they share, testify and study the word of God.)

Prove to her that what she believes is true. She's asking for a loan worth 13,000 PHP that she will use to purchase additional products for her inventory. It only takes one small step for you to help Herminia. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for her inventory.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Load retailing or e-loading for cellphones is popular in the Philippines. Wherever there is a cellphone signal, there’s an e-loading business. This is due to the fact that most cellphone owners use a prepaid plan and only a few subscribe to a postpaid plan. In a prepaid arrangement, a person can budget his load usage because he can buy as little as a 10-peso load.

Ramon, a 61-year-old widower from Barotac Viejo, Iloilo, was encouraged to enter this e-loading business just recently. He has been driving a tricycle for nine years but his income doesn’t suffice especially when passengers are few. Aside from this, he’s already getting old and there are times when he cannot drive. Hence, he started this load retailing. In this way he can earn extra income while waiting for passengers or even at home. He knocks at your kind hearts for a loan worth PHP 8,000, which he can use partly to buy a load wallet and partly to pay for his tricycle maintenance. This loan will give him supplementary income for his everyday needs and some savings for the future. 

He is committed to CCT’s vision to alleviate poverty and he regularly meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy a load wallet for cellphone load retailing

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 32 years old and married with two children.

Melinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like beverages, school supplies, home care products, and other groceries.

Melinda has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Melinda aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like beverages, school supplies, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ginalyn is 26 years old and has two children who are in school.

Ginalyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ginalyn requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Ginalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Nermie

texts.en:
Nermie is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has an Avon dealership business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from E-loading (mobile prepaid load). Nermie is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of Avon products to offer for sale.

Nermie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of Avon products to offer for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to acquire more chips and phone credits.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya  is 55 years old, a married woman doing business of animals’ purchase and sale with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of 5 children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

She has requested a loan of 40000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount  to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater for more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers

loans.name: Roberto Feliciano

texts.es: Roberto tiene 37 años es soltero tiene un hijo y vive con sus padre en Guaranda provincia de Bolivar pertenece a la ventanilla rural Mushuc Pakari, el se dedica a la agricultura siembra papas y realiza quesos para vender, tambien cria animales, solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca para obtener mas leche y hacer mas quesos para poder vender en el mercado de Guaranda su sueño es comprarse un terreno para sembrar maiz, en su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en: Roberto is 37 years old, single, and has a son. He lives with his parents in Guaranda province of Bolivar in the village of Mushuc Pakari. He farms, growing potatoes and making cheeses to sell. He also raises animals. He seeks a loan to buy a cow in order to obtain milk and make more cheeses to sell at the Guaranda market. His dream is to buy himself land in order to grow corn. In his free time he enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Wilma Liliana

texts.es: Liliana es madre soltera, tiene 21 años y su hijo tiene 1 año. Liliana vive con sus padres y su hijo, son 4 años que se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, de esta manera es como  obtiene los ingresos económicos  para solventar sus gastos y sobre todo en la actualidad para la alimentación de su hijo. Liliana solicita el dinero del crédito para comprar chanchos, comenta que cerca de la casa de su madre tiene chancheras para cuidar sus animalitos, Liliana tiene la aspiración de seguir en su negocio, que se mejore para que las ganancias le permitan mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo.
texts.en: Liliana is a single mother. She is 21 years old and has a 1 year old son. Liliana lives with her parents and son. She has been raising small animals for 4 years. In this way she obtains income to support her expenses and above all, feed her child. Liliana seeks a loan to buy pigs. She states that near her mother's home she has pig pens to take care of her little animals. Liliana has aspirations to continue with her business, that is improves in order to increase income resulting in a better quality of life for her son.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Luzia

texts.en:
Luzia live in Atsabe, she is married and has 4 children. She is requesting a loan of $1200.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies to  keep in her store, including eggs, noodles, biscuits, aqua, sardines, milks, cooking oils, detergent, sugar, rose and other things to sell. She has been doing business since 2006 with her own working capital of $350.00. There six members in the family her 4 children including her husband. 

She wants to open a big store in the future so she is taking this loan to has a good management and to improve her business. She also cultivates animals like chickens.

loans.use: To buy eggs, noodles, biscuits, aqua, sardines, milks, cooking oils, detergent, sugar, rose and other things to sell.

loans.name: Zeenat

texts.en:
Zeenat is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting business of tailoring at her home, as her husband’s income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Zeenat is popularly known in her area for her skills in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. 

Therefore, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase stitching materials such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stitching materials such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.name: Kankori

texts.en:
Kankori  is 45 years old and is a married woman.  She deals in business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40000  to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales

loans.name: Urkupi¥A Group

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 37 años de edad, soltera, tiene 1 hijo de 8 años, y su negocio es la venta de burletes y felpa.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, activa, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por su intensa actividad económica y el asentamiento de los mercados más grandes de innumerables galerías y locales comerciales. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Maria es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás de la nuca, baja estatura, complexión física robusta,  su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (la segunda de la izquierda, viste blusa celeste mangas largas y jeans azul). Su vida la comparte con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. La necesidad de mejorar su negocio la llevó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; servicio de transporte, tienda de videos, venta de vajillas, venta de celulares, venta de carne de pollo, venta de flores, servicio de té y taller de soldadura, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de Burletes y Felpa; los burletes son cintas adhesivas que se colocan a las ventanas para proteger que no entre aire, polvo y ruido del exterior, “Los burletes son para aislar del aire y del frío, ayudan para que el aire no entre o salga de la casa enfriando los ambientes…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos, la desventaja es la falta de capital para invertir en su negocio. Su sueño es abrir un puesto de venta, ella desea realizar la compra de burletes de felpa por mayor para ofertar mayor cantidad a sus clientes. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de burletes de felpa por mayor para ofertar mayor cantidad y pagar los gastos escolares de su hijo.
texts.en:
Maria is a 37 year old woman, single, and has an 8-year-old son.  Her business is the sale of weather strips and plush cloth.

She is a good mother, enterprising, independent, active, consistent, responsible, and hard-working.  Her business is located in the southern region of the city, characterized by its intense economic activity and the establishment of the biggest markets with innumerable galleries and local markets.  It is a warm, sub-tropical climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 21-35 degrees Celsius.  

Maria has a dark complexion, brown eyes, long black hair that she wears tied behind the neck, short stature, and robust physical constitution.  Her mother tongue is Guarani, which she speaks with her family.  She also speaks Spanish for cultural and business reasons.  In the picture, she is the second from the left, wearing a light blue long-sleeved blouse and blue jeans.  She shares her life with her son who is in school.  They live in a rented room made of brick and cement with a tin roof and cement floor.  They have drinkable water, electricity, and a sewage system.  The necessity to improve her business brought her to lead a communal bank made up of people whose businesses include: transportation services, a welding workshop, a video store, tea service, and sales of flatware, cell phones, chickens, and flowers.  The group's purpose is to request a loan and expand their businesses.  

Her business is the sale of weather strips and plush cloth.  The weather strips are adhesive tapes that are placed on the windows to protect from drafts, dust, and noise from the exterior.  "The weather strips are to isolate the air and the cold, they help keep the air from entering or leaving the house, cooling the air inside," she says.  The advantage of her business is that she has ongoing customers; the disadvantage is the lack of capital to invest in her business.  Her dream is to open a stall.  She wants to purchase weather strips at wholesale to offer more to her customers.  This is the third cycle of loans with the institution in the years that she has developed this activity.

It is for these reasons that Maria requests a loan for the purchase of weather strips at wholesale, to offer greater quantity and to pay school fees for her son.

loans.use: to purchase weather strips at wholesale in order to offer greater quantity and to pay school fees for her son.

loans.name: Daizy

texts.en:
Daizy engages in selling dried fish to support her family. In addition to that, she also engages in a food vending business. She prepares and sells snack food like donuts and homemade meals to the locals. She is 27 years old with four dependents. Her oldest child is 9 and the youngest is 2. She needs capital to support her livelihood. Together with her family, she lives in Antequera, Bohol.

She is asking for a loan to purchase additional stocks like flour, meat, onion, flour, oil and vegetables. These ingredients will be used to produce more food to sell and enable her to augment her income. She could then provide her children with nutritious diets and better living conditions.

Daizy hopes that she can be successful in managing her sources of income to become sustainable and that she is able to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase flour, meat, onion, flour, oil and vegetables.
